children.definition: frighten in turn, App. BC 3.91, Onos. 29.2.
flow down, drip in turn, Olymp. in Mete. 80.36, al., Steph. in Hp. 1.130D., al.; run back again, Gal. 8.285.
establish instead, D.H. 1.5.
πολλὰ τῶν ἀδίκων J. AJ 16.7.1.
prepare in opposition, D.C. 49.37, 77.15.
being confronted with one another, Plb. 4.47.4; opposition, J. AJ 16.2.5; λόγοι ἐξ ἀντικαταστάσεως γενόμενοι Decr.ib. 14.10.21, cf. SIG 785.7 ( Chios).
to encamp opposite, D.H. 8.84.
holding in by force, τοῦ πνεύματος Arist. Pr. 961b22.
counter-extension, Hp. Art. 72.

children.label: II
children.definition: confronting, πρός τινα BGU 1138.3 (i B. C.), POxy. 260.10 (i A. D.).
make counter-extension, Hp. Fract. 14, Art. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἂν ἀντικατατείναντες λέγωμεν αὐτῷ λόγον παρὰ λόγον if we speak setting speech directly in contrast with speech against him, Pl. R. 348a, cf. Plu. QConv. 2.669e.
overrun in turn, D.C. 60.9.
to be carried down again, Gal. 17(2).57.
despise in turn, τινός D.C. 54.33.
plant instead, ἕτερα ἀντὶ τῶν ἐκλειπόντων [δένδρων] BGU 1120.33 (i B. C.).
replacement, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.10.14.
hold fast on the other side, Hp. Art. 74.
occupy incongruous position, τοὺς οἴκους ἢ τὰ ὑψώματα Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).115.
accuse in turn, recriminate upon, τινός Gorg. Pal. 27, Lys. 6.42, Aeschin. 1.178:—in Pass., D.C. 36.40.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., in Logic, to be convertible, ἀ. τοῦ πράγματος Arist. Top. 102a19, al.; reciprocate, of cause and effect, Id. APo. 73a16, cf. 78a28.
contradictory, sermo (i.e. λόγος) Gal. Subf.Emp. 12 p. 65 Bonnet.
countercharge, Quint. Inst. 3.10.4.

definition: ἀντικάτημαι, ἀντικατίζομαι, ἀντικατίστημι, Ion. for ἀντικάθ-.

children.definition: slip down correspondingly, Paul.Aeg. 6.65.
Anticato, name of a book written by Caesar in reply to the Cato of Cicero, Plu. Caes. 54, App. BC 2.99.

definition: ἀντίκειμαι, 3 pl. ἀντικέαται Archyt. ap. Stob. 2.2.4, used as Pass. of ἀντιτίθημι:—

children.definition: to be set over against, correspond with, τιμὰ ἀγαθοῖσιν ἀ. is held out to them as a fitting reward, Pi. I. 7(6).26:— ἀντικείμενος, ὁ, name of a bandage, Sor. Fasc. 12.515C.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be opposite to, of places, τινός Hp. Aër. 4; τινί Str. 2.5.15; of things, to be opposite or opposed, πρὸς ἄλληλα Pl. Sph. 258b; ἀ. κατὰ διάμετρον in a circle, Arist. Cael. 277a23, al. Adv. -μένως, συνέστηκεν PA 654a11.

to be opposed, in various ways, Cat. 11b17, Metaph. 1055a38, al.; in Logic, αἱ -κειμέναι προτάσεις APr. 63b24, al. Adv. ἀντικειμένως Metaph. 1054b15, etc.; propositions are opposed either contradictorily ( ἀντιφατικῶς) or contrarily ( ἐναντίως), Int. 17b16; ἀντικείμενα defined as ὧν τὸ ἕτερον τοῦ ἑτέρου ἀποφάσει πλεονάζει Stoic. 2.70, cf. 82, al.

data.quote: ὧν τὸ ἕτερον τοῦ ἑτέρου ἀποφάσει πλεονάζει

children.definition: ἀντικειμένη [λέξις] antithetical, Arist. Rh. 1409b35; ἀντικειμένως εἰπεῖν ib. 1401a5, cf. 1410b29; ἀντικείμενα κῶλα Demetr. Eloc. 22.

children.label: III
children.definition: resist, be adverse, ἀντικείσομαι τοῖς ἀντικειμένοις σοι LXX Ex. 23.22, cf. Is. 66.6, al., Ev.Luc. 13.17, al.; to be hurtful, τοῖς σώμασι Procop.Gaz. Ep. 27.
pursuing an opposite path, φάος Man. 4.74; simply, opposite, τοῖχος Nonn. D. 8.191: c. gen., Καρκίνος ἀ. Αἰγοκερῆος 2.658.

children.label: II
children.definition: opposing, hostile, αἰχμή 2.459, cf. 23.35, al.
bid, command in turn, Th. 1.128: Pass., to be bidden to do a thing in turn, ib. 139.
that which acts as a goad, A. Eu. 136, 466.
back of the head, Lyd. Mens. 4.54, Hippiatr. 115.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., κροκοδείλους -κεφάλους αὑτοῖς back to back, PMag.Par. 1.2954.
mind, tend instead of another, τινός E. Ion 734:—also ἀντικήδομαι, Poll. 5.142.
deputy-herald, IG 3.1295.
proclaim in answer to, οὐδὲν ἀντεκήρυξεν λόγοις E. Supp. 673; in opposition to, τινί Lib. Decl. 39.45.
move in opposition, Arist. Mem. 453 a26, cf. Ph. 2.22:— Med. or Pass., ἀνάγκη τὸ κινοῦν ἀντικινεῖσθαι must suffer a counter-movement, Arist. Ph. 257b23, cf. GA 768b10, Cael. 272b4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. also, make counter-movements, πρὸς πᾶν Plb. 2.66.3; σφοδρότερον -ηθῆναι retaliate more ruthlessly, Chor. p.226B [35.2.80 ἂν κινηθῆναι Τ. -HD].
contrary motion, Corp.Herm. 2.6, Simp. in Ph. 677.20, Id. in Cael. 366.8, 395.29.
moved in return, Phlp. in Ph. 355.15.
encounter, only aor. Med. ἀντικ[ι]χομένην BGU 1024vii29 (iv/v A. D.).
sound by striking against, κραυγὴ . . πέτραισιν ἀντέκλαγξʼ is echoed by them, E. Andr. 1145.
ἀ. ἀλλήλαις μέλος sing against one another, Id. Ba. 1057.
weep in return, Hdt. 3.14 (v.l. ἀνέκλαιον), Eust. 37.14.
bend back, Sch. Opp. H. 1.152.
to be enclosed, εἰς τὴν κοιλότητα Ruf. Oss. 32.
false key, Poll. 10.22, Palch. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.97.13:—also ἀντί-κλειθρον, τό, Gloss.
calling upon, summoning in return, Jul. Ep. 192.
turn or bend again, Musae. 107.
alternative inflexion, Sch. Opp. H. 1.59.
strike on the shin, S.E. M. 1.217 (s.v.l.).
part of the leg in front of the κνήμη ( τῆς κνήμης τὸ πρόσθεν Arist. HA 494a6; but τὸ ὄπισθεν Sch. Ar. Pl. 784), shin, Hippon. 49, Hp. Fract. 18, Ar. Ach. 219, Eq. 907.
hollow of the instep, dub. l. in Polem.Phgn. 85.
punish in return, Luc. Tyr. 12 ( Pass.).
flatter in turn, Plu. Alc. 24.
bring back as an answer, λόγον Plu. Lys. 26:— Med., receive in exchange, J. BJ 2.8.4, App. BC 4.70.
boast in opposition, τινί Plu. Ant. 62.
support with a pole or stick, ξύλῳ ἀ. τῷ σώματι Hp. Mochl. 20 ( ἀντικονταίνουσι prob.l. for -κοταίνουσι Erot., -κοτέουσι or -κοντέουσι codd.).—But -όω is confirmed by ἀντικόντωσις (sq.).

senses.definition: the support of a stick to a lame man, Hp. Art. 52, 58.

children.definition: beating back, hindrance, check, Epicur. Ep. 1p.10U.; resistance, Id. Nat.Herc. 908.4; προσκρούσει καὶ ἀ. Plu. Profect. 2.77a; clashing, of streams meeting, Str. 5.2.5.
resisting, repellent. S.E. M. 10.137.
cut down mutually, ἀλλήλους D.C. 43.37 (nisi leg. ἀνακ-).

children.label: II
children.definition: beat back, resist,

ὁκόταν νέφεα . . ἀντικόψῃ πνεῦμα ἐναντίον Hp. Aër. 8: abs., ὅταν πνεῦμα ἀντικόπτῃ νότιον Arist. HA 599a1, cf. PA 642b1; check growth, ὅταν ἀντικόψῃ ὁ χειμών Thphr. CP 1.12.6, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.11U., al.:—in Pass., meet with resistance, Id. Nat.Herc. 908.2; ἀ, ἀλλήλοις, of winds, Thphr. Vent. 53.
ὁ δὲ Θηραμένης ἀντέκοπτε λέγων . . X. HG 2.3.15, cf. Aristid. Or. 43(1).10: c. dat, Phld. Vit. pp 9, 25J.
ἤν τι ἀντικόψῃ if there be any hindrance, X. HG 2.3.31; ἡ πυκνότης ἀ. πρὸς τοῦτο militates against this, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1055.18.
take arms against, ἀνέμοις AP 7.668 ( Leon.), Ath. 15.701b.
arrange in turn, Plu. Praec. 2.813d.
adorn in turn, ib. Vit. aer. al. 828a :— Pass., Aristid. Or. 25 ( 43). 33:— Subst. ἀντικόσμ-ησις, εως, ἡ, Suid.
deputy- κοσμητής (signf. I.2), IG 3.1120, al.:— hence ἀντικοσμ-ητεύω, discharge this office, ib. 1126.
obstrigillo, obtrecto, officio, Gloss.:—also ἀντικότ-ησις· offensio, ib.
opposition, ἀνέμων Thphr. Vent. 55.
to shout in return, πολλὰ βλάσφημά τισι J. BJ 6.2.3.
hold, have instead of something else, AP 11.298.
judge in turn, τινά Aristid. Or. 34650). 40; compare, match, τί τινι Ael. NA 5.56, al.:— Pass., πρός τι 2.43, al.:— Med., contend against, LXX Jb. 9.32, 11.3.
counter-ram, Aen.Tact. 22.7.
Anaxil. 41, Poll. 4.113.
abrupt close, in a rhetorical period, Arist. Rh. 1409b22; hindrance, check, Plu. QConv. 2.721b; dub. sens. in Aeschin. 1.168, perh. repartee.
offensio, Gloss.

definition: ἀντικρουστία, ἡ, dub. sens. in Phld. Po. 1677.23.

children.definition: strike or clash against, come into collision,
ὀλίγα . . τὰ ἀντικρούοντα αὐτοῖς Arist. Cael. 313b2: abs., Id. PA 642a36, al., cf. Pl. Lg. 857c; ἀσπὶς ἀσπίδι Lib. Decl. 37.8.

αὐτοῖς . . τοῦτο ἀντεκεκρούκει had been a hindrance to them, had counteracted them, Th. 6.46; ἀ. τοῖς λογισμοῖς J. AJ 2.4.3; ἀ. ταῖς συμβουλίαις Plu. Ages. 7; ἀ. πρός τι Id. Cat.Ma. 24: abs., prove a hindrance, offer resistance, ἀντέκρουσέ τι καὶ γέγονʼ οἷον οὐκ ἔδει D. 18.198; ἐαν ἀντικρούσῃ τις Arist. Rh. 1379a12; ἀντέκρουον αἱ γυναῖκες Pol. 1270a7.

data.quote: ἀντέκρουσέ τι καὶ γέγονʼ οἷον οὐκ ἔδει

children.definition: over against, right opposite, θεοῖς ἀντικρὺ μάχεσθαι Il. 5.130: c. gen., Ἕκτορος ἀντικρύ ib. 8.301.

children.label: II
children.definition: straight on, right on, ἀντικρὺ δόρυ χάλκεον ἐξεπέρησεν Od. 10.162; ἀντικρὺ μεμαώς Il. 13.137: mostly followed by a Prep., ἀντικρὺ δʼ ἀνʼ ὀδόντας 5.74; ἀντικρὺ διʼ ὤμου 4.481, cf. Od. 22.16; ἀντικρὺ κατὰ μέσσον right in the middle, Il. 16.285; once in X., ἀντικρὺ διᾴττων Cyr. 7.1.30; cf. καταντῑκρύ.

outright, utterly, quite, ἀντικρὺ δʼ ἀπόφημι Il. 7.362; ἀντικρὺ δʼ ἀπάραξε 16.116; ἀντικρὺ μακάρεσσιν ἔϊκτο A.R. 4.1612, etc. (Cf. ἄντικρυς sub fin.) [ ῡ generally, but ῠ Il. 5.130, 819; ῐ by nature (cf. καταντῐκρύ Ar. Ec. 87), ῑ by position in Ep.]
straight on, right on, ἄντικρυς ἰὼν παρεκαθέζετο ἐκ δεξιᾶς he came straight up and . ., Pl. Euthd. 273b, cf. Ar. Lys. 1068, Th. 2.4; also εἰς τὸ ἀ. πορεύεσθαι Pl. Smp. 223b.

outright, openly, without disguise, ὅπως ἄ. τάδʼ αἰνέσω A. Ch. 192; ὁ χρησμὸς ἄ. λέγει Ar. Eq. 128; εὔχονταί γε πλουτεῖν ἄ. Id. Pl. 134; ἄ. ἔφη χρῆναι πλεῖν Th. 6.49; ἃ ἠδικοῦντο οὐ δηλοῦντες ἄντικρυς Id. 5.30; οὐδὲν ἢ ἄ. δουλείαν downright slavery, Id. 1.122; ἡ ἄ. ἐλευθερία Id. 8.64; οὐκ ἄ. not at all, οὐ διοίσοντʼ ἄ. τῶν Ἡρακλειδῶν Ar. Pl. 384.
straightway, συλλαβόντες ἄγουσιν ἄ. ὡς ἀποκτενοῦντες Lys. 13.78, cf. Men. Pk. 38, Pl. Ax 367a.

children.label: II
children.definition: opposite, ἄ. εῖναι to oppose, Arist. EE 1243a37; ἄ. ἐπιέναι against, D.H. 3.24; καταστῆναι Plu. Sol. 27; κατακλιθῆναί τινος LXX 3 Ma. 5.16; ἐν τῇ ἄ. πυαλίδι CIG (add.) 4224e ( Cragus): c. gen., ἄ. Χίου Act.Ap. 20.15, cf. PTeb. 395.4 (ii A.D.), etc.—Gramm. distinguish ἀντικρύ, = ἐξ ἐναντίας, and ἄντικρυς, = φανερῶς, διαρρήδην, cf. AB 408, but ἀντικρύ (q.v.) has both senses in Hom. ( -κρυ ( ς) prob. akin to κέρας, κάρα.)

definition: ἀντικρύσιον, dub. sens., Theognost. Can. 125.2 (from ἄντικρυς).

children.definition: acquisition of one thing for another, ἀδελφοῦ ἀ. οὐκ ἔστιν Plu. Frat. 2.481e.
in requital for murder, ἀντικτόνοις ποιναῖσι . . πατρός A. Eu. 464.
ring in response, AP 14.10.3; clash against, τινί APl. 16.221 ( Theaet.): abs., Procop. Goth. 2.23.
praise in turn, Them. Or. 4.57d.
boil with conflicting waves, dash hither and thither, Plu. 2.897c; of wind in a cul-de-sac, surge back, Orib. 9.20.3.
surge against, Procop. Aed. 4.8.

definition: ἀντικύπριος, sc. πούς, the foot - ⏑ - - ⏑, Diom. 1.482K.

children.definition: occur, crop up, τὰς ἀντικυπτούσας χρείας Ascl. Tact. 12.10 (fort. ἀνα-).
hellebore, Suid.:—also ἀντικύρικον· ὁ ἐλλέβορος, Hsch. (From the place-name Ἀντικύρα.)
hit upon, encounter, meet, τινί Pi. O. 12.12, S. OC 99, etc.: abs., Id. Ph. 545.
hinder by resisting, Hp. Loc.Hom. 10:—hence ἀντι-ῡτέον, Gal. 18(2).390.
celebrate by a festival in turn, Sch. Pi. P. 9.156.
ridicule in turn, Plu. Flam. 9, (Max.Tyr. 9.3.
Hsch.
thing to hold by, handle, ὅπως ἂν . . μὴ ἔχοι ἀντιλαβὴν ἡ χείρ Th. 7.65; of a shield, οὔτε πόρπακας οὔτʼ ἀντιλαβὰς ἔχει Str. 3.3.6.

data.quote: ὅπως ἂν . . μὴ ἔχοι ἀντιλαβὴν ἡ χείρ

children.definition: grip, of a dog, Ael. NA 8.1.
πολλὰς . . ἔχει ὑποψίας καὶ ἀντιλαβάς gives many handles against one, points of attack, Pl. Phd. 84c; so ἀ. διδόναι D.H. Rh. 8.15; παρέχεσθαι Luc. Tim. 20.
division of a line between two speakers, Hsch.
apprehension. Dam. Pr. 6.
move for a rehearing of a suit, when the case had gone by default, ἀ. δίαιταν Id. 21.86; ἀ. τὴν μὴ οὖσαν (sc. δίαιταν) ib. 90, cf. Poll. 8.61, Hsch.; τὴν ἔρημον (sc. δίκην) ἀ. D. 32.27.

children.label: II
children.definition: enter an exceptive plea, οἱ νόμοι διδόασι τὰς παραγραφὰς ἀντιλαγχάνειν Id. 37.33.

data.quote: οἱ νόμοι διδόασι τὰς παραγραφὰς ἀντιλαγχάνειν

children.label: III
children.definition: bring counteraction, Procop. Arc. 17.

definition: ἀντιλάζομαι or ἀντιλάζ-ῠμαι, poet. and Dor. Prose for ἀντιλαμβάνομαι,

children.definition: take hold of, hold by, c. gen., E. IA 1227; πραγμάτων Theag. ap. Stob. 3.1.67, cf. Archyt. ib. 117; take a share of, partake in, πόνων E. Or. 452, etc.
to receive in turn, to be repaid, ἀντιλάζυται . . τοιάδʼ ἃν τοκεῦσι δῷ Id. Supp. 363. ( -λάζυμαι l.c., Or. 753, IA 1109; -λάζομαι ib. 1227, Or. 452 ( -λάζου); both forms in codd. Med. 1216)
kick against, τινί Ar. Pax 613; τῷνῷ Phld. Rh.Supp. p.52S.
kick back in return, ὄνον Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10c.
answer in Laconian fashion, Eust. 1642.51.
speak against one, dub. in Men. Epit. 529, Sm. Ps. 138 (139).20.

receive instead of, χρυσοῦ δώματα πλήρη τᾶς ἥβας ἀ. E. HF 646 (lyr.); mostly without a gen., οὔτε κακοὺς εὖ δρῶν εὖ πάλιν ἀντιλάβοις receive in turn, Thgn. 108; κἂν . . ᾖ σώφρων . . σώφρονʼ ἀντιλήψεται E. Andr. 741; ἡδονὴν δόντας . . κακίαν . . ἀ. Th. 3.58; ἔρανον Arist. Pol. 1332b40; ἀ. ἄλλην [χώραν] seize in return, get instead, Th. 1.143; ἀ. ἄλλους τινάς X. Cyr. 5.3.12, cf. 8.7.16; χάριτα AP 6.191 (Longus).

data.quote: χρυσοῦ δώματα πλήρη τᾶς ἥβας ἀ.
οὔτε κακοὺς εὖ δρῶν εὖ πάλιν ἀντιλάβοις

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., with pf. Pass. -είλημμαι Lys. 28.15, Pl. Prm. 130e: c. gen., lay hold of, σαπροῦ πείσματος ἀντελάβου Thgn. 1362; ἄκρου τοῦ στύρακος ἀ. Pl. La. 184a, cf. Prt. 317d, al.; τῇ ἀριστερᾷ ἀ. τοῦ τρίβωνος ib. 335d; φιλίου χωρίου ἀ. gain or reach it, Th. 7.77, cf. Ar. Th. 242: abs., -όμενος Th. 3.22.

children.label: b
children.definition: lay hold of, τῆς σωτηρίας, τῆς ἐλευθερίας, τοῦ ἀσφαλοῦς, Id. 2.61, 62, 3.22; lay claim to, τοῦ θρόνου Ar. Ra. 777, 787; τοῦ πατρικοῦ μέρους BGU 648.10 (ii A.D.).

help, take part with, assist, οὐκ ἀντιλήψεσθʼ; E. Tr. 464; of persons, ἀ. Ἑλλήρων to take their part, D.S. 11.13; ἀ. τῶν ἀσθενούντων Act.Ap. 20.35, etc.: abs., Th. 7.70:— also in Pass., ἀντειλημμένη having received help, BGU 1105.21 (Aug.), al.

take part or share in a thing, take in hand, τῶν πραγμάτων X. Cyr. 2.3.6, D. 1.20, etc.; τοῦ πολέμου Isoc. 6.101; τῆς θαλάττης Plb. 1.39.14; τῆς Ἀφροδίτης Alex. 219.15; τῆς παιδείας Pl. R. 534d; ἀ. τοῦ λόγου seize on the conversation (to the interruption of the rest), ib. 336b: abs., ἀρχόμενοι πάντες ὀξύτερον ἀ. Th. 2.8, cf. 8.106.

take hold of for the purpose of finding fault, reprehend, attack, ἡμῶν Pl. Sph. 239d, cf. R. 497d, etc.; τοῦδε ἀντιλαβώμεθα let us attack the question, Id. Tht. 169d; ἀ. ὡς ἀδύνατον . . to object that . ., Id. Sph. 251b: abs., Id. Grg. 506a.
take fast hold of, i.e. captivate, ὁ λόγος ἀντιλαμβάνεταί μου Id. Phd. 88d, cf. Prm. 130e, Luc. Nigr. 19.
take hold, Thphr. HP 4.1.5; of scions, unite, CP 1.6.4.

grasp with the mind, perceive, apprehend, Pl. Ax. 370a; noted as an obsol, word for συνίημι by Luc. Sol. 7:—so of the senses, ἀ. κατὰ τὴν ἀκοήν, ὀσφρήσει, S.E. P. 1.50, 64, cf. Phot. p.148R., Alex.Aphr. in Top. 103.1, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med. also, hold back, ἵππου τῷ χαλινῷ X. Eq. 10.15, cf. Arist. MM 1188b6; interrupt, Arist. Aud. 802b26.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Act. in sense of Med., Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.38.
light up in turn, οἱ δʼ ἀντέλαμψαν (sc. οἱ φύλακες) A. Ag. 294.

children.label: II
children.definition: reflect light, shine, X. Cyn. 5.18; πρὸς τὴν σελήνην Plu. Arat. 21; of the rainbow, Anaxag. 19.
shine opposite to or in the face of, ὁ ἥλιος ἀ. τινί Plu. Mar. 26, etc., cf. Arr. Tact. 27.4: metaph., dazzle, τῷ ἀκροάτῃ λέξις ἀ. Plu. Aud. 2.41c.

children.label: III
children.definition: vie in brilliance with, τινί Philostr. Ep. 32.
reflection of light, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.930d, 931b.

definition: ἀντιλέγω, Hdt., Com., and Att. Prose (cf. ἀνταγορεύω): fut. ἀντιλέξω E. Hipp. 993, Ar. Ra. 998, Lys. 8.10 (but the common fut. is ἀντερῶ): aor. ἀντέλεξα S. OT 409, Ar. Nu. 1040 (but the aor. commonly used is ἀντεῖπον): pf. ἀντείρηκα: fut. Pass. ἀντειρήσομαι:—

children.definition: speak against, gainsay, contradict, τινί Th. 5.30, Pl. Smp. 216b, X. Mem. 4.6.13, etc.; περί τινος Th. 8.53, X. Mem. 4.4.8; ὑπὲρ τῶν δικαίων ib. 3.5.12; πρός τι 1.2.17; πρός πάντα τὰ δίκαια Ar. Nu. 888:—often folld. by a dependent clause, ἀ. ὡς . . declare in opposition or answer that . ., χρησμοῖσι οὐκ ἔχω ἀντιλέγειν ὡς οὐκ εἰσὶ ἀληθέες Hdt. 8.77, cf. Ar. Eq. 980, Th. 8.24, X. An. 2.3.25, etc.; οὐ τοῦτό γʼ ἀντιλέγουσιν, ὡς οὐ . . Arist. Pol. 1287b23; also ἀ. ὑπέρ τινος ὡς . . Th. 8.45: so c. inf., ἀ. ποιήσειν ταῦτα, ἤν . . to reply that they will . ., if . ., Id. 1.28; ἀ. μὴ κτεῖναι Μυτιληναίους Id. 3.41; ἀ. τὸ μὴ οὐ ἀξιοῦσθαί τινα X. Cyr. 2.2.20.

data.quote: χρησμοῖσι οὐκ ἔχω ἀντιλέγειν ὡς οὐκ εἰσὶ ἀληθέες
οὐ τοῦτό γʼ ἀντιλέγουσιν, ὡς οὐ . .
ἀ. τὸ μὴ οὐ ἀξιοῦσθαί τινα

children.definition: ἴσʼ ἀντιλέξαι S. OT 409; ἀ. τὸν ἐναντίον λόγον Lys. 8.11; μῦθον ἀ. τινί tell one tale in reply to another, Ar. Lys. 806; ἀντιλέγομεν πρᾶγμά τι Men. Epit. 8:— Pass., to be disputed, questioned, X. HG 6.5.37; of a place, ὑπό τινος ἀντιλεγόμενον counter-claimed, ib. 3.2.30; ἀντιλέγεσθαι μικρὸν πρός τινα περί τινος D. 27.15; τὰ ἀντιλεγόμενα points in dispute, Aeschin. 2.44; πρὸς τὰ ἀντειρημένα κτλ., title of work by Chrysippus, Stoic. 2.8; τόπος ἀντιλλεγόμενος (sic) IG 5(2).443.15 ( Megalopolis, ii B.C.): abs., -λέγεται περί τινος Str. 8.6.6; of the genuineness of literary works, to be disputed, Plu. VOrat. 2.839c.

data.quote: ἀντιλέγεσθαι μικρὸν πρός τινα περί τινος

children.definition: speak in opposition, Hdt. 9.42, E. Hipp. 993, Ar. Ra. 1076, etc.; ὁ ἀντιλέγων the opponent, Pl. Prt. 335a; οἱ ἀντιλέγοντες Th. 8.53; λαὸς ἀπειθῶν καὶ -λέγων LXX Is. 65.2.
render service in return, PPar. 63.183 (ii B.C.).
one must gainsay, οὐδὲν ἀ. E. Heracl. 975, cf. Hp. Ep. 27:— Adj. ἀντιλεκ-τέος, α, ον, Luc. Anach. 17.
questionable, to be disputed, ὅρος οὐκ ἀ. Th. 4.92.
answer, Hp. Decent. 12.
dialogue, ἀντιλέξεις τῶν ὑποκριτῶν, opp. μονῳδίαι, Philostr. VA 6.11.
contradiction, J. AJ 18.1.3.
chatter against, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.25.50.
lion-like, formed like ἀντίθεος, Ar. Eq. 1044; where, however, it is in fact a pr. n.
set off in accounts, deduct, POxy. 1577.11 (iii A.D.), cf. 1578.17 ( iii A.D., Pass.).
motion for a new trial, D. 39.38; cf. ἀντιλαγχάνω.
one must take part in a matter: abs., Ar. Pax 485; τῶν πραγμάτων αὐτοῖς ἀ. D. 1.2, cf. 14.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must hold back, ἀ. τοῦ ἵππου τῷ χαλινῷ X. Eq. 8.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adj. ἀντι-ληπτέος, α, ον, ὁ λόγος Plu. Nob. 3.

able to apprehend, λόγων Ti.Locr. 100c; χρωμάτων Phld. Herc. 19.18; δύναμις ἀ. πληγῆς ἀέρος Plu. Fort. 2.98b; ἀ. δύναμις, of the soul, Aristo Stoic. 1.86, cf. Stoic. 2.230; assisting a scion to unite, γλισχρότης Thphr. CP 1.6.4; of the hand, prehensile, Gal. UP 2.6. Adv. -κῶς, ἔχειν to be aware, apprehend, Hierocl. p.19A.
taking hold of, i.e. impressing itself upon the senses, φωνή Thphr. Fr. 89.3, cf. Cass. Pr. 35 ( Comp.); τὸ ἀ. Iamb. Comm.Math. 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: able to check, Pl. Def. 416a.
self-controlled, Ptol. Tetr 188.
which can be apprehended, τῇ ἁφῇ Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 201.4; τῇ ὄψει Phlp. in Ph. 417.16; τὰ -ληπτά objects of sense-perception, Plot. 4.5.8.
helper, protector, LXX 2 Ki. 22.3, BGU 1139.17 (i B.C.), Eustr. in APo. 93.19; θεοὶ ἀ. UPZ 14.18 (ii B.C.).
receiving in turn or exchange, Th. 1.120; counterclaim, X. HG 3.5.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med.) laying hold of in turn, reciprocation, Democr. ap. Arist. Fr. 208; of cultivated plants, giving a return, Thphr. CP 3.6.6; of a vine laying hold by its tendrils, ib. 2.18.2.

children.label: b
children.definition: taking in hand, τοῦ λ<ε>ιτουργήματος POxy 900.13 (iv A.D.).
hold, support, X. Eq. 5.7; of a bandage, Hp. Off. 9; ἀντίληψιν βοηθείας ἔχειν D.S. 1.30; ἀ. διδόναι τινί give one a handle, Plu. Sollert. 2.966e; ἀ. παρέχειν Luc. Anach. 2.
defence, succour, UPZ 42.38 (ii B.C.), PAmh. 35.58 (ii B.C.), BGU 1187.27 (i B.C.), LXX Ps. 21(22).20, al., 1 Ep.Cor. 12.28, Iamb. Myst. 7.3.
claim to a thing, X. HG 3.5.5.

objection, Pl. Phd. 87a, Sph. 241b, Hp.Ma. 287a, Plu. Alex. 18, Iamb. Myst. 1.1, al.: in forensic oratory, plea of justification, Hermog. Stat. 2, al., Syrian. in Hermog. 2p.79R.; discussion, θεολογικὴ ἀ. Iamb. Myst. 1.8.

grasping with the mind, apprehension, Epicur. Fr. 250, Stoic. 2.206, Diog.Oen. 4; φυσικὴν -ψιν ποιεῖσθαί τινος D.S. 3.15; οὐκ ἐπιστρέφει τὴν ἀ. does not attract the attention, [ Longin.] Rh. p.190H.; of sensuous perception, Stoic. 2.230, Ti.Locr. 100b, Anon. in Tht. 59.48, Phld. Herc. 1003, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 91.5; ποιοτήτων Plu. QConv. 2.625b, cf. Metrod. 1.
seizure, attack, τῶν ἀκρωτηρίων Th. 2.49.
entreat in return, Plu. Col. 2.1117c.
upper edge of the ear, opp. προλόβιον, Gal. 14.701, Poll. 2.86.

definition: ἀντιλοβίς, ίδος, ἡ, = foreg., Ruf. Onom. 44.

children.definition: deny, S. Ant. 377 (lyr.).
Ar. Nu. 321, al.:—in Med., Democr. 85, Antipho Soph. 98.
Gal. 7.281, Hsch.

contradiction, controversy, ἀ. χρησμῶν πέρι λέγειν Hdt. 8.77; ἡμέας . . ἐς ἀ. παρέξομεν will offer ourselves to argue the point, Id. 9.87; ἐδόκεον ἀντιλογίης κυρήσειν expected to be allowed to argue it, ib. 88; εἰς -ίαν κατέστησαν Lys. Fr. 75.1; -ίας ἅπτεσθαι Pl. R. 454b; ἐς -ίαν τινί γενέσθαι Th. 1.73; ἀ. καί λοιδορία D. 40.32; ἀντιλογίαν ἔχει it is open to contradiction, Arist. Rh. 1418b25, cf. 1414b3: in pl., opposing arguments, Ar. Ra. 775; διʼ ἀντιλογιῶν καταλλαγῆναι Th. 4.59; ἀ. πρός τινα X. HG 6.3.20; ἐς -ίαν ἐλθεῖν Th. 1.31; ἀντιλογίαν ἐν αὑτῷ ἔχειν to have grounds for defence in itself, Id. 2.87; ἄνευ -ίας without dispute, BGU 1133.15 (Aug.), etc.
quarrel, dispute, PPetr. 2p.56 (iii B.C.), PGrenf. 1.38.8 (ii/i B.C.), Ep.Hebr. 12.3, etc.
right, claim, τοῦ αὐτοῦ λάκκου POxy. 1892 (vi A. D.).
count up or calculate on the other hand, Antipho 2.2.8; ἀ. ὅτι . . X. HG 6.5.24. ( Act. dub. in Phld. D. 1.21 ( ἀντιλογικῶν Diels).)

given to contradiction, disputatious, Ar. Nu. 1173, Isoc. 15.48, Ph. 1.412, Sor. 1.14, Pl. Tht. 197a, al.: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of disputation, Id. R. 454a, Phdr. 261d; τὸ -κόν Id. Sph. 225b: οἱ -κοί persons skilled in this art, Id. Ly. 216a, Phd. 101e; of arguments, οἱ περὶ τοὺς ἀντιλογικοὺς λόγους διατρίψαντες ib. 90c: [ λόγοι] -κοί, οἱ, title of work by Protagoras, D.L. 3.37. Adv. -κῶς in the manner of such disputants, Pl. Tht. 164c.

data.quote: οἱ περὶ τοὺς ἀντιλογικοὺς λόγους διατρίψαντες ib.

children.definition: countercharge, Philostr. VS 2.1.4.
contradictory, reverse, τύχαι E. Hel. 1142 (lyr.); φιλονεικίαι love of contradiction, Simp. in Ph. 1135.28, cf. Epicur. Nat. 28 Fr. 8.
rail at or abuse in turn, PPetr. 3p.48 (iii B.C.), Plu. Util. 2.88f ( Pass.), 1 Ep.Pet. 2.23:— Med., c. acc. rei, Luc. Symp. 40.

definition: ἀντίλοξος, η, ον (or ος, ον), name of a

children.definition: bandage, Sor. Fasc. 12.512, cf. 516C.
lay counter-ambush, Ph. 1.664 (s.v.l.).
vex in return, Plu. Demetr. 22, Luc. DMeretr. 3.3, 12.5.
vexing in return, Arist. de An. 403a30, Plu. Virt.mor. 2.442b.
responsive to the lyre or like that of the lyre (Sch.), καναχά, of the flute, S. Tr. 643.
ransom, 1 Ep.Ti. 2.6.
antidote, remedy, Orph. L. 593.
one must ransom in return, Arist. EN 1164b35.
maltreat in return, Eust. 757.59 ( Pass.).
to be filled with passion for a lover in return, Luc. DMeretr. 12.2.
rage against, βρονταῖς Διός APl. 16.30 ( Gem.).
learn in turn or instead, Ar. V. 1453.
divine, predict. in reply, Them. Or. 13.163a.

appear as witness against, Ar. Fr. 437; contradict, τινί Plu. Def.orac. 2.418a; opp. συμφωνεῖν, Polystr. p.10W.; esp. in Epicurus’ Logic, disprove by fact or experience, Ep. 1p.10U., al.; so ἀ. πρὸς τὴν αἴσθησιν Plu. Virt.mor. 2.447c: abs., Id. Alc. 21, cf. Gal. 4.735: c. acc., ἀ. τὰ εἰρημένα Plot. 6.4.4:— Pass., to be disproved, invalidated, Epicur. Ep. 1p.11U., al.
counter evidence, Ep. Fr. 247: in pl., Id. Nat. 28 Fr. 7, Plu. Col. 2.1121e.
protest on the other hand, Luc. Symp. 47.
resist by force of arms, D.S. 23.7.
resist, demur, AB 184.
conflict, struggle, ἐπʼ ἀλλήλοις D.H. 8.58.
fight against one, Th. 4.68: abs., D.S. 22.10.
capable of meeting in war, τινί App. Hisp. 9.
vie in pride or boasting with, τινί Eust. 676.5.
drag different ways, distract, τὰ -οντα πράγματα Ph. 1.231, cf. APl. 16.136 ( Antiphil.), 139 ( Jul.Aegypt.), in Pass.; τῇ καὶ τῇ AP 10.74 ( Paul.Sil.).
reciprocal participation, Simp. in Ph. 101 18.
move from one side to the other, revolutionize, ψηφίσματα καὶ νόμον Ar. Th. 362.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 and pf. Act., exchange places, ἀ. ἀλλήλοις τό τε ὕδωρ καὶ ὁ ἀήρ Arist. Ph. 209b25, cf. 211b27, Mete. 366b20; ἀλλήλαις Jul. Or. 8.241a.

data.quote: ἀ. ἀλλήλοις τό τε ὕδωρ καὶ ὁ ἀήρ

children.definition: make countermoves, Luc. Dem.Enc. 37.
behave petulantly in return, πρός τινα Plu. Sull. 6.
compete in music with, τινί AP 5.221 ( Agath.).
wait and watch against one, ἀντιμελλῆσαι Th. 3.12 (Sch. for ἀντεπι-).
blame in turn, retort upon one, ἀ. ὅτι . . Hdt. 2.133.
impart in turn, χάριν AP 6.209 (Antip. Thess.).
distinguish, Hsch.
rival claimant, τινῶν Jul. Gal. 148c.
to be in the opposite meridian, as the sun at midnight, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.284e, Ptol. Tetr. 33, Vett.Val. 116.5, al., Man. 4.613.
opposite meridian, S.E. M. 5.12, Ptol. Tetr. 201; name of the fourth τόπος in a ‘nativity’, Paul.Al. L. 3.
occupation of the opposite meridian, Heph.Astr. 1.2.
passover in turn, ἐπί τι Alex.Trall. 5.6.
meet one change with another, Hp. Acut. 26.
rowing up-stream, πρὸς τὸ ῥεῦμα τοῦ ποταμοῦ Plu. Fort.Rom. 2.319c.
resilient, Sor. 2.31.
transposition, as a figure of speech, as in ‘non ut edam vivo sed ut vivam edo’, Quint. Inst. 9.3.85, cf. Alex. Fig. 2.22, Phoeb. Fig. 2.4.
countermarch, λόχον Onos. 33.6; press in contrary direction, Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.8.20.
counterextension, τοῦ σώματος Orib. 49.9.3.
mutual contribution, Dam. Pr. 17.
interchange, προσώπων Longin. 26.1; of meanings, Alex. Fig. 2.22.
turn aside or the opposite way, Ph. 1.678.
assume in turn or in exchange, πρόσωπον Plu. An seni 2.785c; τὸν τόπον τινός Ascl. Tact. 10.15; ὥσπερ ἐκ κληρονομίας τὸ μῖσος J. AJ 16.3.1.
receive back in return, Phld. Oec. p.65J., cf. Piet. 113.
take arguments in reverse order, Dam. Pr. 350.

children.label: II
children.definition: use a form in place of another, A.D. Adv. 130.14:— Pass., 154.22, al.; also, to be changed, εἰς . . 130.11.
one must use instead, substitute, λέξεις ἀντὶ λέξεων Phld. Rh. 1.159S.
partaking of the opposite, Plu. Def.orac. 2.438d (fort. ἀντίληψις) ; ἀ. τῶν βίων experience of divers kinds of life, ib. Tranq. 466c.
double reflex movement, Hehod. ap. Orib. 8.28.28, 29.
interchange of forms, A.D. Adv. 155.1.
one must substitute, Thphr. Metaph. 16 codd.
countermine, Ph. Bel. 99.13, Plb. 1.42.12; τοῖς πολεμίοις 16.31.8.
flow off in turn or back, Placit. 4.22.2, but ἀντιμετερᾷ (cj. Bernardakis) is prob.
draw off in a different direction, εἰς φροντίδας J. AJ 13.5.3.
counter-change, reciprocal replacement, Arist. Ph. 208b2; reverse movement, εἰς τὸ ἀντίπαλον D.H. 3.19, Simp. in Ph. 1352.14.
interchange of gender, D.H. Amm. 2.10.
change the order of battle so as to meet the enemy, in Med., D.H. 3.25.
to be changed, replaced, J. AJ 16.7.6, cf. Numen. ap. Eus. PE 14.5.
go away to the other side, ταῖς ἐλπίσι make room for new hope, J. AJ 15.2.2.
interchange, of letters, etc., Eust. 1618.36.
to be unrolled in reverse direction, of cables, Orib. 49.22.14.
compete with others: οἱ ἀντιμετιόντες rival competitors, Plu. Comp.Arist.Cat. 2.
participate reciprocally, Dam. Pr. 14, 33, 65.
measure out in turn, give one thing as compensation for another, τί τινι Luc. Am. 19:— Pass., ἀντιμετρηθήσεται ὑμῖν it shall be measured in turn, Ev.Matt. 7.2, Ev.Luc. 6.38.

children.label: II
children.definition: correspond in ascension, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).187.
reciprocal measurement, Simp. in Ph. 733.29.
front to front, face to face, X. HG 4.3.19, Ages. 2.12, Hld. 9.16.
rage, be wrathful against, Ael. Fr. 205.
testify in return, BMus.Inscr. 4.481*.388 ( Ephesus, ii A. D.).
contrive against or in opposition, ἄλλα ἀ. Hdt. 8.52, cf. E. Ba. 291; σβεστήρια κωλύματα Th. 7.53: abs., Arist. HA 613b27; πρός τι X. HG 5.3.16.
counter-engine or device, μηχανήμασιν ἀ. εὐτρεπίζειν Polyaen. 4.2.20, cf. Ath.Mech. 9.1.
follow an example, App. BC 5.41, 94.
close imitation of a person in a thing, c. dupl. gen., Th. 7.67.

closely imitating, ἠχή, of an echo, Callistr. Stat. 9; τινός Alcid. ap. Arist. Rh. 1406a29; of man as a microcosm, ἀ. τῆς οὐρανίου τάξεως Ruf. Anat. 1; ἀ. οὐρανοῦ ποταμός Hld. 9.9, cf. Ph. 2.164, Sthenidas ap. Stob. 47.63: c. dat., ὀφθαλμὸν ἀ. ἡλίου τροχῷ Ar. Th. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dsc. 4.75; = ὠκιμοειδές, Ps.- Dsc. 4.28.
hate in return, Ar. Lys. 818.
requital, recompense, Ep.Rom. 1.27, 2 Ep.Cor. 6.13.
reward, Ps.-Callisth. 3.26.
as a reward, in compensation, μνήμην ἀντίμισθον ηὕρετʼ ἐν λιταῖς A. Supp. 270.
hired as a substitute, Hsch.
(mensa) table in a court of justice, Suid.
rival in love, D.S. 8.19.
in proportionate shares, D. 36.8.
receive a proportionate share, Poll. 4.176.
compensation, v.l. for ἀντιμοιρεί, D. 36.8.

definition: ἀντίμοιρος, ον, prob. for ἰσοτίμοιρος, A. Ch. 319.

children.definition: go to meet, Apollon. Lex. s.v. ἀντιβολῆσαι.
sounding instead of, ἀ. ὀλολυγῆς κωκυτός a shriek of far other note than the cry of joy, E. Med. 1176; ὕπνου τόδʼ ἀντίμολπον . . ἄκος song, sleepʼs substitute, A. Ag. 17.
corresponding, of stones in a building, IG 1.322.
formed after, corresponding to a thing, Luc. Am. 44. Adv. -φως, τινί Plu. Crass. 32.
low in answer, τινί D.H. 1.39.
roar against, ἀλλήλοις, of sea and lake, Procop. Aed. 4.8.
answer mockery, gladio Cic. Fam. 15.19.4.
Leg.Gort. 6.25.
build ships against, Th. 7.36, 62 ( Pass., as v.l.).
bestow in return, τὰν αὐτὰν χάριν Epigr.Gr. 205.
deputy- νεοποιός, Rev.Ét.Gr. 19.251 ( Aphrodisias).
swim against, πρὸς κῦμα Plu. Sollert. 2.979b.
conquer in turn, A. Ch. 499, cf. D.C. 48.21.
in honour of Antinous at Athens and Eleusis, IG 3.1129,1147 (ii A.D.).
disobey, θεοῖς Philostr. VA 6.20 (fort. ἀντινομ<οθετ>εῖν).
conflict of laws, Quint. Inst. 7.1.15, Hermog. Stat. 2, D. 22Arg.ii 12; ἐν ἀντινομίᾳ γίγνεσθαι to be in a strait between two laws, Plu. Caes. 13; ambiguity in the law, Id. QConv. 2.742a.

definition: ἀντινομίζομαι, Pass., νόμοι ἀντινομιζόμενοί τινος, prob. laws

children.definition: enacted against one, Archyt. ap. Stob. 4.1.132.
relating to ambiguity in the laws, Plu. QConv. 2.741d. Adv. -κῶς by citing a contrary law, D. 22Arg.ii24.
make laws in rivalry with, τινί Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1044c, etc.
opposite in character, resisting, τινί Hp. Epid. 6.5.4.
warn in return, Plu. Adul. 2.72e.
back to back, D.S. 2.54, Ael. Tact. 37.1, Arr. Tact. 29.1.
entertain in return, ξενισθεὶς μὴ -ίσαι Phld. Vit. p.30J., cf. Eust. 1961.37.

definition: ἀντιξηραίνω, prob. f.l. for ἀναξηραίνω, Gal. 18(2).804.

children.definition: set oneself against, oppose, Pi. O. 13.34.

definition: ἀντίξοος, ον, contr. ἀντί-ξους, ουν:— Ion. word,

children.definition: opposed to, adverse, ἐλπόμενοι οὐδέν σφι φανήσεσθαι ἀντίξοον Hdt. 7.218, cf. 6.50; τὸ . . τοῖσι Σκύθῃσι ἀ. 4.129; στρατὸν . . ἀ. Πέρσῃσι 6.7:—abs., ἐν μυρίῃσι γνώμῃσι μίαν οὐκ ἔχω ἀντίξοον 8.119; δοῦρα ἀ. γόμφοις A.R. 2.79; τὸ ἀντίξοον opposition, Hdt. 1.174; τὸ ἀ. συμφέρον Heraclit. 8; of diseases and remedies, Aret. SA 2.4, CA 2.1. Adv. ἀντιξόως in hostile spirit, Philostr. VA 7.36.

scrape in turn, ἀ. τὸν ξύοντα ‘claw me, claw thee’, Sophr. 149, Aristid. 2.84J.

definition: ἀντίον, τό, a part of the loom, Ar. Th. 822, cf. Poll. 7.36, 10.125.

children.definition: loom, ἀντίον ὑφαινόντων LXX 2 Ki. 21.19, al.

definition: ἀντιόομαι, fut. -ώσομαι Hdt. 7.9.γʹ, 102, al.: aor. Pass. ἠντιώθην, Ion. ἀντ- Id. 4.126, 7.9.α, al.:—

children.definition: resist, oppose, τινί Id. 1.76, A. Supp. 389, etc.; τινὶ ἐς μάχην Hdt. 7.102: abs., οἱ ἀντιούμενοι, = οἱ ἐναντίοι, Id. 1.207, 4.1.

Id. 9.7.β (dub.), c. acc., τὸν Πέρσην ἀντιώσεσθαι ἐς τὴν Βοιωτίην that ye would meet him in Boeotia. ( ἐναντ- is used in pure Att., ἀ. in Aen.Tact. 36.7. The Homeric forms ἀντιόω, ἀντιόωσι, etc., belong to ἀντιάω.)
set against, and so,

children.label: I
children.definition: face to face, opposite, ἀντίοι ἔσταν ἅπαντες Il. 1.535; ἀντίος ἦλθε θέων went to meet them, 6.54; ἡ δʼ οὐκ ἀθρῆσαι δύνατʼ ἀντίη though she faced him, Od. 19.478; esp. in battle, Il. 11.216, etc.: ἐχώρεον . . οἱ Πέρσαι ἀντίοι Hdt. 9.62; ἐκ τοῦ ἀντίου προσφέρεσθαι X. Cyr. 1.4.8; ἀντίος ἐλαύνειν ibid.; ἐκ τῆς ἀντίης προσπλέειν Hdt. 8.6; κατʼ ἀντίον Hp. VC 11:—freq. c. gen., which often precedes, Ἀγαμέμνονος ἀντίος ἐλθών Il. 11.231, cf. 5.301, 7.98; but also follows, ἀ. ἦλθεν ἄνακτος Od. 16.14, cf. Il. 17.31, etc.: less freq. in Hom. c. dat., ὅς ῥά οἱ ἀ. ἦλθε 15.584, cf. 7.20; but mostly so after Hom., ἀντίαι ἵζοντο τοῖσι Πέρσῃσι Hdt. 5.18, cf. Pi. N. 10.79, E. Supp. 667, X. An. 1.8.17, etc.; ἀ. ἐς . . h.Merc. 345; = διάμετρος, Man. 3.339.

data.quote: ἡ δʼ οὐκ ἀθρῆσαι δύνατʼ ἀντίη

children.label: b
children.definition: direct, opp. πλάγιος, Antyll. ap. Orib. 44.23.9, cf. Heliod.ib. 28.

opposite, contrary, τὸν ἀ. τοῖσδε λόγον A. Ag. 499; τούτοις ἀντία opinions opposed to these, E. Supp. 466; ἁδεῖα μὲν ἀντία δʼ οἴσω with pleasure [I speak], though I shall offer reproof, S. Tr. 122; οἱ ἀντίοι, = οἱ ἐναντίοι, Pi. P. 1.45 (so later, PTeb. 43.21 (ii B.C.)); εἰς τὸ ἀντίον X. Eq. 12.12; also λόγοι ἀντίοι ἢ οὓς ἤκουον words the very reverse of those I have heard, Id. An. 6.6.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. in neut. ἀντία and ἀντίον, against, over against, abs., ἀντίον ἷζεν Od. 14.79, cf. 17.334, etc.: more freq. like a Prep. c. gen., ἀντίʼ ἐμεῖο στήσεσθαι Il. 21.481; ἀντία δεσποίνης φάσθαι before her, Od. 15.377; so ἀντία σευ in thy presence, Hdt. 7.209, cf. 1.133; ἀντίον τοῦ μεγάρου facing it, Id. 5.77; τὰς καμήλους ἔταξε ἀντία τῆς ἵππου Id. 1.80, cf. 3.160, al.; τἀνδρὸς ἀντίον μολεῖν S. Tr. 785: so,

data.quote: τὰς καμήλους ἔταξε ἀντία τῆς ἵππου

children.definition: against, ὅς τις σέθεν ἀντίον εἴπῃ Il. 1.230; ἀντίον αὐτῶν φωνὴν ἱέναι Hdt. 2.2; ἐρίζειν ἀντία τοῖς ἀγαθοῖς Pi. P. 4.285: c. dat., ἰέναι ἀντία τοῖσι Πέρσῃσι ἐς μάχην Hdt. 7.236; ὕδωρ καπνῷ φέρειν ἀντίον Pi. N. 1.25.

data.quote: ἰέναι ἀντία τοῖσι Πέρσῃσι ἐς μάχην

children.definition: τὸν δʼ ἀντίον ηὔδα answered, Od. 15.48, etc. (more freq. in Od. than Il.).
ἀντία εἶναι to be present, help, of a god, Milet. 7p.64 (ii/iii A.D.).—The word is almost confined to Poets and Ion. Prose; in Att. Prose ἐναντίος is preferred, though X. uses ἀντίος.
to be contrary, of a wind, S. Ph. 640.
tonsillotome, Gal. 14.785, Hermes 38.281.
of Antiochus, τέτραχμον IG 11.203B40, 46 (iii B.C.).
Pass., contrario more futuo, AP 11.284 ( Pall.).

definition: ἀντιόω, ἀντιόωσα, etc., v. sub ἀντιάω.

children.definition: contend in the παγκράτιον, Sch. Philostr. Im. 2.6.
suffering instead, λυπεῖ τὸν στερόμενον τῶν ἀγαθῶν ἡ ἀ. κακῶν Pl. Ax. 370a.

data.quote: λυπεῖ τὸν στερόμενον τῶν ἀγαθῶν ἡ ἀ. κακῶν

children.label: II
children.definition: opposition, contrast, τῆς γῆς πρὸς τὴν αἰθέρα Plu. Frig. 2.952d.

children.label: III
children.definition: counteraction, antipathy, S.E. P. 1.43, Archig. ap. Philum. Ven. 14.4, Sor. 2.42.

children.label: IV
children.definition: opposed rhythms, ἡ κατʼ ἀντιπάθειαν μεῖξις Heph. 14, cf. Aristid.Quint. 1.28.

children.label: V
children.definition: contrary affection, Str. 3.5.7; περὶ συμπαθειῶν καὶ ἀντιπαθειῶν, title of work by Bolus, Suid. s.v. Βῶλος, etc.
have an aversion, Alex.Aphr. Pr.Prooem.
to be opposed, reversed in metric, as lambus or trochee, Sch.Heph.p.115C.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be affected, ὑπὸ τῶν ἔξωθεν A.D. Synt. 291.14.
to be affected in a contrary manner, τινί Plb. 34.9.5, cf. Str. 3.5.7.
in return for suffering, A. Eu. 782; felt mutually, ἡδονή Luc. Am. 27.
of opposite feelings or properties, δύναμις Plu. QConv. 2.664c; φύσιν ἔχειν ἀ. πρός τι ib. Fac.lun. 940a. Adv. -θῶς Gp. 5.11.4, Alex.Trall. 8.2.
opposed rhythms, Sch. Heph. p.122C., al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀντιπαθές, τό, remedy for suffering, Plu. Ant. 45, cf. ἀντίτομον· φάρμακον ἀντιπαθές, Hsch.; λίθος ἀντιπαθὴς καλούμενος Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 21.5:—name of a black kind of coral, Dsc. 5.122.
opposed to passivity, Sch. Opp. H. 1.653.
Hsch. s.v. μῶλυ.
teach as a rival master, τινί Suid. s.v. Γενέθλιος.
deputy- παιδονόμος, IG 12(2).259 (Mytil.).
play one with another, X. Cyn. 5.4, Pl. Erx. 395b.
like a child, γραῦς A. Eu. 38; little more than a child, θυγατρὸς ἀντίπαιδος E. Andr. 326; ἡλικία Luc. Am. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: instead of a boy, i.e. no longer e boy, S. Fr. 564 (s.v.l.).
Subst., a mere boy, Plb. 15.33.12, 27.15.4, D.H. 4.3, Plu. Aem. 22, Luc. Somn. 16, Ant.Lib. 13.5.
strike against, resist, τὸ ἀντιπαῖον Hp. VM 22, cf. Arist. Pr. 902b13: metaph., πρός τι Plb. 18.46.15; τινί Iambl. in Nic. p.22 P. : — Pass., ib. p. 24 P.
sing the battle song against, ἀλλήλοις Max.Tyr. 32.2 [26.2.g]. cf. Aen.Tact. 27.4 ( -παιαν-).
antagonist in wrestling, Ael. VH 4.15.
wrestle against, POxy. 1099, Sch. Ar. Ach. 570, Eustr. in EN 117.34.
rebound, Cass. Pr. 26, Eust. 948.12.

wrestling against: hence, antagonist, rival, κράτος ἀ. A. Pr. 528 (lyr.); ἀ. θεοῖς E. Ba. 544 (lyr.): c.gen., μένος γήραος ἀντίπαλον Pi. O. 8.71; γοητείας φάρμακον ἀ. AP 10.50 ( Pall.):— Subst. ἀντίπαλος, ὁ, antagonist, rival, adversary, Pi. N. 11.26, S. Ant. 126 (lyr.): mostly in pl., Hdt. 7.236, Ar. Ra. 365.1027, Pl. Alc. 1.119e, al.; cf. φθόνος πρὸς τὸ ἀ. Th. 2.45, etc.; ὁ δʼ ἦλθεν ἐπὶ τἀντίπαλον E. Ba. 278 (dub.).

nearly matched, nearly balanced, ἀπὸ ἀ. παρασκευῆς Th. 1.91; ἀ. τριήρης equally large, Id. 4.120; ἀ. τινι Id. 1.11, Pl. Mx. 240a; γνῶμαι μάλιστα ἀ. πρὸς ἀλλήλας Th. 3.49; ἀ. δέος fear caused by the balance of the power of the parties, mutual fear, ib. 11; ἀ. ποιναί adequate punishment, E. IT 446; ἤθεσιν ἀ. [τῇ πόλει] habits corresponding to . ., Th. 2.61; ὑμεναίων γόος ἀ. E. Alc. 922; ἀντίπαλόν τι τῆς ναυμαχίας a point where the action was evenly balanced, Th. 7.71, cf. 38, Lys. 2.38; ἀντίπαλα καταστῆσαι bring to a state of balance, Th. 4.117; εἰς ἀ. καταστῆναι to be in such state, Id. 7.13. Adv. -λως Id. 8.87: also neut. pl., ναυμαχήσαντες ἀντίπαλα Id. 7.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸν ἀμὸν ἀ. him who fights for me, my champion, A. Th. 417 (lyr.).
transgress, PLips. 298 (iii A.D.).

place side by side so as to compare or contrast, τι πρός τι Pl. Ap. 41b; λόγον παρὰ λόγον Hp.Mi. 369c, cf. Isoc. 5.142; τί τινι Arist. Fr. 91; βίον τινὸς καί τινος Plu. TG 1:— Pass., c. dat., measure oneself against, rival, App. BC 2.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: contribute instead, X. Lac. 5.3.
one must compare, prob. for -τόν in An.Ox. 3.216.
reply by comparison or contrast, Arist. Rh. 1414b10, 1419b34, Plu. Aud. 2.40f, Longin. Fr. 11, Ruf. ap. Orib. 49.30.9.
competition for a public office, Plu. Arat. 35.
give orders, command in turn. X. HG 4.2.19, D.C. 65.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: compete for a public office, Plu. Caes. 7; δημαρχίαν Id. Mar. 29; τινί with one, Id. Cat.Mi. 49.
counter-παραγραφή, perscriptio, replicatio, Gloss.
add or insert on the other side, Ptol. Geog. 8.1.3:— Med., as law-term, reply to a παραγραφή, remancipo, Gloss.
shift in order to meet attacks, τοὺς σάκκους J. BJ 3.7.20:— Pass., to be shifted in the other direction, Paul.Aeg. 6.3.
Pass., to be produced correspondingly, Plot. 2.4.11.
adduce, allege on the other side, Plu. QConv. 2.719c: abs., argue on the other side, Phld. Rh. 2.267S., cf. Vit. p.4J.

children.label: II
children.definition: lead an army against, advance to meet the enemy, X. Cyr. 1.6.43.
march parallel with, skirt, ταῖς ὑπωρείαις Plb. 1.77.2, cf. 3.53.4.
flank march, Plb. 9.3.10 (pl.), 11.18.2, Plu. Pyrrh. 21.
machinations, UPZ 20.44 (ii B.C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: hostility, πρός τινα Plb. 10.37.2, al.
admit instead or in place of, A.D. Synt. 108.13.
receive in turn, BGU 977.15 (ii A.D.); dub. sens. in Ph. 2.508.
deliver up in turn, τὴν ἀρχήν τινι J. AJ 15.3.1, cf. PFlor. 384.74 (v A.D.).
mutual accommodation, of heavenly bodies, Vett.Val. 162.31.
comparison, contrast, J. Ap. 2.33, A.D. Synt. 49.21, al., Herm. in Phdr. p.183 A.
outflank, X. An. 4.8.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: run parallel to a thing, Plot. 6.5.11.
advise contrariwise, c. inf., D.C. 65.11.
deprecate in answer, A.D. Synt. 296.18.
summon in turn or contrariwise, ἐπὶ ἀληθεστέραν γε σωτηρίαν Th. 6.86, cf. X. Cyr. 2.2.24, Pl. Grg. 526e; ὑπέρ τινος change oneʼs attitude and petition, J. BJ 1.25.5.
lie just opposite, τινί Plb. 3.37.7.
correspond with, to be correlative to, τινί A.D. Adv. 155.1, al.; to be opposed, Synt. 118.23 (2,2,166 Uhlig).
exhort in turn or contrariwise, τοῖς πρεσβυτέροις μὴ καταισχυνθῆναι Th. 6.13, cf. X. Cyr. 3.3.42 and 59.
mutual exhortation, Plb. 11.12.2.
comparison, Diog.Oen. 38 (dub. rest.).
compare by contrasting, Gal. 14.221.

children.label: II
children.definition: take a function in exchange, Vett.Val. 174.7.
pass from side to side, χεῖρας περὶ τὸ στέρνον Sor. 1.103.
annoy in turn, Th. 4.80.
to be cheered on oneʼs way [to death] by the remembrance, Plu. Suav. 2.1099d.
set up as a standard of comparison or reference, A.D. Synt. 37.22 ( Pass.).
sail along on the other side, Th. 2.83.
march on the flank, ταῖς χώραις Plb. 5.7.11.
prepare oneself in turn, arm on both sides, Th. 1.80, D. 10.29, etc.; ἀ. ἀλλήλοις ὡς ἐς μάχην Th. 7.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., instigate in return, τινὰ ἐναντιωθῆναί σφισι D.C. 38.14.
hostile preparation, Th. 1.141.

definition: ἀντιπαράστασις, εως, ἡ, as a figure of speech,

children.definition: counter-objection, rejoinder, retort, Hermog. Stat. 3, al., Aps. p.270 H., Olymp. in Cat. 78.26, Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 518.28; indirect reply, Procl. in Alc. p.303C.:— Adj. ἀντιπαρα-στᾰτικός, ή, όν, Hermog. Inv. 3.6. Adv. -κῶς ibid., Eust. 704.36.
encamp opposite, D.H. 8.25.
hostile demonstration, ἀντιπαρατάξεις κατὰ τὴν ἀγοράν D.H. 6.22; ἀ. τῆς γνώμης stubborn determination to resist, J. AJ 18.8.5.

definition: ἀντιπαρατάσσομαι, Att. ἀντιπαρατάττομαι, Med. and Pass.,

children.definition: stand in array against, ἀλλήλοις Th. 6.98, cf. X. HG 1.3.5; ἀντιπαρατεταγμένους πρὸς τὴν τούτων ἀσέλγειαν Aeschin. 3.257: metaph., hold oneʼs ground against, Epicur. Fr. 138: abs., stand in hostile array, Th. 1.63; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἀντιπαραταχθέντος in hostile array, Id. 5.9; in a Com. metaph., ἡ δημιουργὸς ἀντιπαρατεταγμένη κρεάδιʼ ὀπτᾷ Men. 518.12; λίαν -τεταγμένοι, of a hostile audience, Corn. Rh. p.360H.: c. acc., ἀντιπαρετάξαντο φάλαγγα X. An. 4.8.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., = Med., is dub. l. in Plb. 9.26.4.
stretch side by side so as to compare or contrast, ἄλλον [λόγον] πρὸς αὐτὸν ἀ. Pl. Phdr. 257c.
extend beside, Anon. Geog.Comp. 7; and Pass. in same sense, ib. 21.
contrast and compare, τὰς ἄλλας νύκτας ταύτῃ ἀ. Pl. Ap. 40d, cf. Men. 325.15, Phld. Po. 2.28, Hom. p.12O., Jul. Gal. 99d.
yield, give up in turn, τινὰ ἀλλήλοις Phlp. in Ph. 553.20; give place in turn, ἀλλήλοις Gal. 19.474: Astrol., yield to adverse influence, Vett.Val. 125.10; return a pledge, BGU 1158.6 (i B.C.).
making way for each other, Simp. in Cael. 459.16; mutual concession, Eust. 445.11: Astrol., yielding to adverse influence, Vett.Val. 274.19.
march on opposite sides of a river or entrenchments, X. An. 4.3.17, HG 5.4.38.
introduction of a second soul, Plot. 2.9.5 (as v.l.).
interpenetration of two or more bodies in κρᾶσις, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.153.
to be reciprocally interpenetrated, τὰ ἀλλήλοις διʼ ὁλων -όμενα Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.154:—also Act., [ αἱ ψυχαὶ] διʼ ὅλων τῶν σωμάτων -ουσιν Id.ib. 153.
Act., extend in line with, τῷ τείχει τὸ ἱππικόν J. BJ 3.7.24.
Pass., extend in the contrary direction, Iamb. in Nic. p.13P.
lead on against the enemy, τὴν δύναμιν, τὸν ἵππον, Plu. Luc. 27, Pyrrh. 16: metaph., cite an authority in contradiction of another, Gal. 8.715; incite to rivalry, Them. Or. 22.275d.
bring into action as an enemy, τὸν θεόν J. AJ 18.8.1.
στρατόν) march against, Philipp. ap. D. 18.39: metaph., adduce arguments against, [ τοῖς ποιηταῖς] D.Chr. 7.98, cf. Ael. VH 4.9, S.E. M. 7.166.

children.label: b
children.definition: march parallel with, τινί Plu. Aem. 30, cf. Arr. An. 5.17.1: c. acc, τὴν δύναμιν Plu. Luc. 27.

children.label: II
children.definition: compare, ἑαυτὸν πρός τινα Id. Tranq. 2.470b.
a means of attack in controversy, πρός τινα S.E. M. 7.150.
proceed in a parallel direction, J. AJ 2.9.4, Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.195c.

children.label: II
children.definition: make hostile demonstrations, Id. Cic. 43.
compare, τοὺς βίους τῶν πόλεων ἀλλήλοις D.H. 3.11; βύβλον βίβλῳ Id. Th. 16.
pass by on the opposite side, Ev.Luc. 10.31: c. acc. loci, AP 12.8 ( Strat.).

children.label: II
children.definition: come up ana help, as against an enemy, LXX Wi. 16.10.

children.label: III
children.definition: enter in place of, Diog.Oen. 29.

children.label: IV
children.definition: penetrate, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.248.
furnish or supply in turn, Th. 6.21:—also in Med., X. Hier. 7.12; supply mutual need, τοὐλλιπὲς ἀλλήλοις AP 9.12 ( Leon.).
cause in return, τοὺς ἀντιπαρέξοντας πράγματα D. 21.123.
persuade, comfort in turn, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.118a.
Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.153, 230; stretch parallel to, c. dat., Arist. Mu. 393a31, Str. 2.5.28; outflank, τῷ στρατεύματι Paus. 8.10.6.
bring their cavalry against, Arr. An. 5.16.3.
retort, τινί τι Aps. p.270 H., Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 102.15 ( -ιστῶντος):— Pass., νόμος -ίσταται νόμῳ Aps. p.271 H.; correspond, Ptol. Geog. 8.1.14.
meet on a march, ἀλλήλοις App. Pun. 107.
to be opposite in expression, Iamb. in Nic. p.29 P.
speak freely in turn, Plu. Adul. 2.72e.
write a parody against, Str. 9.1.10:— Subst. ἀντιπαρ-ῴδησις, εως, ἡ, Steph. in Rh. 319.19.
to be opposite in name or expression, Nicom. Ar. 1.8:— Act. in same sense, Iamb. in Nic. p.18 P., al.:— Subst. ἀντιπαρ-ωνῠμία, ἡ, ib. p.13 P., al.; and Adj. ἀντιπαρ-ώνῠμος, ον, Nicom. Ar. 2.3.

suffer in turn, κακὰ ἀ. suffer evil for evil, Antipho 4.2.3; δεσμούς X. Hier. 7.12; τί ἂν δράσειαν αὐτούς, ὅ τι οὐκ ἂν μεῖζον ἀντιπάθοιεν; Th. 6.35; δρῶν ἀντιπάσχω χρηστά I receive good for good done, S. Ph. 584; καλὸν τὸ εὖ ποιεῖν μὴ ἵνα ἀντιπάθῃ Arist. EN 1163a1; ἀ. ἀντί τινος Th. 3.61: abs., suffer for oneʼs acts, X. An. 2.5.17.

data.quote: τί ἂν δράσειαν αὐτούς, ὅ τι οὐκ ἂν μεῖζον ἀντιπάθοιεν;
καλὸν τὸ εὖ ποιεῖν μὴ ἵνα ἀντιπάθῃ

children.label: b
children.definition: to be affected in a contrary manner, ἡ ψυχὴ τοῖς σώμασιν ὡς ἀσώματος ἀντιπέπονθε Sallust. 8; opp. συντρέχειν, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 437.16.

data.quote: ἡ ψυχὴ τοῖς σώμασιν ὡς ἀσώματος ἀντιπέπονθε

children.definition: τὸ ἀντιπεπονθός requital, Arist. EN 1132b21 (Pythag.); of persons, εὔνοιαν ἐν ἀντιπεπονθόσι φιλίαν εἶναι ib. 1155b33.
to be in the same proportion, πρός τι Id. Mech. 850b2.

to be reciprocally proportional, Euc. 6.14, al.; -πεπονθότα σχήματα figures having the sides about the equal angles reciprocally proportional, Id. 6 Def. 2, cf. Hero Def. 118. Adv. -πεπονθότως reciprocally, Archim. Aequil. 1.6, 7, al., cf. Iamb. in Nic. p.11 P.

children.label: II
children.definition: counteract, δυσουρίαις, θανασίμοις φαρμάκοις, Dsc. 3.62,64.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be of opposite nature to, τινί Thphr. Lap. 14.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀντιπεπονθώς reflexive, κατηγορήματα Stoic. 2.59.

children.label: V
children.definition: to be adversely affected, Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.11, Archig. ap.eund. 8.2.15.
rattle so as to drown another sound, ψόφῳ Th. 3.22; τοῖς ὅπλοις Dam. Isid. 63.
repercutio, Gloss.
trample upon in turn, Sch. Ar. Pl. 973.
silver vessel, IG 11.110, al. ( Delos, iii B.C.). (Prob. from pr. n. Ἀντίπατρος.)
availing to persuade to the contrary, An.Bachm. 2.291.
cherish in turn, Iamb. VP 5.24, Zen. 1.94; cherish in place of another, of a sister acting as parent, Aristaenet. 1.25:— Subst. ἀντιπελάργ-ωσις, εως, ἡ, Com.Adesp. 939.
send back an answer, Hdt. 2.114; πέμψασιν ἀντέπεμψεν S. OT 306:— Pass., Hdt. 6.4.
send back sound, echo, Arr. An. 6.3.3.
send in requital or repayment, οἰκούρια S. Tr. 542; τινὶ θηρίον Philem. 47.

children.label: II
children.definition: send against, στρατιάν τινι Th. 6.99.

children.label: III
children.definition: send in the place of another, στρατηγοὺς ἐπὶ τὰς ναῦς Id. 8.54.
sending back of sound, echo, Arr. An. 6.3.3.
causing grief in turn, A. Eu. 782.
reciprocal proportion, Nicom. Ar. 1.7, Iamb. Comm.Math. 7.
Adv. for ἀντιπέρᾱν, Plb. 1.17.4 (dub.): c. gen., ἀ. τῆς Γαλιλαίας Ev.Luc. 8.26: proparox. in Hsch.
accomplish in turn, τὸ δρᾶν καὶ τὸ παθεῖν, sens. obsc., AP 12.238 ( Strat.).
lying over against, ἀντιπέραἰ ἐνέμοντο the lands lying over against, Il. 2.635:—in late Ep. also fem. ἀντιπέραιᾰ A.R. 2.351, D.P. 962, Nonn. D. 24.148:—also ἀντιπεραῗτις, ιδος, ἡ, Tz. H. 1.896.
v.l. in X. HG 6.2.9, cf. A.R. 2.177, al.; also κατʼ ἀντιπέραν, c. gen., Plb. 9.41.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., Ἀσίδα τʼ ἀντιπέρην τε Asia and the opposite coast, Mosch. 2.9.
over against, on the other side, c. gen., Th. 2.66, etc.; εἰς τὸ ἀ. X. Cyn. 9.3: abs., ἡ ἀ. Θρᾴκη Th. 1.100, cf. 4.92.
Adv. from the opposite side, A.R. 1.613, AP 9.551 ( Antiphil.): c. gen., A.R. 2.1030.
bring round, τὸν δὲ [σκορπίον] τὸ κέντρον ἐπαίροντα ἀντιπεριάγειν Arist. Mir. 844b27; of the corvus employed on the Roman ships, Plb. 1.22.8; τὸν αὐχένα τοῦ ἵππου Ph. 1.311.

children.definition: contrary revolution, Ptol. Alm. 5.2, Procl. Hyp. 4.34.
rotatory movement used in extracting the afterbirth, Sor. 1.73.
put round in the other direction, e.g. a bandage, Hp. Fract. 11.
embrace in return, Ach.Tat. 5.8:— Pass., to be clothed about, θανάῳ LXX Si. 23.12.
to be rolled in the contrary direction, Orib. 49.22.24.
come round as in a cycle, Aret. SA 2.2.
draw round to the other side, S.E. M. 7.189.
echo around, Plu. Garr. 2.502d.
oppose by surrounding, compress, Arist. Mete. 382b10, 347b6:— Pass., with intr. tenses in Act., to be compressed, ib. 348b6, al.
Pass., to be replaced by another substance, ib. 382a14; ἀ. ἀλλήλοις change places with, Id. Resp. 472b16, cf. Gal. 17(2).292.
Pass., to be opposed, in general sense, Iamb. in Nic. p.19P.; of the shadow of the earth, TheoSm. p. 121 H.

children.label: II
children.definition: bring all round, φόβους ἀ. τινί Plb. 4.50.1; εὐδαιμονίαν τισί Lib. Decl. 43.6.
embrace in turn, X. Smp. 9.4.
sail round on the other side, Str. 1.1.8.
express reciprocal action, of certain verbs, A.D. Synt. 429.3.
expressive of a claim, An.Bachm. 2.291.

definition: ἀντιπερίσπασμα, ατος, τό, as military term,

drawn through, of cautery, Paul.Aeg. 6.42.
draw off, divert, D.S. 3.37; esp. as military term, Plb. 2.24.8, etc.:— Pass., Arist. PA 670b10.
divert, distract, ἑαυτὸν ἄβακι Iamb. VP 5.24.
surrounding so as to compress, Arist. Somn.Vig. 457b2, 458a27, Pr. 867b32, 962a2.
reciprocal replacement, interchange, Id. Ph. 215a15, 267a16 (v. Simp. ad loc.), Mete. 348b2, Thphr. Ign. 18, Sud. 23.
alternation, Nicom. Ar. 1.8 and 13.
turning round to the other side, Placit. 4.14.2.
to be broken up and return, of sputum, Steph. in Hp. 1.174D.
contrary revolution, Procl. in Ti. 1.76D., al., Simp. in Cael. 473.19: pl., Procl. in Prm. p.571S.
move round in turn or in opposition, Plu. Ages. 39.
cool or chill in turn, Plu. QConv. 2.691f.
push or press back any surrounding body, Plu. QPlat. 2.1005f:—hence Subst. ἀντιπερίωσις, εως, ἡ, ibid.

definition: ἀντιπέσσομαι, Att. ἀντιπέττομαι, Pass., of food,

children.definition: to be quite digested, Arist. Pr. 884a2.
like stone, rocky, S. OC 192 codd. (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Theoc. Syrinx 2 (acc. to Sch.), exchanged for a stone, of Zeus in his infancy.
to be fixed opposite, ἀλλήλοις, of crocodileʼs teeth, Tim.Gaz. in An.Ox. 4.264.
wheeled cradle or perambulator for infants, κοίλης ἐν ἀντίπηγος εὐτρόχῳ κύκλῳ E. Ion 19; κύτος ἑλικτὸν ἀντίπηγος ib. 40. (Mytil., = κιβωτός, acc. to Eust. 1056.46.)
to be blinded in return, Ph. 2.332.
talio, Gloss.
drink to, pledge in turn, Sch. Opp. H. 3.226.
collide, Arist. Pr. 915b18; fall upon, ταῖς σπείραις Plb. 3.19.5.

resist, ἀντιπῖπτον resisting body, Arist. Pr. 961b3; ἀ. τινί Act.Ap. 7.51; μηδὲν ἀντιπεσόντα without demur, UPZ 36.21 (ii B.C.); τῆς φράσεως οὐκ -ούσης A.D. Adv. 123.5; εἰ μηδὲν -πίπτει POxy. 1473.20 (iii A. D.), cf. Aët. 16.73; ἀντιπῖπτον an objection, Phlp. in Mete. 58.3; ἡ τοῦ ἀντιπίπτοντος λύσις Aps. p.238H.
to be adverse, τινί Plb. 16.2.1, etc.: abs., τῆς τύχης -ούσης ib. 28.2; of contrary winds, 4.44.9; tell against, conflict with (fact or theory), Phld. Sign. 8, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: to fall in a contrary direction, αἱ σκιαί Str. 2.1.19.
trust in return, Charito 2.11.
to be placed athwart, of bars in lattice-work, Lyd. Mag. 3.37.
substance or process for protecting walls from damp, Ath.Mitt. 26.110.
similarly formed; generally, like, νόμος S. Fr. 284.
intertwine, in Pass., Gal. 18(2).748; of crossed or reversed bandaging, Sor. Fasc. 12.513C.

have equal precedence or privilege, ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ τό τε μέσον αὐτοῦ καὶ τὸ πέριξ Simp. in Cael. 515.5; have respective advantages over each other, Id. in Cat. 335.1, Elias in Cat. 98.1:—hence ἀντιπλεονέκτ-ησις, εως, ἡ, Simp. in Cat. 341.2.

data.quote: ἐν τῷ οὐρανῷ τό τε μέσον αὐτοῦ καὶ τὸ πέριξ

children.definition: with its side opposite, parallel, κῆπος Εὐβοίας S. Fr. 24.4; ἀ. παριππεύειν Hld. 10.29.
sail against an enemy, v.l. in Th. 1.50 and 54; ἀ. ἀνέμοισιν Ps.-Phoc. 113.
struggle with, πρός τινα Tz. ad Lyc. 930.
beaten by the waves, ἀκταί S. Ant. 592 (lyr.).
fill in turn or against, τὰς ναῦς man them against the enemy, Th. 7.69, etc.:— Med., ἀ. φιλοτησίαν πρός τινα fill oneʼs cup in his honour, pledge him, Aristid. 2.115J.

children.label: II
children.definition: fill up by new members, ἀ. τάξεις ἐκ πολιτῶν X. Cyr. 2.2.26; replenish after exhaustion, Thphr. CP 1.13.3.
strike in turn, in Pass., Arist. EN 1132b29, MM 1194a33.
sailing close to the wind: metaph. of a mixed constitution, dub. l. in Plb. 6.10.7 (fort. -πνοια).
opposite current of air, Orib. 9.20.3.
blow against, πρός τι Arist. Pr. 940b34; ἀλλήλοις Thphr. Vent. 53: impers., ἀντιπνεῖ, διὰ τὸ ἀντιπνεῖν Arist. Mete. 370b22.
to be adverse or contrary, Ph. 1.593, Plu. Cic. 32, Luc. Nav. 7: metaph. of fortune, Plb. 25.3.9, Clitomachus ap. Stob. 4.41.29: c. dat., Luc. Tox. 7.
πνεῦμα ταῖς ναυσί Plu. Par.min. 2.309b.
conflicting wind, τῷ βορέᾳ Thphr. Vent. 28.
contrary wind, Ph. 1.352, Hdn. 5.4.11.
caused by adverse winds, ἀντιπνόους . . ἀπλοίας A. Ag. 147 (lyr.); στάσις ἀ. Id. Pr. 1087 (lyr.). Adv. -νόως Tz. ad Lyc. 739.
long for in turn, X. Mem. 2.6.28 ( Pass.).

do in return, ταῦτα Pl. Cri. 50e; ἀντʼ εὖ ποιεῖν Id. Grg. 520e; οἱ μὴ ἀντιποιοῦντες εὖ Arist. Rh. 1397b7; κακῶς μὲν πάσχοντας, ἀντιποιεῖν δὲ οὐ δυναμένους X. An. 3.3.12, cf. ib. 7; ἀ. κακῶς τὸν ἄρξαντα Muson. Fr. 10p.56H.; ἀ. τὸ αὐτό Arist. EN 1138a22:— Pass., to have done to one in turn, LXX Le. 24.19.

data.quote: κακῶς μὲν πάσχοντας, ἀντιποιεῖν δὲ οὐ δυναμένους

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. ( aor. Pass. in Luc. DMort. 23[29].2), c. gen., exert oneself about a thing, seek after it, ἀ. τῶν σπουδαίων Isoc. 1.2; lay claim to, τῆς πόλεως Th. 4.122; ἀρετῆς Isoc. 6.7; τῆς τέχνης, τῶν νικητηρίων, Pl. Men. 90d, Phlb. 23a; τοῦ πρωτεύειν D. 10.52; τῆς θαλάττης Antiph. 190.11; τῶν ἐν τῇ Ἑλλάδι πραγμάτων D.Chr. 11.62; οἱ Δωριεῖς ἀντιποιοῦνται τῆς τραγῳδίας Arist. Po. 1448a30: also c. inf., ἀ. ἐπίστασθαί τι lay claim to knowing . ., Pl. Men. 91c, cf. Hp.Mi. 363a: c. acc., τὴν κληρονομίαν Michel 546.16 (Cappad., i B. C.).
contend with one for a thing, ἀ. τινὶ τῆς ἀρχῆς X. An. 2.1.11, 2.3.23; more rarely τινὶ περί τινος ib. 5.2.11; τινὸς πρός τινα Arr. Epict. 1.29.9.
set up opposition, Pl. Prt. 336c, Arist. Pol. 1314a12; maintain resistance, Plb. 2.9.5, 21.25.6.
laying claim to, τινός D.H. 11.30, cf. S.E. M. 6.27, PLond. 2.251.25 (iv A.D.).

requital, retribution, ἀντίποινʼ ὡς τίνῃς ματροφόνου δύας prob. in A. Eu. 268; ἀντίποινά τινος πράσσειν, λαμβάνειν, to exact retribution for . ., Id. Pers. 476, S. El. 592; ἀντίποινʼ ἐμοῦ παθεῖν suffer retribution for me, Id. Ph. 316, cf. Nech. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.145. —In codd. sts. written ἀντάποινα, q.v. Later in sg., as Lib. Decl. 43.69.
for recompense, Lyc. 271.
in substitution, Id. 1201.
wage war against, Th. 3.39: c. dat., Pl. Criti. 112e, X. Cyr. 7.2.24: c. acc., LXX Is. 41.12:— Pass., to be warred against, D.C. 38.40.

warring against, οἱ ἀντιπολέμιοι enemies, Th. 3.90 codd. (but -πόλεμοι Poll. 1.150); in Hdt. 4.134, 140, codd. vary between ἀντιπόλεμοι and -μιοι; but in 7.236, 8.68.βʹ ἀντιπόλεμοι occurs without v.l., and is the only form cited by Hsch., cf. Onos. 10.9, al.
build up as an opposing city, ἑαυτόν J. BJ 5.2.4.
besiege in turn, τόπον Th. 7.28; τινά Plu. Marc. 7:— Pass., J. BJ 3.7.19.
rival city, τινί Str. 3.5.3, v.l. in D.S. 11.81.
political opposition, τινὶ πρός τινα Plb. 20.5.5, cf. Plu. Caes. 11.

children.label: II
children.definition: opposite parties, Plb. 11.25.5.

to be a political opponent, Arist. Pol. 1274a14; οἱ -όμενοι the opposite party, Din. 1.97: in sg., political opponent, Cic. Att. 7.8.5: metaph., ὁ φθόνος ταῖς πράξεσιν ἀ. Aristonym. ap. Stob. 3.38.36; ἀ. τινι Plu. Them. 19, Per. 8.
exert oneself in opposition, App. BC 5.33.
return for labour, wages, Iamb. VP 5.22.
marching against, Ascl. Tact. 10.2, Ael. Tact. 25.1.

definition: ἀντιπορεῖν, aor. with no pres. in use,

children.definition: give instead, APl. 16.341.
march to meet another, X. HG 7.3.5.
ravage in return, E. Tr. 359, Lyc. 1398.

over the straits, ἠπείροιν δυοῖν πεδία plains on opposite sides of the straits, E. Ion 1585; Πελοπίας χθονὸς ἐν ἀντιπόρθμοις in the parts opposite Peloponnesus, Id. Fr. 515, cf. Arist. Mu. 392b23, Lyc. 1071: c. dat., Str. 8.6.21.

definition: ἀντιπορνόβοσκος, ὁ, title of a comedy by Dioxippus, Ath. 3.100e.

children.definition: on the opposite coast, ἐς ἀ. γείτονα χώραν, i.e. Europe, as separated by a strait from Asia, A. Pers. 66, cf. Supp. 544, E. Med. 210; Ἄρτεμιν Χαλκίδος ἀντίπορον, i.e. her templeat Aulis over against Chalcis in Euboea, Id. IA 1494 (all lyr. passages): —in X. An. 4.2.18 τὸν ἀ. λόφον τῷ μαστῷ, simply, over against, opposite to.
seton for keeping incision open, Hippiatr. 24, 26.

definition: ἀντίπους, ὁ, ἡ, πουν, τό, gen. οδος,

children.definition: with the feet opposite, στὰς ἀ., of one at the Antipodes, Pl. Ti. 63a; so ἀ. ἔσται πορευόμενος ἕκαστος αὐτὸς αὑτῷ Arist. Cael. 308b20, cf. Eratosth. 16.19; οἱ ἀ. the Antipodes, Str. 1.1.13, Cleom. 1.2, Cic. Acad.Pr. 2.39.123, Plu. Herod. 2.869c.

data.quote: ἀ. ἔσται πορευόμενος ἕκαστος αὐτὸς αὑτῷ

children.definition: counteracting, M.Ant. 2.1: Comp. -ώτερος Xenocr. ap. Orib. 2.58.72.
counteraction, resistance, Plb. 6.17.8, D.H. 11.53, Plu. Publ. 11, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.71.
contract of sale executed by the purchaser, PLond. ined. 2227 (iv A. D.).
act against, seek to counteract, τινί X. Ath. 2.17, Alex. 264 ( Med.); πρός τι Arist. Pol. 1320a6, etc.

act in opposition, D. 32.14; ὁ ἀντιπρήσσων, = ἀντιστασιώτης, Hdt. 1.92; ἀ. τι oppose in any way, X. HG 2.3.14; ἐάν τε ἀντιπράττῃ τις ἐάν τε μὴ συμπράττῃ Arist. Rh. 1379a13; conflict with, tell against a theory, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1055.20:— Med., X. Hier. 2.17.

data.quote: ἐάν τε ἀντιπράττῃ τις ἐάν τε μὴ συμπράττῃ

children.definition: send counter-ambassadors, Th. 6.75, Luc. Peregr. 16: c. dat., Paus. 7.9.5:— Act. in Aristid. 1.372J., App. Mith. 87.
= Lat. pro legato, Gloss.
buy in return, SIG 2861 (Delph.).
mutual preference, πρὸς ἀλλήλους Arist. EE 1236b3.
propose instead of another, τὸν ἕτερον Pl. Lg. 755d:— Act., Gal. 19.64.
proposing instead of another, Pl. Lg. 755e, 756a (cj.).
recognize before meeting, ἀλλήλους Ph. 2.544.
come forward against or to meet, τινί Th. 6.66: abs., App. Pun. 107.
precede instead of following, EM 462.35, Hdn.Gr. 2.394.
to be hostilely disposed, Aen.Tact. 11.1.
for next to nothing, cheaply, X. Ages. 1.18, Poll. 7.10.
compensation, PFlor. 294.74 (vi A.D.).
hold out before one, present, as weapons, ἡ λύπη ἀ. τὰ ἄμαχα κέντρα τῆς φύσεως Them. Or. 32.357b:— Hsch. has the Act. ἀντιπροΐσχειν· ἀντιδοῦναι.

data.quote: ἡ λύπη ἀ. τὰ ἄμαχα κέντρα τῆς φύσεως

children.definition: retort a legal challenge ( πρόκλησις), D. 37.43; challenge in turn, c. acc. et inf., D.H. 15.8.
one must reply to an anticipation, Arist. Rh.Al. 1433b1.
retorting of a πρόκλησις, Hsch.
drink in turn, αἷμα ἀλλήλοις J. BJ 5.10.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: present in return (cf. προπίνω I.2), ἀοιδάς Dionys. Eleg. 1; τὰ ὅμοια Ath. 4.128a.
return salute, Plu. Crass. 3 (in aor. -ευσα):— but in earlier Prose, aor. 2 ἀντιπροσεῖπον Thphr. Char. 15.3:— Pass., ἀντιπροσερρήθην X. Mem. 3.13.1.
adduce on the other side, τι πρός τινα Phld. Rh. 1.377S.
heap in turn, ἀ. τὴν γῆν scrape up new soil upon, X. Oec. 17.13.
to be impinged upon in return, Hierocl. p.23A.
march against, X. Cyr. 3.3.24.
charge against, of cavalry, D.C. 46.37.
come to meet, τινί D.C. 60.6.
summon in turn, D. 47.45.
join instead, Alex.Aphr. de An. 134.32:— Pass., to be added to in exchange, c. dat., Id. in Sens. 57.2.
fall down and worship in turn, Plu. Col. 2.1117c.
appearing instead, glossed by ὁμηρεία, Suid., Zonar.
bring near in turn, λύχνον τινί X. Smp. 5.9.
accost in return, Ph. 1.36.

with the face towards, facing, τοῖς πολεμίοις X. Cyr. 7.1.25, cf. Aen.Tact. 22.11; face to face, ἀντιπρόσωποι μαχόμενοι X. HG 6.5.26; φιλήματα AP 12.251 ( Strat.); of images, reflected, Thphr. Sens. 52, 53; of winds, blowing in a contrary direction, Placit. 4.1.1. Adv. -πως Arist. Mir. 835b11, Steph. in Hp. 1.95 D., al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀντιπρόσωπον, τό, prow, Artem. 2.23, 4.24.
counter-proposition, Hermog. Inv. 3.4, Steph. in Int. 24.1.
hold out in turn, τὴν δεξιάν X. HG 4.1.31; ἱκετηρίας D.H. 8.19 codd.
propose in turn, D.C. 48.11 ( Med.).
adduce on the other side, Gal. 10.112.
publish, post up in opposition, γράμματα D.C. 65.1.
adduce in reply, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.49.

with the prow towards, ἀ. τοῖσι βαρβάροισι γενόμενοι Hdt. 8.11; τοὺς ἔσπλους ταῖς ναυσὶν ἀντιπρῴροις κλῄειν Th. 4.8; [ ἐμβολαῖς] μὴ ἀντιπρῴροις χρῆσθαι not to charge prow to prow, Id. 7.36; τὸ ἀ. ξυγκροῦσαι ibid.; ἀ. ἐμβάλλεσθαι ib. 34; τῶν πολεμίων ἀ. ἐφορμούντων Id. 8.75; of ships, ready for action, ib. 53; ἀ. καταστῆσαι τὰς τριήρεις X. HG 6.2.28; τὸ στράτευμα ἀ. ὥσπερ τριήρη προσῆγε ib. 7.5.23.

data.quote: τοὺς ἔσπλους ταῖς ναυσὶν ἀντιπρῴροις κλῄειν

children.definition: face to face, τάδʼ ἀντίπρῳρα . . βλέπειν πάρεστʼ S. Tr. 223 (lyr.); κατʼ ἀντίπρῳρα ναυστάθμων in front of them, E. Rh. 136 (lyr.); ὀργῆς ἀντιπρῴρου κυλινδουμένης Plu. de Ira Fr. 27B [fr. 148 Sandbach].
obstruct, stand in the way, πρός τι Onos. 17.
stumble against, LXX Si. 34(31).29; accident, Ptol. Tetr. 116, Paul.Al. N. 3b.
opposition, resistance, Hp. Decent. 3 (pl.).

children.label: II
children.definition: interchange of cases, Priscian. Inst. 17.155, Sch. Ar. V. 135.
of or belonging to ἀντίπτωσις II, Anon. Fig. p.151S. Adv. -κῶς with such interchange, Eust. 29.39.
rump to rump, Arist. HA 540a14, 542a16.
turned away from, λιμὴν ἀ. λιμένος Scyl. 46, cf. 108.
wrestle against, τῷ ἔρωτι Sch. S. Tr. 441.
with the gates opposite, ἀλλήλησι Hdt. 2.148.
like a tower or fort, E. Ba. 1097.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀ., ὁ, repository, cupboard, ἀ. ξύλινοι Lib. Or. 11.254.
build a tower over against, c. acc. cogn., πόλιν τήνδʼ ἀντεπύργωσαν reared up this rival city, i. e. the Areopagus as a rival to the Acropolis, A. Eu. 688.
return signals, Plb. 8.28.3, 10.46.1.
counterpoise, balance, A. Ag. 574; τινί Hp. Art. 4: metaph., vacillate, ὥσπερ ἐπὶ πλάστιγγος Ph. 2.170, etc.
flow or (of wind) blow contrariwise, Poll. 1.111.
break opposite ways, Plu. QPlat. 2.1005b.

gainsaying, altercation, ἀ. γίγνεταί τινι πρός τινα περί τινος Plb. 2.7.7; controversy, Gal. Phil.Hist. 24 D.; refutation of, D.S. 1.38, J. Ap. 2.1, Hermog. Id. 1.8, Gal. 1.131; counter-statement, POxy. 68.11 (ii A. D.); reply, Phld. Rh. 1.384S., al., Sign. 7, cf. 11.

data.quote: ἀ. γίγνεταί τινι πρός τινα περί τινος

children.definition: one must speak against, Pl. Plt. 297b.
controversial, λόγος S.E. P. 1.21. Adv. -κῶς, ἔχειν πρός τινας Steph. in Hp. 1.72 D.
speak against, dispute with, τινί Max.Tyr. 9.3 [3.3.c].
calfʼs snout, Antirrhinum Orontium, Thphr. HP 9.19.2 (codd. -ριζον, cf. Hsch.), Dsc. 4.130.
back-current, Thphr. Vent. 53.
counterpoise, Hp. Art. 38, 39 (v.l. ἀντιρροπίη, as in Gal. 18 (1).481).

definition: ἀντιρροπία, ἡ, in pl., τύχης ἀ.

children.definition: vicissitudes of fortune, Agath. Praef. p.134 D.

counterpoising, compensating for, τινός D. 1.10; ἄγειν . . λύπης ἀ. ἄχθος to balance the counterpoising weight of sorrow, S. El. 120 (lyr.); Θεανοῖ . . ἀ. balancing her, weighing as much as . ., Antiph. 26.24; κτῆμα πόνοις ἀ. Max.Tyr. 6.6 [35.6.e]; ῥώμη πρὸς κίνδυνον ἀ. Pl. Def. 412a. Adv. ἀντιρρόπως, πράττειν τινί so as to balance his power, X. HG 5.1.36: also neut. pl. as Adv., ψυχὰς δʼ ἀντίρροπα θέντες as a counterpoise, IG 1.442.
equivalent to, c. dat., X. Oec. 3.15.
flowing directly opposite to, Νείλῳ Str. 11.2.2.
opposite, c. gen., POxy. 941.4 (vi A.D.).
to be equal with, compensate, c. gen., Sch. E. Alc. 859.
revere in turn, Epicur. Fr. 141.
meet pride with pride, Arist. Pol. 1314a7.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., extol in return, Eust. 1563.40.
compensating, equivalent, χάρις Eust. 1075.8.

counterbalance, compensate for, c. dat. rei, ὡς τοῖσδε (sc. κακοῖς) δὶς ἀντισηκῶσαι A. Pers. 437: c. gen., ἀντισηκώσας δέ σε φθείρει θεῶν τις τῆς πάροιθʼ εὐπραξίας some god ruins thee, making compensation for, balancing, thy former happiness, E. Hec. 57, cf. D.S. 31.12: c. acc., τιμαῖς ἀντισηκώσω χάριν I will compensate the favour by honours, Luc. Trag. 243; support by way of compensation, τινά Hp. Acut. 29, cf. Art. 6:— Pass., ἡ ὠφέλεια πολλαῖς ὀδύναις -οῦται Simp. in Epict. p.27 D.
equipoise, compensation, PSI 238.10 (vi/vii A. D.), Eust. 546.24.
= foreg., ἀ. γίνεται Hdt. 4.50; equivalence, Plot. 1.4.14.
give a countersign, J. AJ 19.1.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: give hostile signs, τοῖς βαρβάροις ἀντεσήμαινε τὰ ἐκ τοῦ θεοῦ Paus. 10.23.1.

data.quote: τοῖς βαρβάροις ἀντεσήμαινε τὰ ἐκ τοῦ θεοῦ

children.definition: make to putrefy in turn, Gal. 11.608.
followers of Antisthenes, Arist. Metaph. 1043b24; ὁ Ἀ. Ἡρακλῆς, referring to a book by A., Plu. Vit.pud. 2.536b.
a way of life according to the teaching of Antisthenes, Jul. Or. 6.187c.
sigma reversed, as a critical mark, D.L. 3.66, Sch. Od. 5.247.
symbol for ps, Priscian. Inst. 1.42.
to be silent in turn, Ar. Lys. 528.
lay snares for, τινά Tz. H. 3.256.
furnish for oneself in opposition, τὸν οἶκον X. Ages. 8.6:— Pass., Ph. Bel. 92.11.
opposite the stage-buildings, prob. sc. στοά, Ephes. 2.41 (iii A. D.).
throwing a shadow the opposite way, Ach.Tat. Intr. Arat. 31, Vett.Val. 142.28, Jul. Or. 4.147c; ζόφον . . ἀ. Ἠοῦς Nonn. D. 7.311.
Plin. HN 19.112.
obstruct, τῷ δικαίῳ S.E. M. 2.78.
obstruction, Gloss.
mock in return, Plu. Tim. 15, Ant. 24:— Pass., take a gibe in return for oneʼs own, ἡδέως D.C. 66.11.
oppose on equal terms, Th. 3.11.
use counter-devices, πρός τι Arist. Pol. 1297a36: abs., Ph. 1.364.
= foreg., τῷ θείῳ λόγῳ Ph. 1.449, cf. Numen. ap. Eus. PE 14.8.
one who seeks to refute, c. gen., μαγγανείας Luc. Alex. 43, cf. Cal. 16.
revulsion, esp. of bodily humours, Hp. Hum. 1, Vict. 2.56, Gal. 10.315, etc.
distraction, diversion, Plb. 2.18.3, D.S. 20.86, J. AJ 17.2.4.
convulsion, Ar. Lys. 967.

children.label: II
children.definition: counter-movement (ebb and flow), of the sea, Placit. 3.17.7.
one must draw off by another outlet, Hp. Vict. 4.90, Gal. 16.153.
able to draw back, retractile, Arist. HA 638a31.

children.label: II
children.definition: revulsive, βοηθήματα Gal. 17(1).907. Adv. -κῶς Id. 11.305.

children.label: III
children.definition: antispastic, Heph. 10, al.
drawn in the contrary direction, νεφέλαι πνεύμασιν ἀ. Orph. H. 21.5.
spasmodic, convulsive, ὀστέων ἀδαγμὸς ἀ. S. Tr. 770.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντίσπαστος (sc. πούς), ὁ, in Prosody, antispast, a foot made up of an iambus and trochee, ⏑ - - ⏑, Heph. 3, Aristid.Quint. 1.22.
Phryn. Trag.11; ἀντίσπαστα ἐφυμνεῖ πηκτίδος συγχορδίᾳ S. Fr. 412 (unless ‘doubly twanged’, of an instrument with two registers).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀντίσπαστον· φιλήματος ὄνομα, Hsch.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Subst. ἀντί-σπαστος, ὁ, tackle, pulley-rope, Ath.Mech. 9.13, al.

draw the contrary way, hold back, ἀ. ὁρμώμενον A. Pr. 339; τοὺς μὲν τείνειν τοὺς δʼ ἀ. Ar. Pax 493, cf. Luc. Cat. 4; opp. σπάω, Arist. HA 542a15, al.:— Pass., suffer a check, Id. Rh. 1409b21; to be drawn in a contrary direction, Epicur. Ep. 2p.53U., Ph. 2.171: metaph., περίοδοι -σπώμεναι dragging, Phld. Rh. 2.95S.

data.quote: τοὺς μὲν τείνειν τοὺς δʼ ἀ.

children.definition: draw to itself, X. Cyn. 5.1; εἰς αὑτό Arist. Pr. 929a39:— Med., draw over to oneʼs own side, Plb. 22.10.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: seize, c. gen., A.R. 2.598.
oppose eagerly, contend against, πρός τινα Antipho 1.7; τοῖς ἐπιθυμήμασί τινος D.C. 59.13.
substitute for [mineral] ashes, vegetable ashes, Orib. 15.1.27(36), Gal. 12.234:—also ἀντίσποδον, Dsc. 1.109, 5.75.
opposite exertion, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.24.
a furlong long, i.e. enormous, Sch. Od. 12.90.
Sm. Jb. 28.19:—in Med., Eust. 1875.8.
Incert. Jb. 28.19.
counterpoising, balancing, τινί Pl. Sph. 229c; χρυσὸν ἀ. τῆς κεφαλῆς οὐκ ἐδέξαντο D.S. 5.29: metaph., in compensation for, ὡς πατὴρ ἀ. τοῦ θηρὸς ἐκθύσειε τὴν αὑτοῦ κόρην S. El. 571.

data.quote: χρυσὸν ἀ. τῆς κεφαλῆς οὐκ ἐδέξαντο
ὡς πατὴρ ἀ. τοῦ θηρὸς ἐκθύσειε τὴν αὑτοῦ κόρην

children.definition: form a party against, τινί X. An. 4.1.27; οἱ ἀντιστασιάζοντες, = οἱ ἀντιστασιῶται, Id. Cyr. 7.4.3; ἀ.πρὸς πάντα to offer opposition to . ., D.C. 37.54.
sloping, Anon.Alch. p.26B.
of equal weight: metaph., λόγοι Max.Tyr. 4.1; τὸ ἀ. Id. 39.1.
counter-faction, στάσις καὶ ἀ. καὶ μάχη Pl. R. 560a.

children.label: II
children.definition: opposition, αἰώνιος Ph. 1.577; ἐπὶ τῇ ἀρχῇ J. AJ 17.11.2; τύχης Plu. Aem. 36; ἐξ ἀ. ἀγωνίζεσθαι in pitched battle, Hdn. 5.4.4; ἴσην ἀ. ἔχειν weigh equally, Arist. Mu. 397a1.

children.label: III
children.definition: counter-plea, set-off, e.g. benefit conferred balanced against injury done, Hermog. Stat. 2, cf. 6 (pl.), Arg. Lycurg.
one of the opposite faction or party, Hdt. 1.92, 4.164, X. An. 1.1.10, Aen.Tact. 11.7, etc.
one must check, ταῖς κενώσεσι Philum. ap. Aët. 9.6.
resist, oppose, esp. as a political partisan, Hdt. 3.52; τινί Pl. Grg. 513c, J. AJ 18.9.2, cf. Ph. 1.205, al.; πρός τι Plu. Praec. 2.802b; trans., τῷ φόβῳ τὸ κλέος Lib. Vit. 1.7.
opponent, adversary, A. Th. 518, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1084b.

children.label: II
children.definition: vertical beam in plinth of torsion-engine, Hero Bel. 91.11.
of or for a counter-plea (cf. ἀντίστασις III), Hermog. Stat. 5, 10.
the part of the spine opposite the breast, Sor. 2.63 (pl.), Ruf. Anat. 25.
Hsch. s.v. ἀντεξάγω.
a prop or support, Hp. Art. 9, 16: metaph., support, stay, LXX Ps. 17(18).18.
blocking the way, resistance, ἀνακοπαὶ καὶ -μοί D.H. Dem. 38; -μοὶ γραμμάτων Id. Comp. 16.
press against, Hp. Art. 47; offer resistance, Democr. 9, Arist. Pr. 940a11.
shine by reflection, Zen. 3.8.
change of a letter, e.g. φιτπῶν for φυτρῶν, Sch. Il. 12.29.
stand opposite in rows or pairs, χοροὶ ἀντιστοιχοῦντες ἀλλήλοις X. An. 5.4.12; ἀ. τινί stand vis-a-vis to a partner in a dance, Id. Smp. 2.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: correspond, ἀ. τὰ δασέα τοῖς ψιλοῖς EM 443.17.
standing opposite in pairs, τῶν ποδῶν Arist. Pr. 894a19; πραγμάτων Plu. Tranq. 2.474a.

children.label: II
children.definition: correspondence, of the relation of tenuis, media, and aspirate to each other, Ascl.Myrl. ap. Ath. 11.501b.
ranged opposite in rows or pairs, Arist. IA 708b8, al.
standing over against, σκιὰ ἀντίστοιχος ὥς E. Andr. 745; ἀντίστοιχα λέγων . . τούτοισι corresponding with, D.H. Rh. 9.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: corresponding, as tenuis, media, and aspirate, A.D. Synt. 55.14, cf. Fr. 7b, D.T. 631.27; also of vowels, Hdn. Epim. 2; κατʼ ἀντίστοιχον Lyd. Mag. 1.7.
drawn up face to face, διφαλαγγία Ascl. Tact. 11.3, cf. Ael. Tact. 37.3, Arr. Tact. 29.2, Hsch.
lay paving instead, SIG 2.587.48 ( Eleusis).
conjecturing in turn, Sch. D. 8.17.
take the field, make war against, τινί X. Cyr. 8.8.26:—later in Act., D.S. 22.15, J. AJ 2.10.1 (abs.): metaph., Ἔρωτες ἀ. τοῖς ὑπερηφανοῦσι Aristaenet. 2.1.
act against as general or (generally) make war against, τινί D.H. 11.37; τοῖς ἐπιχειρήμασί τινων J. Vit. 55, cf. (Max.Tyr. 41.3.
hostile manoeuvre, Onos. 32.9.
enemyʼs general, Th. 7.86, D.H. 6.5, Plu. Sert. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: acting commander or governor, either pro consule, Plb. 28.3.1, or pro praetore, D.C. 41.43.
propraetor, i.e. governor of a province with rank of pro praetore, IG 12(5).722 ( Andros, ii B.C.).

lieutenant of a commander, Lat. legatus pro praetore, OGI ii p.551 ( Bargylia, ii B.C.), Plb. 3.106.2, 15.4.4, Plu. Comp.Lys.Sull. 4, etc.; in full, πρεσβευτὴς καὶ ἀ. J. AJ 14.12.13; ἀντιταμίας καὶ ἀ. proquaestor pro praetore, OGI 448 (i B.C.); πρεσβευτὴς Σεβαστοῦ ἀ., = Lat. legatus Augusti pro praetore, IGRom. 3.186 ( Ancyra, ii A.D.), etc.
soldier of the enemy, Gal. 19.180, Chor. in Lib. 4.522 Reiske.
an encamping opposite, the position of two armies in sight of one another, D.C. 78.26.
encamp over against, τινί Isoc. 6.80, Plb. 1.74.13, Onos. 10.19, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., τινί Hdt. 1.76: abs., Th. 1.30: so pf. Pass., Id. 4.124, X. HG 7.4.13.
to be converted, Arist. APr. 51a23.

children.label: II
children.definition: one must reverse, τὴν δόξαν Plot. 5.5.11.
that can be turned about: τὰ ἀ. machines that move on a pivot or swivel, D.S. 20.91.

turn to the opposite side:— Pass., to be turned in the opposite direction, μόχλος ἀντεστραμμένος reversed lever, Ph. Bel. 59.25; turn and look at, Aristaenet. 1.4: also c. acc., οὐδʼ ἀ. ὃ λέγουσιν cast a glance at, Phld. Rh. 1.245S. Adv. ἀντεστραμμένως Arist. IA 712a4.
wheel about, face about, X. Ages. 1.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: retort an argument, τοὺς λόγους Arist. Top. 163a30, cf. APr. 59b1; αἰτίας Procop. Pers. 1.16.

children.label: III
children.definition: correspond, ἀλλήλοις Anon. in Tht. 19.47.

children.label: IV
children.definition: to be convertible, Arist. Cat. 14b11, al.; τὰ γένη κατὰ τῶν εἰδῶν κατηγοπεῖται, τὰ δὲ εἴδη κατὰ τῶν γενῶν οὐκ ἀντιστπέφει are not conversely predicable of genera, ib. 2b21: impers., ἀντιστρέφει the relation is reciprocal, Id. GC 337b23, cf. de An. 423a21, Pr. 883b8; περὶ ἀντιστπεφόντων λόγων καὶ συνημμένων complementary propositions, title of work by Chrysipp.: so of metaphors, Anon. Fig. p.228S.

conversion of one of the premisses, Arist. APr. 50b25; either of the terms, τὸ Β τῷ Α ἀντιστρέφει the term B is convertible with A, ib. 67b30, al.; τὸ Γ πρὸς τὸ Α ἀ. ib. 38; ἀ. τὸ καθόλου τῷ κατὰ μέρος ib. 31a27, al.; or of the propositions, ib. 25a8, al.; ἀ. καθόλου to be simply convertible, ib. 28; ἀ. ἐπὶ μέρους, ἐν μέρει, κατὰ μέρος, ib. 39a15, 25a8, 10.
Pass., of propositions, to be converted or changed into their opposites, Id. APr. 45b6, APo. 80b25, al.

to be interdependent, have a reciprocal nexus, τὰ μὲν οὖν ἀ. . . καὶ ποιητικὰ ἀλλήλων καὶ παθητικὰ ὑπʼ ἀλλήλων Id. GC 328a19: hence of cyclical argument, ἐν μόνοις τοῖς ἀ. κύκλῳ καὶ διʼ ἀλλήλων (sc. αἱ ἀποδείξεις) Id. APr. 58a13, cf. APo. 95b40, GC 337b23.

data.quote: τὰ μὲν οὖν ἀ. . . καὶ ποιητικὰ ἀλλήλων καὶ παθητικὰ ὑπʼ ἀλλήλων

children.definition: to be suited conversely for one or another purpose, ὁ τόπος ἀντιστπέφει πρὸς τὸ ἀνασκευάζειν καὶ κατασκευάζειν Id. Top. 109b25; ἀ. πρὸς ἄμφω ib. 112a27, al.

data.quote: ὁ τόπος ἀντιστπέφει πρὸς τὸ ἀνασκευάζειν καὶ κατασκευάζειν

children.label: V
children.definition: pf. part. Pass., conversely opposed, of concavities, facing one another, ἀντεστραμμένα πρὸς ἄλληλα Id. HA 498a8; but, back to back, Plb. 6.32.6.
converted, συλλογισμὸς -μμένος Arist. APr. 44a31; πρότασις ib. 58a1; ἀ. τῇ πάχνῃ ὁ εὐρώς its converse, Id. GA 784b16; ἡ ἀ. πρόσθεσις Id. Ph. 207a23.
Adv. ἀντεστραμμένως inversely, ib. 206b5; conversely, PA 684b35, IA 712a4, al.; in Logic, opposedly, Id. Int. 22a34.

children.label: VI
children.definition: possess strophe and antistrophe, Aristid.Quint. 1.29, Sch. Ar. Ach. 1037, Sch. Heph. p.167C.

children.label: VII
children.definition: to be inverted, A.D. Synt. 180.16, al.
a turning about:

children.label: I
children.definition: strophic correspondence, D.H. Comp. 25; in later writers, = ἀντίστροφος, ἡ (q.v.), Sch. Ar. Nu. 595, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: repetition of closing words in successive members, Phld. Rh. 1.195 S., Hermog. Id. 1.12, cf, 2.1, Eust. 945.60; ἀ. τὸ ἐναντίον τῆς ἐπαναφορᾶς Alex. Fig. 2.4.
inversion, of construction, e.g. ἠχῶν ἔπεσα for πεσὼν ἤχησα Phoeb. Fig. 1.5.
inversion of letters (e.g. ἀκήν, ἦκα), EM 424.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: inversion, κατὰ τὴν ἀ. τῆς ἀναλογίας in inverse ratio, Arist. Ph. 266b18:—in Logic, conversion of terms of a proposition, Id. APr. 25a40; ἀ. δέχεσθαι to be convertible, ib. 50b32.

children.label: b
children.definition: τῶν θεωρημάτων ἡ ἀ. Procl. in Euc. p.251 F., cf. Apollon.Perg. Con. 2.49; ἀ. προηγουμένη complete conversion, Procl. in Euc. p.253F.; ἀ. ἀξιωμάτων Stoic. 2.64; generally, κατʼ -φήν conversely, Metrod. Herc. 831.14.
retortion of an argument, Arist. APr. 61a22.
change of a proposition into its opposite, ib. 38a3, 39a28.

turned so as to face one another: hence, correlative, co-ordinate, counterpart, Pl. Tht. 158c, etc.; τινί to a thing, Id. Grg. 464b, R. 605a; ἡ ῥητορική ἐστιν ἀ. τῇ διαλεκτικῇ Arist. Rh. 1354a1, Pol. 1293a33, etc.; ἰατρικὴ ἀ. δικαιοσύνῃ Aristid. 2.37 J.; also τινός the correlative or counterpart of . ., Pl. R. 530d, Grg. 465d, Isoc. 5.61, etc.; ἀ. . . ὥσπερ Arist. Pol. 1292b7. Adv. -φως in a manner corresponding, τινί Pl. R. 539d; ἡ γλῶττα ὥσπερ -φως ἔχουσα τῷ μυκτῆρι being the counterpart of . ., Arist. PA 661a27; συμβαίνει δʼ ἀντιστρόφως the result follows by a reversible proof, Id. Ph. 265b8.

data.quote: ἡ ῥητορική ἐστιν ἀ. τῇ διαλεκτικῇ
ἡ γλῶττα ὥσπερ -φως ἔχουσα τῷ μυκτῆρι

children.definition: converse, λόγος Phld. Rh. 1.179S. Adv. -φως Id. Sign. 6: also in Math., converse, θεώρημα Papp. 970.20; τὰ ἀ. the converse proposition, Apollon.Perg. Con. 4.55. Adv. -φως conversely, ib. 1.38, Max.Tyr. 34.4.
contrary, opposed, τινός D.Chr. 4.87; πρός τι Luc. Merc.Cond. 31. Adv. -φως in the opposite way, Phld. Lib. p.31O., Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: that can be retorted, D.H. Rh. 9.5 (as v.l., cf. ἀγχι-).

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐξ ἀντιστρόφου by an inverted construction (cf. ἀντιστροφή II.2), Hdn. Fig. p.102S.

children.label: IV
children.definition: antistrophic, Arist. Pr. 918b27, etc.: esp. Subst. ἀντίστροφος (sc. ᾠδή), ἡ, antistrophe, Id. Rh. 1409a26, D.H Comp. 19, etc.; also of members in a rhet. period, ἐν στροφῇ καὶ ἀντιστρόφῳ Hermog. Id. 1.11.

children.label: V
children.definition: wheeling both ways, A. Supp. 882 codd.

children.label: VI
children.definition: retorting a charge, Procop. Arc. 17.

children.label: VII
children.definition: ἀντίστροφος, ἡ, = ἀπόστροφος Sch. Ar. Pl. 3.
ἀντίστροφοι, name for the two upper ribs, Poll. 2.182.

children.label: VIII
children.definition: Adv. -φως crosswise, τὰς χεῖρας ἀλλήλαις ἐπιβάλλειν Gal. UP 5.14; inversely, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 10.5.4, cf. Diogenian. 3.30.
counter-senate, name given by Marius to his body-guard, Plu. Mar. 35, Sull. 8.
compare one with another, Nicom. Ar. 1.13:— Pass., ib. 20, Charito 6.1.
answer by syllogism, Arist. Rh. 1402a31, al.
give a counter-receipt, PFay. 73.1 (ii/iii A.D.), al.
counter-receipt, PFay. 73, al., PGrenf. 2.23, PLond. 1.15.3.
give contrary advice, Stob. 2.6.2.
to be helped in return, ὑπό τινος Longin. 17.1.
write a Symposium in rivalry of Plato, Luc. Lex. 1.
