anoint in return, τὸν συναλείψαντα Phld. Vit. p.30J.
meet face to face, AP 12.227.
meet in opposite directions, dub. in Gal. 18(2).727.
protecting against fistula, κολλύριον Aët. 15.13.
play at ball against, οἱ ἀντισφαιριοῦντες parties about to play in a match, X. Lac. 9.5.
slaughter in turn, D.C. 45.47 (in aor. 2 Pass.).
counter-wedge which drives out another, Ph. Bel. 67.32.
ἔνθεν καὶ ἔνθεν ἀ. form an obstacle by tension, Hp. Art. 3.
sealed copy, SIG 785.12 ( Chios).
meet one figure by another, D.H. Rh. 9.14.
the use of such figures in turn, D.H. Rh. 9.14
to be stiff in maintaining a contrary opinion, Th. 3.44; πρός τι Plu. Vit.pud. 2.535e.
strong to resist, Hsch.
repel by force, LXX Wi. 7.30, D.C. 48.11.
Hp. Fract. 11, S. Ph. 830 (lyr.), Th. 1.7 [codd. often confuse -ίσχων, -ισχών].
preserve in turn, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. δυσκλεές, Aristid. 1.418J.
equalization, Iamb. Protr. 21.ιθ.
opposing force, D.S. 11.67, Plu. Cleom. 23; of a person, ‘a political force’, Nic. 2, Luc. 38.
one must array against, τι πρός τι Plu. Sanit. 2.127f.
Pass.) one must make resistance, πρός τινα Arist. Top. 134a4.
fit for resistance, πρός τι Plu. Amat. 2.759e.
contrary, opposed, τῶν πραγμάτων ἐχόντων τι-ον Hierocl. p.60A.
APl. 16.221 ( Theaet.); put into the opposite scale, Lib. Decl. 43 Intr. 2.
= Lat. pro quaestore, SIG 745 ( Rhodes, i B.C.), J. AJ 14.12.13, D.C. 41.43, etc., prob. in IG 14.356 ( Halaesa); cf. ἀντιστράτηγος.

a setting in array against, ἡ σφετέρα ἀ. τῶν τριήρων their ships ranged for battle, Th. 7.17; ἀ. ποιεῖσθαι πρός τινα, = ἀντιτάσσεσθαι, Id. 5.8, cf. Phld. Piet. 12; contest, of bulls fighting, Hierocl. p.11A.
opposition, D.H. 10.57, Plu. QConv. 2.663b, Andronic. Rhod. p.572M.
stir up in opposition, Max.Tyr. 14.7.
stretching the contrary way, e.g. in the setting of a dislocated limb, Hp. Art. 75.
opposition, resistance, πᾶσαν ἀ. ἀντιτείνειν Pl. Lg. 781c.

set opposite to, range in battle against, τὸ ἄριστον ἀ. Πέρσῃσι Hdt. 5.110; τίνʼ ἀντιτάξεις τῷδε; A. Th. 395, cf. 408, etc.; ἀ. τὸν νόμον πρὸς τὴν ἀναίδειαν set the law in opposition to their impudence, Aeschin. 3.16, cf. Isoc. 9.61, etc.:—so in Med., πρὸς τὸ ἐμπειρότερον αὐτῶν τὸ τολμηρότερον ἀντιτάξασθε Th. 2.87; τῶν Ἑλλήνων τινὰ ἀρετὴν τῇ Ξέρξου δυνάμει ἀντιτάξασθαι Id. 3.56.

data.quote: πρὸς τὸ ἐμπειρότερον αὐτῶν τὸ τολμηρότερον ἀντιτάξασθε
τῶν Ἑλλήνων τινὰ ἀρετὴν τῇ Ξέρξου δυνάμει ἀντιτάξασθαι

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., set oneself against, meet face to face, ἀντιτάξομαι κτενῶν σε E. Ph. 622, cf. Th. 4.55, etc.; περί τῶν πρωτείων ἡμῖν ἀντιτάξασθαι D. 3.27:— Pass., to be drawn out in array against, τινί Hdt. 4.134, X. HG 3.1.6; πρὸς τὸ διπλήσιον Hdt. 7.103; πόλιν -ομένην πρὸς πόλιν X. Cyr. 3.1.18, etc.; κατά τινας Id. HG 4.2.18; τὸ ἀντιτετάχθαι ἀλλήλοις τῇ γνώμῃ Th. 3.83: abs., dub. in E. Supp. 1144.
oppose, resist, Plb. 31.25.8, Act.Ap. 18.6, Ep.Rom. 13.2, etc.
set against, compare, LXX Pr. 3.15 ( Pass.).
dig a trench in opposition, Ph. Bel. 93.26.
stretch, strain back, εἰς τοὔπισθεν τὰ σπαπτία Arist. Pr. 888a20; τὰς ἡνίας Plu. Lib.educ. 2.13d.
stretch out or offer in return, νήπἰ ἀντὶ νηπίων E. Med. 891.

children.label: II
children.definition: act or strive against, resist, ἐπιβουλίᾳ Pi. N. 4.37; τινί Hdt. 7.161, Pl. R. 547b, etc.; παντὶ λόγῳ Id. Phd. 91c; πρός τι Phdr. 256a, Arist. EN 1126b15 ( πρός = with respect to): abs., Hdt. 7.219, S. Ant. 714, etc.; οὐκ ἀντέτεινον, ἀλλʼ εἶκον Hdt. 8.3; ὑπείκει καὶ οὐκ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 727d; δύο ἄνδρες ἀντιτείνοντες pulling one against the other, Hp. Fract. 15.
lie over against, τινι Plu. Them. 8.
erect counter-fortifications, πρὸς τὰς μηχανάς J. AJ 14. 16.2; trans., fortify instead, τὸ καταρριφθὲν τοῖς σώμασι Id. BJ 5.8.2: metaph., τῷ τέλει τῆς ἡδονῆς Ph. 1.426 ( Pass.).
counter-fortification, Th. 2.77, Ath. 13.602d (pl.).
cut against, i.e. as a remedy or antidote, φάρμακα . . ἀντιτεμὼν βροτοῖσι E. Alc. 972 (lyr.).
delight in return, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.334a ( Pass.).

definition: ἀντιτεταγμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀντιτάσσω,

children.definition: in the opposite sense, τῷ ποιεῖν Plot. 5.3.15.
throw at dice, Eub. 57.3.
make in opposition, ἀντιτέτυκτο Antim. 35 codd.
use art in turn, D.H. Rh. 9.5:—also in Med., πρός τι J. AJ 1.19.8.
contrive in opposition, counter-plan, τάδε Hdt. 5.70; τινί Max.Tyr. 32.9: abs., Plu. Sert. 18; πρός τι J. AJ 14.16.2.
to be a rival in art, Sch. Ar. V. 1402.
counter-manoeuvring, emulation, Th. 7.70, D.H. 14.10.
professional rival, Gal. 5.655.

rival in an art or craft, Ar. Ra. 816, Pl. R. 493a, etc.; οὐκ ἐκείνῳ οὐδὲ τοῖς ποιήμασιν αὐτοῦ Id. Phd. 60d, cf. Lg. 817b; ἀ. καὶ ὁμότεχνος τοῖς ποιηταῖς D.Chr. 12.46: c. gen., τῆς μαγγανείας αὐτοῦ Luc. Alex. 43.

data.quote: οὐκ ἐκείνῳ οὐδὲ τοῖς ποιήμασιν αὐτοῦ

children.definition: maintain in turn, Arr. Epict. 2.20.14.
set against or so as to oppose, θαλασσαίαισι δίναις ἀντιθέντα μένος στάλας Simon. 57 (dub.).

children.label: b
children.definition: set against so as to balance, contrast, or compare, τὠυτὸ ἀντιθήσω ἐκείνῳ Hdt. 1.207, cf. 8.66; δύο γὰρ ἀντίθες δυοῖν E. Or. 551: also c. gen., ἀ. τὴν Ἀθηναίων ἐκ πολλοῦ ἐμπειρίαν τῆς σφετέρας ἐξ ὀλίγου μελέτης Th. 2.85, cf. 3.56: with a Prep., ἀ. τι πρός τι D. 21.175:— Pass., to be contrasted, τινί or πρός τι, Pl. Sph. 257d, 258e.

data.quote: ἀ. τὴν Ἀθηναίων ἐκ πολλοῦ ἐμπειρίαν τῆς σφετέρας ἐξ ὀλίγου μελέτης

children.definition: ἀ. τινί τινα match one against the other in battle, ἴσους ἴσοισι . . ἀντιθείς E. Ph. 750, cf. Ar. Eq. 353:— Pass., to be matched one against another, of counteracting tendencies, Hdt. 4.50; of opposing motives, Id. 8.83.
retort, rejoin, ἀντίθες παρρησίᾳ ὅπως . . E. El. 1049; ἀντιθεῖσʼ ἀμείψομαι Id. Tr. 917; ἀ. ὅτι . . Th. 6.18.
oppose, resist, πρὸς τὸν Δία Arr. Epict. 3.24.24, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: place or deposit in return, ἀντιθέντας ἐν ναοῖς ἢ χαλκὸν ἢ . . E. Hipp. 620, cf. X. Mem. 3.14.1; ἀ. τί τινος give one thing for another, τήν ἐνθάδʼ Αὖλιν ἀντιθεῖσα τῆς ἐκεῖ E. IT 358.

data.quote: ἀντιθέντας ἐν ναοῖς ἢ χαλκὸν ἢ . .
τήν ἐνθάδʼ Αὖλιν ἀντιθεῖσα τῆς ἐκεῖ

children.definition: honour in return, τινά X. HG 3.1.13; τινὰ πᾶσι τοῖς καλοῖς Id. Cyr. 5.2.11, etc.:— fut. Med. in pass.sense, Id. Oec. 9.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. as law-term, make a counter-estimate of damages, c. gen. pretii, Pl. Ap. 36b, D. 24.138.

definition: ἀντιτίμημα, ατος, τό, glossed by ἀντιτῑμ-ησις, εως, ἡ, Hsch.

children.definition: of equal worth, Ἀθηνᾶ 20 p.163 ( Chios), and ἀντίτῑμα· τὰ ἄποινα, τὰ ἀντέκτιτα, Hsch.
avenge oneself on, τινά E. IT 357, Th. 3.82, Plb. 1.81.9: abs., revenge oneself, take vengeance, Ar. Pax 134, 626:—a fut. Pass. occurs in Sch. Lyc. 1337.

definition: ἀντιτιμώρημα, ατος, τό, and ἀντιτῑμωρ-ία, ἡ,

children.definition: vengeance, revenge, Sch. Lyc. 1297.

definition: ἀντιτιμώρησις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Gal. 6.138, al.
ἀντιτιμωρητέον, dub. in Gal. UP 2.8 codd. (misquoting Hp. Acut. 37. β).

children.definition: Eust. 1346.3, Hsch.
suffer punishment for a thing, τι Thgn. 741: abs., S. Aj. 1086: generally, repay, χάριτάς τινι Eust. 142.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., exact or inflict in turn, ἐμῆς ἀγωγῆς ἀντιτείσασθαι φόνον exact death as a punishment for . ., A. Ag. 1263; πόσιν δίκην (codd. δίκῃ) τῶνδʼ ἀντιτείσασθαι κακῶν exact a penalty from him for these evil deeds, E. Med. 261, cf. Lyc. 1367. [On the quantity v. τίνω.]
wound in turn, Sch. E. Hipp. 507: plpf. Pass. ἀντετέτρωτο Hld. 7.27.
striking full on the bulwarks, ἀκτίς Tim. Pers. 12.
dare to stand against another, abs., Th. 2.89; πρὸς τολμηρούς Id. 7.21.
boldly attacking, A. Eu. 553 (lyr.).
cut as a remedy for an evil:— Subst. ἀντίτομον, τό, remedy, antidote, h.Cer. 229, Hsch.; ἀντίτομα ὀδυνᾶν antidotes for pains, Pi. P. 4.221.

children.label: II
children.definition: having opposite curvatures for cutting, Paul.Aeg. 6.30.
to have a different accent from, τινί Eust. 1025.4.
strained against, resisting, Pl. Ti. 62c; of a bow, APl. 16.211.4 (Stat. Flacc.).
Subst. ἀντίτονα, τά, guy-ropes securing torsion-engines, Plu. Marc. 15, Ph. Bel. 99.47.
shoot arrows in return, X. An. 3.3.15, Philostr. Im. 1.6.
bore right through, c. gen., δόρυ χροὸς ἀντετόρησεν Il. 5.337: c. acc., πυκινὸν δόμον ἀντιτορήσας having broken it open, ib. 10.267, cf. h.Merc. 178.
piercing, Eust. 672.30.

definition: ἄντιτος (by haplology for ἀντίτιτος, which occurs in Hsch.), ον,

children.definition: requited, revenged, ἄ. ἔργα the work of revenge, Od. 17.51, 60; ἄ. ἔργα παιδός revenge for her son, Il. 24.213, cf. Call. Iamb. 1.160.
the eminence of the external ear, Aret. CD 1.2, Poll. 2.85, Ruf. ap. Orib. 25.1.7.
to be exasperated in turn, πρός τινα Eust. 467.9.
sustain, maintain in turn, X. Cyr. 8.3.38.
rub in return, Plot. 6.1.20 ( Pass.).

meet with in return, τινός Simon. 128, Thgn. 1334; ἀ. ἐπικουρίας ἀπό τινος Th. 6.87; ἀ. μάχας fall into quarrel, Pi. N. 7.42; κρείττονος Prov. ap. Plb. 15.16.6; ἀ. χοιπάδος hit upon a rock, Opp. H. 4.480; πλείστων ἀ. ἀέθλων IG 4.682 ( Hermione).

children.label: II
children.definition: ὁ ἀντιτυγχάνων any chance person, GDI 1918, al. (Delph.).

ἁ βωλὰ ἁντιτυχόνσα the council for the time being, IG 4.554 ( Argos); οἱ ἔφοροι . . ἀεὶ οἱ ἀντιτυγχάνοντες ib. 5(1).1146 ( Gythium, i B.C.), cf. 7.3080 (Lebad.), 5(2).266 ( Mantinea, i B.C.), Delph. 3(1).294 v5.
beat drums in rivalry with, βρονταῖς prob. cj. in Anon. Vat.42.

strike against, esp. of a hard body, τινί Arist. Mete. 370b18; resist, τὰ ἁπτὰ ἀ. τὴν ἁφήν Phld. Sign. 18; πεδίου μὴ ἀντιτυποῦντος τῇ ὁπλῇ Luc. Dom. 10; προσάλληλα Ach.Tat. 2.38: abs., Hp. Mul. 2.177; τὸ εἶκον καὶ μὴ ἀντιτυποῦν Pl. Cra. 420d:—also in Med., Hp. Mul. 1.61.
resisting, repellent, Hdn. 6.7.7; συγκρίσεις Epicur. Nat. 2.9; of αἴσθησις, Stoic. 2.115.
hard, Alex.Aphr. de An. 125.9; ἀ. καὶ στερρὸν ὁ πόνος Ph. 2.162.

children.label: II
children.definition: clashing, dissonant, D.H. Comp. 22, al.
collision, Olymp. in Mete. 204.19.
resistance of a hard body, Phld. Sign. 34, Mus. p.30 K., S.E. P. 3.39, Aret. SD 1.14, Corp.Herm. 2.6, Plot. 2.6.2, Plu. Exil. 2.599d (pl.); repercussion, Cass. Pr. 26.
reflection, Plot. 4.4.29.
surface of a solid, Theol.Ar. 18, Iamb. Comm.Math. 8.

definition: ἀντίτυπος, ον, rarely η, ον, v. infr. II.1a: ( τύπτω): —

children.definition: repelled by a hard body, τύπος ἀ. blow and counter-blow, of the hammer and anvil, Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.67, cf. 68; of sound, echoed, echoing, στόνος S. Ph. 694 (lyr.), 1460 (lyr.), cf. APl. 16.154 ( Luc. or Arch.); κατὰ τὸ ἀ. by repercussion, of an echo, Luc. Dom. 3; of light, reflected, ἀκτῖνες Tryph. 519, cf. AP 9.822.

corresponding, as the stamp to the die, ἅγια ἀ. τῶν ἀληθινῶν figuring or representing the true, Ep.Hebr. 9.24, cf. 1 Ep.Pet. 3.21; ἀ. τοῖς δακρύοις χάριτα IG 14.1320; resembling, c. dat., Nonn. D. 26.327; μίμημα ib. 8.23: hence, feigned, counterfeit, 1.423, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: corresponding, φιλότης mutual affection, 13.552.

children.label: c
children.definition: Subst. ἀντίτυπος, ὁ, or ἀντίτυπον, τό, image, Ἄμμωνος κεραοῦ χάλκεον ἀ. Epigr.Gr. 835 ( Berytus); ἀντίτυπον, τό, = ἀντίγραφον, reproduction, copy, POxy. 1470.6 (iv A.D.): metaph., antitype, Plot. 2.9.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., repelling, as a hard body does: hence,

firm, resistent, χωρίον Hp. Art. 43; rigid, inelastic, AP 9.739 ( Jul.Aegypt.); -ώτερα ὄντα, of a horseʼs fetlocks, X. Eq. 1.4; ἀντιτύπᾳ δʼ ἐπὶ γᾷ πέσε S. Ant. 134; οἱ ἐν ἀντιτύποις περίπατοι walking on hard ground, Arist. Pr. 885a36; ἀντιτυπώτατον εἶδος, expl. of σκληρόν, most resistent, Pl. Ti. 62c.

children.label: b
children.definition: stubborn, obstinate, ἄνθρωποι Id. Tht. 156a; μάχη ἀ. X. Ages. 6.2; harsh-sounding, ἁρμονίαι D.H. Comp. 22, cf. 16; ἀ. ἀκοῦσαι Ael. NA 12.15; of colour, glaring, Plu. Dem. 22.

opposed to, ἦθος δόλιον πίστιος ἀντίτυπον the reverse of . ., Thgn. 1244; ἀ. Διός the adversary of Zeus, A. Th. 521 (lyr.); adverse, of events, X. HG 6.3.11: simply, ἀ. τινι opposite, over against, Plb. 6.31.8.
express as by a figure, χρώμασι . . χάριν AP 1.36 ( Agath.).
beat in turn, Ar. Nu. 1424, Antipho 4.4.3; τυπτόμενον ἀντιτύπτειν Pl. Cri. 51a.
an image impressed, impression, Orib. 45.3.3.
set up a counter-tyranny, Lyd. Mag. 2.1.
blind in return, Mich. in EN 31.27.
ridicule in turn, Conon 49.3.
reflect light, Thphr. Sens. 26:— Pass., ἀντιφαίνομαι, aor. ἀντεφάνην, appear face to face, Hes. Cat.Oxy. 1359 i 5.
reflection, Damian. Opt. 12.

definition: ἀντιφάρα, ἡ, ( φάρω, Dor. for φέρω)

children.definition: dispute, EM 114.19, Hsch.; so ἀντιφαρές· ἐναντίον, Id.
antidote, Arist. Mir. 837a18, Ceb. 26, Ath. 3.84f, Ruf. Fr. 58.1, Apollon. ap. Philum. Ven. 33.6, Dsc. 1.125:— Adj. -κός, ἡ, ἀ. ῥίζα D.S. 17.90.

definition: ἀντίφασις, εως, ἡ, ( ἀντίφημι) in Logic,

children.definition: contradiction of propositions, Arist. Int. 17a33, APo. 72a12, Metaph. 1011b23, 1055b1, al.; ἐξ ἀντιφάσεως per contra, Porph. Chr. 58; ἐξ ἀντιφάσεως συλλογισμός, e.g. ‘either there is day or there is not day’, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.87; ἡ κατʼ ἀντίφασιν ἐρώτησις, e.g. ‘Does A possess B or not?ʼ, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 81.35, cf. 103.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: contradictory proposition, Arist. Int. 22a39, APr. 34b29, al.

contradict, ἑαυτῷ Olymp. in Mete. 181.11; to be in contradiction, Simp. in Ph. 1155.28; τὰ ἀντιφάσκοντα contradictories, Id. in Cat. 44.21, cf. 19.21; ὁ ἀντιφάσκων the opponent in argument, Phld. Po. 2.54.
contradictory, only in Adv. -κῶς Arist. Int. 17b17, 22a34.

set oneself against, measure oneself with, οὔ τις σοίγε . . δύνατʼ ἀντιφερίζειν Il. 21.357; κακὸν ἐσλῷ Hes. Th. 609; ὅτι μοι μένος ἀντιφερίζεις Il. 21.488; σὺ Θεμιστοκλεῖ ἀντιφερίζεις; Ar. Eq. 813, cf. 818; ἀ. πὰρ σοφόν Pi. P. 9.50.
instead of a dower, ἀ. φθορά A. Ag. 406 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀντίφερνα, τά, = donatio propter nuptias, Cod.Just. 5.3.20.

set against, Pl. Erx. 395b; ἀ. πόλεμον ἐπί τινι AP 7.438 ( Damag.): used by Hom. only in Med. or Pass., set oneself against, fight against another, ἀντεφέροντο μάχη Il. 5.701; ἀργαλέος γὰρ Ὀλύμπιος ἀντιφέρεσθαι hard to oppose, 1.589, cf. Od. 16.238: c. acc. cogn., μένος ἀ. τινί match oneself with another in strength, Il. 21.482; τίς Ὁμηρείοις ἀντιφέροιτο λόγοις; AP 9.625 ( Maced.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be borne in a contrary direction to, τῷ οὐρανῷ Arist. Cael. 291b2, cf. Ph. 215a30; τῷ παντὶ τὴν φοράν Theo Sm. p.134 H.
flee or go into exile in turn, ἀντί τινος E. El. 1091.
say ‘no’, contradict, abs., Pl. Grg. 501c, Arist. APr. 65b1; ἀ. τινί contradict a thing, Id. Insomn. 462a7; πρός τι ib. 460b19.
return a sound, echo, repeat, E. Hipp. 1216; τὸ ἀκουσθέν Arist. GA 781a26.

children.label: II
children.definition: speak against, contradict, J. AJ 18.7.2, Luc. Salt. 23, Pisc. 31, S.E. M. 7.332, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: answer, Pi. O. 6.61.

children.label: IV
children.definition: raise a shout in reply, D.S. 17.33.
echo, Sch.rec. S. El. 109.
of answering sound, concordant, c. gen., Pi. Fr. 125; imitative, AP 7.191 ( Arch.).
love in return, Pl. Ly. 212d, Theoc. 12.16, 23.6, Arist. EN 1157b30:— Pass., Pl. Ly. 212c, X. Mem. 2.6.28, Arist. EN 1159a30, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: kiss in return, AP 5.284 ( Agath.).
return of affection, Arist. EN 1155b28.
mutual affection, Arist. EE 1236b2.
vie in ambition, πρός τινα Plb. 1.40.11.
strive jealously against, πρὸς πάντα Plb. 3.103.7; τῇ συγκλήτῳ 32.3.16: abs., J. AJ 2.9.1. [on νεικ- vs. νικ- see φιλονικέω entry]
hold contrary tenets, τῆ στοᾷ Luc. Bis Acc. 21; τῷ τυράννῳ LXX 4 Ma. 8.15.
to be moved by jealousy against, πρὸς τὴν βουλήν D.H. 6.96, cf. Plu. Per. 14; τῆ ἀρετῆ Max.Tyr. 14.7: plpf. ἀντεπεφιλοτίμητο D.C. 59.19; in good sense, show public spirit in return, D.Chr. 32.95.
set up a vicious circle with, ταῖς νόσοις Sever. Clyst. 4.
receive kindly in turn, J. AJ 14.11.5; also, rival, Plu. Sert. 20.
light up again or to meet one, αὐτῷ ὅλον ὀφθαλμὸν ἀντέφλεξε Μήνα Pi. O. 3.20.
talk nonsense against, τοῖς φλυαροῦσιν ἀ. Gal. 8.696, 9.923.
frighten in turn, Ael. NA 12.15.

definition: ἀντιφολκός μέρος τῆς πολεμικῆς νεώς, Hsch.

children.definition: murder in return, Sch. E. Or. 415.
in revenge for blood, ποινὰς ἀντιφόνους ἄτας A. Eu. 982; δώσουσʼ ἀντιφόνους δίκας S. El. 248; ἀντίφονον κορέσαι στόμα Id. Ph. 1156.

children.label: II
children.definition: θάνατοι ἀ. deaths by mutual slaughter, A. Th. 893.—Trag. word, but only in lyric passages.
contrary motion, Simp. in Cael. 156.20.
take in a return-cargo, Str. 5.3.5, Peripl.M.Rubr. 32; but the Med. is more usual in same sense, D. 35.25 and 37: so metaph., Hp. Ep. 17; τίμημα ἀ. τοῦ ἔργου Procop. Arc. 20.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. also, import in exchange for exports, X. Vect. 3.2; take as return-freight, ἀργύριον Arist. Mir. 844a18.
Pass., χρήματα . . ἀντιφορτισθέντα goods received in exchange for the cargo, Syngr. ap. D. 35.11, cf.ib. 24.
return-freight, Arg.1 Ar. Ach.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. ἀντίφορτον, τό, load which balances another, BGU 248.27 (i A.D.).
counter-fence, bulwark, πρός τι Plu. Vind. 2.558d.
translate, Gal. 11.793.

children.label: II
children.definition: express by antithesis or negation, Trypho Trop. 2.15 ( Pass.).
barricading, γῆς ἀ. the interposition of the earth, so as to cause a lunar eclipse, Arist. APo. 90a16, cf. Mete. 367b21; so ἥλιον ἐκλείπειν σελήνης ἀντιφράξει Id. Fr. 210, cf. Plu. Superst. 2.169a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pythag. name for seventeenth day of the month, ib. 367f.

definition: ἀντίφρασις, εως, ἡ, ( ἀντιφράζω) Rhet. and Gramm.,

children.definition: antiphrasis, i.e. the use of words of good sense in place of those of a contrary sense, Εὐμενίδες for Ἐρινύες, πόντος εὔξεινος for ἄξεινος, Ath. 3.90b; or οὐδʼ ἄρα . . γήθησεν for ἐλυπήθη, Trypho Trop. 2.15; κατʼ ἀντίφρασιν Corn. ND 4, Erot. s.v. ἀσήμοις, Herm. in Phdr. p.176A., Porph. Chr. 87.

children.label: II
children.definition: expression by means of negation, Anon. Fig. p.212S.
barricade, block, τὴν ὁδόν τισι Plu. Vind. 2.548d:— Pass., to be screened, ἀντιπεφραγμένος λαμπτήρ lantern, Philist. 15; τόπος ὑπὸ τῆς γῆς -φραττόμενος Plu. Nic. 23.

children.label: II
children.definition: stand in the way of, τῷ ἀέρι Arist. Juv. 470a13, cf. Pr. 929a38; esp. of a body intercepting the sunʼs light, ὅσοις ἀντιφράττει ἡ γῆ ὥστε μὴ ὁρᾶσθαι ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου . . Id. Mete. 345a29: c. acc., ἕκαστον ἀντιφράττειν αὐτήν (sc. τὴν σελήνην) Id. Cael. 293b25. abs., X. Smp. 5.6, Thphr. Ign. 49; ἡ γῆ ἀ. Arist. APo. 87b40; ἡ θάλαττα ἀ. Id. Mete. 368b10; κωλύει τὸ ἀλλότριον καὶ ἀ. Id. de An. 429a20.

data.quote: ὅσοις ἀντιφράττει ἡ γῆ ὥστε μὴ ὁρᾶσθαι ὑπὸ τοῦ ἡλίου . .

children.definition: Pass., to be placed as an obstacle, τινὸς ἀντιφραχθέντος περὶ τὴν ἀναπνοήν Pl. Ti. 66e.
by way of ἀντίφρασις, Eust. 399.38.
bristle up in self-defence, Arist. HA 630a2.

definition: ἀντίφρουρος τὴν ἴσην ἔχων φρουράν, Hsch.

children.definition: a watching against one another, πρὸς ἀλλήλους Th. 2.84: pl., D.C. 77.2, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 28.
watch in turn, Pl. Lg. 705e:— Med., to be on oneʼs guard in turn, X. An. 2.5.3, cf. Plu. Demetr. 36.
blow against, Antyll. ap. Orib. 9.23.11.
implant in turn: metaph., ἔρις ἔριν ἀ. Ps.-Phoc. 78.
to be of contrary nature, Hsch.
sound in answer, reply, rejoin, abs., A. Eu. 303, S. Ant. 271, etc.; esp. answer in a loud voice, Plu. Mar. 19, etc.
ἀ. ἔπος utter a word in reply, S. Aj. 773; πόλλʼ ἀ. Id. El. 1501; ἀ. Ἔρωτας, of a lute, sound love strains in reply, Anacreont. 23.9.
reply to, answer, μή μʼ ἀντιφώνει μηδέν S. Ph. 1065.

answer by letter, τινί Plb. 8.16.11, POxy. 805 (i B.C.), al.: abs., Plb. 8.17.8:— Pass., to be received in answer, ἐκ Ῥώμης Id. 15.18.6, cf. J. AJ 14.10.26; but -πεφωνημένα ἐκ τῶν δημοσίων δέλτων ἀντίγραφα copies taken from . ., OGI 453.26 ( M.Antonius).
controvert, disagree with, τινί S.E. M. 7.327; to be discordant with, -φωνοῦντος τοῦ νῦν βίου τῷ βιβλίῳ Luc. Apol. 4.

children.label: II
children.definition: = constituere, Anon. de Actionibus in Zeitschr.d.Savigny-Stiftung 1893 p. 92.
answer by letter, POxy. 294.12 (i A.D.), BGU 1204.4 (i B.C.).
one who answers for, is responsible for another, POxy. 136.39 (vi A.D.).
sounding in answer, concordant, as in the octave, ὀξύτητα βαρύτητι σύμφωνον καὶ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 812d: abs., ἁρμονίαι Ph. 2.485.
responsive to, c. gen., στεναγμάτων E. Supp. 800 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: discordant, contradictory, Plu. Isid. 2.361a, Corp.Herm. 16.1: c. gen., τῶν γενησομένων Plu. Def.orac. 2.412b.

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst., ἀντίφωνον, τό, concord in the octave, τὸ ἀ. σύμφωνόν ἐστι διὰ πασῶν Arist. Pr. 918b30, 921a8.

data.quote: τὸ ἀ. σύμφωνόν ἐστι διὰ πασῶν

children.definition: to be directly exposed to light, -ομένου ὄμματος Dam. Pr. 29.
reflection of light, Plu. QConv. 2.625e; πρὸς τὴν σελήνην Id. Nic. 21.
rehisco, Gloss.
rejoice in turn or answer, Νίκα ἀντιχαρεῖσα Θήβᾳ S. Ant. 149.
to be embittered against, D.H. 17.5, Plu. Tranq. 2.468b.

definition: ἀντιχάλημα (leg. -χέλυσμα) · μέρος τι τῆς μακρᾶς νεώς, Hsch.

children.definition: forge against, in Med., πρὸς τὰς μαχαίρας κράνη ὁλοσίδηρα Polyaen. 8.7.2.
show kindness in return, τινί Hdt. 7.114, X. Cyr. 4.1.20, Ph. 2.26, etc.
acknowledgement of a favour, Heliod. in EN 95.18, Lib. Decl. 43.29.
yawn in answer to, τοῖς χασμωμένοις Arist. Pr. 886a24, 887a4.

definition: ἀντίχειρ (sc. δάκτυλος, which is supplied in Heliod. ap. Orib. 48.54.1, S.E. M. 1.137, Gp. 4.12.13), ὁ,

children.definition: thumb, as being opposite to the fingers, Sor. 1.103, Dsc. 5.79, Plu. Amat. 2.761c, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: responsive to the touch, βόμβοι κυμβάλων Diog.Trag. 1.4 (Casaubon).

children.label: III
children.definition: Subst. (sc. σωλήν, inverse tube of alembic, Zos.Alch. p.225B.
thumb-breadth, Hero *Geom. 4.11; also ὁ ἀντίχειρος δάκτυλος thumb, Antyll. ap. Orib. 7.9.8.
vote against, abs., Th. 6.13, 24, Ar. Ec. 423; ἀ. ὡς . . D. 59.5; τινί Max.Tyr. 17.5.
contrary vote, Poll. 2.150.
opposite or counter-earth, in the Pythag. system, Arist. Cael. 293a24, Metaph. 986a12, Placit. 2.7.7.
southern hemisphere, Cic. Tusc. 1.28.68; ἀ. ζώνη Jul. Or. 5.173c: in pl., people of the southern hemisphere, Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 30, Plin. HN 6.81.
concordant, Hsch.: but,

children.label: II
children.definition: in reply or opposition to, τοῖς πεφιλοσοφημένοις Plu. QConv. 2.663f.
dance in harmony, Nonn. D. 22.44.
to be a rival choragus, And. 4.42; ἀ. τινί rival him in the choragia, D. 21.62.

children.label: II
children.definition: furnish in return, J. BJ 2.20.8 ( Pass.).
rival choragus, And. 4.20, D. 21.59.
odes sung alternately by two semichori, Poll. 4.107.
to be sufficient, only in aor. 1, ὁ ποταμὸς οὐκ ἀντέχρησε τῆ στρατιῆ πινόμενος Hdt. 7.127, cf. 187.

data.quote: ὁ ποταμὸς οὐκ ἀντέχρησε τῆ στρατιῆ πινόμενος

children.definition: transact business instead of another, PFlor. 382.59 (iii A.D.).
substitution of usufruct for interest, Dig. 20.1.11.1.
Antichrist, 1 Ep.Jo. 2.18, 22, etc.
use of one tense for another, Sch. E. Or. 82.

definition: ἀντιχρονισμός, ὁ, = foreg., Sch. E. Or. 48, Hdn. in An.Ox. 3.274.

children.definition: colour, tinge in turn, [ Lib.] Descr. 30.13.
raise an embankment against, πόλει Amynt. ap. Ath. 12.529e.
move in opposite direction, dub. l. in Porph. Sent. 11.
play a stringed instrument in accompaniment of song, ἀ. ἐλέγοις φόρμιγγα Ar. Av. 218.
responsive, harmonious, ᾠδάς E. IT 179 (lyr.).
E. Hec. 275.
blame in turn, Sch. A. Eu. 416.
obtrecto, Gloss.
vote against, πρός τι Plu. Lys. 27; τὸ ἀληθὲς τῷ λόγῳ ἀ. Lib. Or. 64.37.
voting against, τῷ θεῷ Pl. Alc. 2.150b.
given for life, Luc. Lex. 10.
ἀ. ἀποθανεῖν giving oneʼs own life for anotherʼs, D.C. 59.8.
οἱ Μέμνονος ὄρνιθες, Hsch.
cool, chill in turn, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.113.
feed with dainty morsels in rivalry, Arg. 1 Ar. Eq.
bale out bilge-water, bale the ship, Thgn. 673, Alc. 19.

draw water, ἀντλέει καὶ ἐγχέει Hdt. 6.119, Ev.Jo. 2.8, etc.; οἷον ἐκ κρήνης ἐπʼ ὀχετοὺς ἀ. draw as from a well, and pour into . ., Pl. Ti. 79a; διὰ χώνης τοῖσι βουλομένοις πιεῖν Pherecr. 108.31: prov. of labour in vain, ἠθμῷ ἀντλεῖν draw water in a sieve, Arist. Oec. 1344b25; εἰς τετρημένον πίθον ἀ. X. Oec. 7.40; but ἐκ πίθω ἀ. of one who has abundance in store, Theoc. 10.13; ἕτοιμον ἀ. Herod. 4.14.

children.label: II
children.definition: drain dry, i.e.,
use the utmost, make the most of, τὰν ἔμπρακτον ἄντλει μαχανάν Pi. P. 3.62: but more commonly,
drain to the dregs, τὴν παροῦσαν ἀντλήσω τύχην A. Pr. 377; τλημόνως ἤντλουν κακά Id. Ch. 748; λυπρὸν ἀντλήσει βίον E. Hipp. 898; δέκα ἀντλήσας ἔτη v.l. Id. Tr. 433.
squander, πατρῴαν κτῆσιν ἀντλεῖν S. El. 1291.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., ἀντλούμενος ὄλβῳ flooded with, Man. 4.92.
bucket for drawing water, Plu. Sollert. 2.974e, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1332, Ev.Jo. 4.11.
drawing up or emptying, Ruf. ap. Orib. 5.3.1, POxy. 971 (i/ii A.D.), Ael. VH 1.24.
one who draws water, Poll. 10.31; ληνῶν Man. 4.257.
Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: ladle, Ath. 10.424a.
of or for drawing up: τὸ ἀ. (sc. ἀγγεῖον) bucket, D.C. 50.34.
PLond. 1.131r311 (i A.D.), al., Ptol. Tetr. 179.
for irrigation, ἄξων POxy. 137.20 (vi A.D.); suitable for irrigation, κτήματα PFlor. 148.3 (iii A.D.).
irrigated, PAmh. 2.96.3, PFlor. 369.6 (ii A.D.).
she who draws up, priestess at the Thesmophoria, Sch. Luc. DDeor. 2.1.
hold of a ship, S. Ph. 482; τὴν ἀντλίαν φυλάξω Ar. Eq. 434; δεῖπνον . . ἐξ ἀντλίας ἥκοντα, i.e. the coarse food used by seamen, Dionys.Com. 2.41.
bilge-water, filth, Ar. Pax 17.
reservoir, BGU 1120.26 (i B.C.), PRyl. 92.5 (ii/iii A.D.).
Hsch.
bucket, Men. 30.

definition: ἀντλίον, τό, = foreg., Ar. Fr. 470, Epil. 5.
ἄντλος, ὁ, in Poll. 1.92 also ἄντλον, τό:—in Hom.,

children.definition: hold of a ship, Od. 12.411, 15.479.

bilge-water, πόλις . . ἄντλον οὐκ ἐδέξατο let in no water, metaph. for ‘let no enemy come in’, A. Th. 796; ἄντλον εἴργειν ναός pump out water from a ship, E. Tr. 691; εἰς ἄντλον ἐμβαίνειν πόδα, metaph. for getting into a difficulty, Id. Heracl. 168.
flood of water, Pi. O. 9.53; ἀλίμενον ὥς τις εἰς ἄντλον πεσών E. Hec. 1025 (lyr.); ἐν ἄντλῳ τιθέναι scuttle, sink, metaph., ὕβριν Pi. P. 8.12.

data.quote: ἀλίμενον ὥς τις εἰς ἄντλον πεσών

children.label: II
children.definition: bucket, Man. 6.424.

children.label: III
children.definition: heap of corn, threshed but not yet cleansed, Nic. Th. 114, 546, Q.S. 1.352, AP 6.258 ( Adaeus).
hurt in return, Sch. Theoc. 3.13.
lament in return, App. BC 1.10.
to be ἄντοικος (q.v.):— Pass., ἡ ἀντοικουμένη, Ptol. Geog. 1.8.1, cf. Ach.Tat. Intr.Arat. 30, Olymp. in Grg. p.541 J.
build or fortify against, Plb. 1.42.12, D.S. 16.49; τινά App. BC 2.61:— Med., Arr. An. 1.21.4: metaph., ἀ. τινι διατριβήν Ael. VH 4.9.
one must build against, Ph. Bel. 92.22.
building against, IG 11.165.15 ( Delos, iii B.C.), Plb. 1.48.1.
pl., those who live between the same meridian lines, but on the opposite side of the equator, Gem. 16.1, Cleom. 1.2.
pity in return, Th. 3.40.
= foreg., τινά E. Ion 312.
to be of contrary opinion, Pl. Tht. 178c.

definition: ἀντολή, ἡ, poet. for ἀνατολή, q.v.
ἀντολίη, ἡ, collat. poet. form of ἀνατολή, Androm. ap. Gal. 14.37, APl. 16.61 ( Crin., pl.), Epigr.Gr. 441 ( Trachonitis), al.; personified, PMag.Berol. 2.9.3.

children.definition: Adj., eastern, ἐν ἀντολίη . . ἀρούρη Nonn. D. 25.98.
from the east, Opp. C. 2.123; -θεν ib. 1.43, Man. 2.11, 3.49.
towards the east, D.P. 260.
bewail in turn, J. BJ 4.5.1.

definition: ἄντομαι, only pres. and impf.: ( ἀντί, ἄντα):—poet. Verb ( Hom. only in Il.),

children.definition: meet, Il. 2.595, al.; esp. in battle, c. dat., ἀλλήλοισιν ἄντεσθʼ ἐν πολέμῳ 15.698, cf. 16.788; ἀργύρῳ ἀντομένη . . ἐτράπετʼ αἰχμή 11.237; so χαλεπῇ ἤντ. θευμορίη Call. Epigr. 32: abs., διπλόος ἤντετο θώρηξ the breastplate opposed or stopped (the dart), Il. 4.133.
meet with favour, greet, Pi. P. 2.71.

children.label: II
children.definition: approach with prayers, entreat, πρός σε . . ἄντομαι Διός E. Alc. 1098; πρός σε γενειάδος . . ἄντομαι Id. Supp. 279 (lyr.); πρός σʼ ὅ τι σοι φίλον ἐκ σέθεν ἄντομαι S. OC 250; ἄ. Ἑρμῆν Ar. Th. 977; ἄ. ὑπέρ τινος beg in anotherʼs behalf, S. OC 243 (lyr.): abs., ἔλθετον, ἀντόμεθʼ Ar. Th. 1155 (lyr.).

data.quote: πρός σʼ ὅ τι σοι φίλον ἐκ σέθεν ἄντομαι

children.definition: swear in turn, swear on the other part, in a treaty, c. fut. inf., X. HG 3.4.6, Ages. 1.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: Att. law-term, make an affidavit, both of the accuser and the defendant (cf. ἀντωμοσία), Antipho 1.18, Is. 9.1, D. 43.3, etc.:—in Med., Is. 5.16.

definition: ἄντομος, ὁ, dialectic form of ἀνάτομος,

children.definition: stake or pale, cf. ἄντομοι· σκόλοπες ( Sicel), Hsch.: hence collectively, paling, boundary-fence, Tab.Heracl. 1.15, al.; also, road adjoining such a fence, ib. 2.13, al.

definition: ἀντομῶσαι παρακαλέσαι, Hsch. ἀντοναί· αἱ τῶν χειρῶν φοραί, Id.

children.definition: upbraid in return, τινί Eust. 1042.46.
serve mutually, dub. in Lib. Or. 5.53 codd.
name instead, call by a new name, c. dupl.acc., Th. 6.4.
ὁ -άζων ὅρος plea of avoidance and confession, Arg. Lycurg., cf. Hermog. Stat. 4.
nominate instead, Pass., POxy. 1405.17 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: use ἀντονομασίαι or rhetorical figures, Ar. Th. 55.
use the pronoun, Eust. 103.23; ἀ. τινά A.D. Synt. 192.21:— Pass., ib. 98.11.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be of a contrary denomination, Nicom. Ar. 1.23.
use of an epithet, patronymic, or appellative for a proper name, and vice versa, Trypho Trop. 2.17, Ps.-Plu. Vit.Hom. 24; ἀ. καὶ μετάληψις Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1014.19,20.
nomination of his successor by retiring official, POxy. 1642.15 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: pronoun, or the use of it, D.H. Comp. 2, A.D. Pron. 4.18.

children.label: III
children.definition: contrary denomination, Nicom. Ar. 1.23.
pronominal, cj. for ἀντωνυμικός (q.v.), D.H. Amm. 2.12.
surgical instrument, Hermes 38.281.
to be angry in turn, M.Ant. 6.26, Gal. 19.211.
stretch out, present in turn, Them. Or. 11.153a.
rise up in opposition, Hierocl. p.17A.

definition: ἄντορος, ὁ, dialectic form of ἄνθ-ορος,

children.definition: opposite boundary, counter-fence, Tab.Heracl. 1.60, al.
dig a countermine, Hdt. 4.200, Aen.Tact. 37.7: metaph., ἀ. ὀφθαλμούς Paus. 3.14.10.
imitate oneʼs dancing, Arist. HA 597b24, cf. Metrod. Sceps. 13.

definition: ἄντος εὖρος, οἱ δὲ Εὐριπίδης, Hsch.

children.definition: owe a good turn, to be indebted, Th. 2.40.

look in the face, meet face to face, ἀ. κατὰ πρόσωπον Plb. 18.46.12: hence, defy, withstand, τινί and πρός τινα, Id. 1.17.3, 2.24.1, etc., cf. LXX Wi. 12.14; ἀ. τῷ ἀνέμῳ, of a ship, Act.Ap. 27.15; πάθεσι Longin. 34.4.
looking straight in the face: hence, straightforward dealing, ἀ. πεποίηται πρὸς τοὺς πολίτας IG 5(1).1114.17.
looking in the face, Hsch. s.v. ἀντωπόν.
plant, Hsch.
drive or ride against, f.l. in Mosch. 2.119.
adhesion, Orib. 45.2.6, Gal. 19.440.

children.label: II
children.definition: attachment, c. gen., ἑαυτῶν, of rings, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.67: metaph., Procl. in Ti. 1.75 D.
fortify in turn, τὸ καταρριφθέν J. BJ 3.7.23.
haunting caves or grots, E. Fr. 13.
cave-dwelling, Antip.Sid. Oxy. 662.50.

definition: ἀντριάς, άδος, ἡ, = fem. of ἀντραῖος, Νύμφαι ἀ.

children.definition: grot-Nymphs, AP 6.224 ( Theodorid.), cf. Phryn. PS p.27B.
St.Byz. s.v. Ἄντρον.
living in caves, Orph. H. 32.3; of Pan, ib. 11.5.
like caves, Epicur. Ep. 2p.48U., Placit. 3.15.11.
from a cave, Pi. P. 4.102.
cave, Hom. only in Od., as 9.216, al., cf. Hes. Th. 483, Pi. P. 1.17, etc.; of a lion, A. Eu. 193; of a serpent, E. Ph. 232.

children.label: II
children.definition: inner chamber, closet, LXX 3 Ki. 16.18.
born in caves, ἀνθίαι Opp. H. 3.212.
cave-haunting, epith. of nymphs and Pan, Orph. H. 11.12, 51.5.
full of caves, πέτρα X. An. 4.3.11; τόπος Arist. Pr. 932a2; ὑπώρειαι Ph. Fr. 36H.; τὰ ἀ. Corn. ND 28.
like a cave, οἰκίαι Philostr. VS 2.23.3.
wearing a frontlet, Hsch.
edge or rim of anything round or curved; and so,

children.label: I
children.definition: Hom. (only in Il.):
rim of round shield, Il. 6.118, al., E. Rh. 373 (lyr.).

rail round front of chariot, ἐξ ἄντυγος ἡνία τείνας 5.262, 322; δοιαὶ δὲ περίδρομοι ἄντυγές εἰσι 5.728; καὶ ἄντυγες αἱ περὶ δίφρον 11.535: in pl. also S. Aj. 1030, Pl. Tht. 207a: in sg., μάρπτει δὲ . . ἡνίας ἀπʼ ἄντυγος E. Hipp. 1188.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom.:
the chariot itself, S. El. 746, E. Ph. 1193: sg., κατʼ ἄντυγα Νυκτὸς ὀπαδοί Theoc. 2.166, cf. Jul. Or. 3.122b.
bridge of the lyre, E. Hipp. 1135 (lyr.).

orbit of a planet, h.Hom. 8.8, Procl. H. 2.17; vault of heaven, ἄ. οὐρανίη AP 9.806, cf. 11.292 ( Pall.); ἄ. αἰθερίη IGRom. 4.607; orb, circle of the world, Nonn. D. 38.108; ἄ. ἡμίτομος . . σελάνας the disk of the half-moon, Mosch. 2.88.
Nonn., of the curve of the body, ἄ. μαζοῦ, μηρῶν, D. 1.348, 15.228, so perh. in Herod. 8.29.
outermost tier, in a theatre, ἡ ἐσχάτη ἄ. τοῦ θεάτρου Eun. VS p.489B.—Poet. word, used by Pl. l.c., Luc. D Deor. 24[25].2, in signf. I.2, cf. also II.5.

definition: ἄντυπος ἶσος, ὅμοιος, ἢ ἐναντίος, Hsch.

children.definition: lyric passage responding to ᾠδή, ἀ. καὶ ἀντιστροφή Sch. Ar. V. 1091, Nu. 298.
singing in answer, responsive, ἠχὼ λόγων ἀντῳδός Ar. Th. 1059; ἀ. πανὶ κρέκων κέλαδον AP 7.196 ( Mel.); μέλος ἀ. ἠχεῖν, of birds, Ael. NA 4.16.
push in the contrary direction, Hp. Fract. 39, cf. Ph. 2.354:— Pass., τὸ ὠθοῦν ἀντωθεῖται Arist. GA 768b19, cf. Mech. 851a3:— Med., push one against another, Theopomp.Hist. 283.
counter-thrust, Gal. 18(1).324, Phlp. in Ph. 646.19; prob. cj. for ἀντίθεσις in Paul.Aeg. 6.117.
shoulder to shoulder: ἄντωμοι, οἱ, = ἄντοικοι (q.v.), Cleom. 1.2.
oath or affidavit made by the prosecutor, Pl. Ap. 19b, Lys. 23.13; also, by the defendant, Is. 3.6, cf. Harp. s.v., Poll. 8.55.
buy instead, X. Oec. 20.26, Men. 438.3: metaph., κλέος ἀείμνηστον ἀ. Jul. Or. 1.42b.
bid against, ἐπεὶ οὐδεὶς ἀντεωνεῖτο And. 1.134; ἀ. ἀλλήλοις Lys. 22.9; ὁ ἀντωνούμενος rival bidder, D. 18.239.
have an opposite denomination, Theol.Ar. 41.
pronoun, D.H. Comp. 6, Plu. QPlat. 2.1009c, etc.; περὶ ἀντωνυμίας, title of work by A.D.

children.label: II
children.definition: interchange of names, Dam. Pr. 73.
pronominal, D.H. Amm. 2.12. Adv. -κῶς like a pronoun, A.D. Synt. 156.7, al.
Hld. 1.21, Heph.Astr. 1.24; πρὸς τὸ ἕν Dam. Pr. 118.

definition: ἀντῶπις, ιδος, = fem. of sq. [ἀντωπός], Nonn. D. 6.76.

children.definition: with the eyes front, facing, ἀντωπὰ βλέφαρα E. IA 564; ἀντωπὸς βλέψαι AP 12.196 ( Strat.); τῆς ὄψεως ἀντωπά front parts of the face, Luc. Im. 6; opposite, AP 10.14 ( Agath.); full in the face, βέλος APl. 16.134 ( Mel.); of an eagle, ἀ. ἁλίω Ecphant. ap. Stob. 4.7.64.
like, Opp. H. 5.7.
roar against or at, Sch. Luc. Par. 51.
pushing against or back, Arist. Resp. 480a14.
benefit in return, Mich. in EN 469.18.
assist or benefit in turn, τινά X. Mem. 2.10.3:— Pass., derive profit in turn, ib. 2.8.3, Cyr. 1.6.11.

definition: ἀνυβριστί, Adv. of sq. II, Anacr. 63.

children.definition: not insulted, PRyl. 117.26 (iii A.D.); τελευτή Plu. Pel. 9, cf. Luc. 18. Adv. -τως Ps.-Phoc. 157.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not insulting, decorous, παιδιαί Plu. Sert. 26; σκῶμμα Id. Aud. 2.46c; τὸ ἀ. τοῦ βίου Mult. 92d: Sup., D.Chr. 3.98. Adv. -τως Democr. 73.
incurable, Hsch. s.v. ἀναλθές.
unhealthy, Gloss.
moisten, Hp. Int. 51, Thphr. CP 2.6.1.
melt, soften, τὰ ἤθη Plu. Symp. 2.156d:— Pass., ib. Vind. 566a.
moistening, Archig. ap. Orib. 8.2.6.
without water, Man. 1.144.
draw up from a well, τὸν κάδον Pherecr. 76.
unwatered, Thphr. HP 7.4.6.
want of water, drought, Hp. Aër. 12, Th. 3.88, PPetr. 2p.22; lack of irrigation, PLond. ined. 2179 (iii A. D.).
κώμη PThead. 20.5 (iv A. D.).

waterless, of arid countries, Hes. Fr. 24, Hdt. 4.185; γῆ Hp. Aër. 1; δάπεδα Trag. ap. Phot.p.151 R.; esp. without spring-water, Hdt. 2.7 codd., cf. 149, 3.5; ἡ ἄνυδρος (sc. γῆ) Id. 3.4 and 9, Arist. Fr. 103, LXX Is. 44.3; of seasons, Hp. Aph. 3, 14; θέρος Id. Aër. 10; in E. Tr. 1085 (lyr.), of a corpse, deprived of funeral lustrations; unwatered, σμύρνα Id. Ion 89 (anap.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄνυδρον, τό, = στρύχνον μανικόν, Dsc. 4.73.
without barking, Suid. s.v. μαιουμᾶς.
treeless, τόμοι Thphr. CP 1.5.2 (v.l. ἄϋλος).
immaterial, Ascl. in Metaph. 26.4.
without the nuptial song, unwedded, S. Ant. 876, 917, E. Hec. 416, Men. 548, etc.; μοῖρα ἀ. S. OC 1221 (lyr.): neut.pl. as Adv., Id. El. 962, E. Ph. 347 (lyr.). Adv. -ως Sch.ad loc.
celebrate with nuptial ode, γάμους S. Fr. 725.
proclaim by an oracle, δίκαν E. El. 1190 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: celebrate in song, γάμον D.H. Rh. 2.1, cf. Jul. Or. 5.172d, Chor. p.127 B. [1.2.1], Procop.Gaz. Ep. 52, Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 4 ( Pass.): ἀνυμνείω Orac. in App.Anth. 6.261.18, Nonn. D. 24.328.

children.label: III
children.definition: declaim, Eun. VS p.468 B.

children.label: IV
children.definition: proclaim as, ὅπερ ὂν -οῦμεν Dam. Pr. 48, cf. 58:— Pass., ib. 34.
unwedded, S. El. 165 (lyr.); ματρὸς ἔχοντες ἀ. γονάν born of an ill marriage, Id. Ant. 980, v. Sch.: transf. of things, κάρηνον (of Zeus), Nonn. D. 46.48, cf. 20.155, al.

definition: ἀνυμφής, ές, acc. sg. ἀνυμφέα cj. for ἄνυμφο[ν], Milet. 6.46 ( Mnemos. 50.255).

children.definition: not bridal, ἄ. τροφή S. El. 1183 (lyr.); νυμφη ἄ. a bride that is no bride, unhappy bride, E. Hec. 612, cf. Hipp. 547 (lyr.), Men. 548.

children.label: II
children.definition: without bride or mistress, μέλαθρα E. Hel. 1125 (lyr.), cf. Sammelb. 4301.
swiftly-running, fleet, Sapph. 71.
blameless, Ph. 1.4, al., Hld. 9.11; ἡ κατʼ ὀρθὸν λόγον ἀ. διοίκησις Boeth.Stoic. 3.266. Adv. -ίως Ph. 1.206.

data.quote: ἡ κατʼ ὀρθὸν λόγον ἀ. διοίκησις

children.definition: not suited for hearing, i.e. for declamation, λέξις Phld. Rh. 1.198 S.
non-existent, unreal, Epicur. Fr. 27, Zeno Stoic. 1.19, Phld. Mus. p.65K., Ph. 2.307, Plu. Col. 2.1124a, PGiss. 7.8 (ii A.D.), etc.
non-existence, nonentity, Phld. Mort. 28, Antip.Stoic. 3.252, S.E. P. 1.21, Plot. 5.5.2.
absence of predication, ἡ ἀπόφασις said to be ἀναίρεσις ( τῆς φάσεως) καὶ ἀ. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 409.19.
unyielding, hard, Suid.
without exception, M.Ant. 8.41.
not ostentatious, ἐν δαπάναις καὶ παρασκευαῖς ἀ. Andronic.Rhod. p.576 M.
impassable, κρημνοί D.Chr. 64.21.
not to be overcome, unsurpassable, S.E. M. 9.153; ἀηδία Phld. Vit. p.12J.
Act., not transgressing the bounds, διάθεσις ἀ. τῶν κατʼ ὀρθὸν λόγον D.L. 7.93. Adv. -τως without omission, of numerical progression, Nicom. Ar. 2.23; unfailingly, Gal. 19.544.

data.quote: διάθεσις ἀ. τῶν κατʼ ὀρθὸν λόγον

children.definition: not to be surpassed or outdone, φιλία X. Cyr. 8.7.15; ἀρετή Isoc. 4.71; φιλοτιμία D. 2.18; εὔνοια Lycurg. 101; ἄνθρωπος ἀ. εἰς πονηρίαν Antiph. 168.5; τάχη Epicur. Ep. 1p.10U. Adv. -τως Arist. Rh. 1370b31, Pyth. Sim. 144.
persistent, obstinate, of disease, Gal. 13.61.
unsurpassable, ἀκρότης Phld. D. 3.5.
immediateness, haste, Aq. Ps. 7.7 (pl.).
do immediately, to be hasty, Aq. Ps. 77(78).21.
immediate, Ph. 2.58, al., Dsc. Ther.Praef. Adv. ἀνυπερθέ-τως forthwith, without delay, BGU 1167.51 (i B. C.), LXX 3 Ma. 5.20, IG 3.77, Ph. 1.599, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: unsurpassed by, c. dat., Democr. 275; incomparable, [ Philol.] 21.
without superiority on either side, Eust. 832.3.

not liable to a εὔθυνα, not accountable, of persons, esp. magistrates or statesmen, Ar. V. 587, Pl. Lg. 761e; ἀ. ἄρχειν ib. 875b, cf. Arist. Pol. 1295a20; = Lat. dictator, Plu. Fab. 3. Adv. -νως Andronic. Rhod. p.574M., D.S. 1.70.
beyond human control or criticism, τὰ τῆς τέχνης ἀ. Hp. Praec. 7; ἀνάγκη Epicur. Ep. 3p.65U.; ἐξουσία ἀ. unchartered freedom, Phld. Herc. 1251.3.

children.label: II
children.definition: that will not bear investigation, ἔργα Ph. 2.266.
not obeying, τοῦ λόγου Pl. Ti. 91b, cf. 73a.

definition: ἀνυπηλιφής, ές, EM 61.6, or ἀνυπ-ήλῐφος, ον, Phryn. PS p.34 B.,

children.definition: not anointed with pitch.
beardless, Eust. 1353.47, Hsch.
unserviceableness, Simp. in Epict. p.49D.
without attendance, Euryph. ap. Stob. 4.39.27.
without subscription, unsigned, PFlor. 16.38 (iii A. D.).
-δετος IG 5(1).1390.15 ( Andania, i B.C.), but condemned by Phryn. 409, Id. PS p.27B., etc.
AB 82.
a going barefoot, Pl. Lg. 633c, X. Lac. 2.3.
go barefoot, Arist. Fr. 74, Luc. Cyn. 1.
unshod, barefoot, as the philosophers and Spartans, Epich. 108, Lys. 32.16, Pl. Phdr. 229a, Smp. 173b, Ar. Nu. 103, etc.; ἀ. ὄρθρου περιπατεῖν Aristopho 10.8.
having the feet unprotected, Pl. Prt. 321c.
not liable to action, Plu. Cat.Mi. 11; ἀ. πάσας δίκας καὶ ζαμίας GDI 1685, al. (Delph.), cf. 5170 (Cret.).
without ὑπόζωμα (q.v.), IG 2.789b79,83.
not hypothetical, unconditioned, absolute, ἀρχή Pl. R. 510b, cf. Phld. D. 1.19; τὸ ἀ. Pl. R. 511b, al. Adv. -τως not hypothetically, Plu. Pyth. 2.399b.

children.label: II
children.definition: without foundation, ib. Isid. 358f.
insupportable, Timae. 60, D.H. 7.15, J. AJ 19.2.2, Eus.Mynd. 54; irresistible, φάλαγξ Ascl. Tact. 5.1. Adv. -τως Poll. 3.130.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., impatient, Ptol. Tetr. 159.
intolerabilitas, Gloss.
without dissimulation, LXX Wi. 5.18, Ep.Rom. 12.9, Ep.Jac. 3.17. Adv. -τως M.Ant. 8.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: undramatic, Demetr. Eloc. 194.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἐνυπόκριτος (q.v.), Sch.D.T. p.24H.

definition: ἀνυπόληπτος, ον, perh. f.l. for ἀνυπόδητος, Anon. in Rh. 82.38.

children.definition: subject to no claim or charge, POxy. 71i 6 (iv A. D.): c. gen., ἀ. παντὸς κινδύνου BGU 1119.7 (i B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: without deduction, φόρος CIG 2693e ( Mylasa).
not to be sustained, Stob. 2.6.6:—also ἀνυπο-μενετός, ή, όν, ibid.
Phld. Mus. p.91K.

definition: ἀνυπόμνηστος, ον, dub. sens. in Phld. Piet. 98.

children.definition: unbearable, κακόν Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.131; ἀ. θεάσασθαι Arist. Mir. 843a15, cf. D.S. 3.29, D.H. 6.51, Crates Ep. 29, etc. Adv. -τως Hsch. s.v. ἀστέκτως.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not enduring, Procl. Par.Ptol. 224.
unsuspected, πρός τι in a thing, D. 61.11; ἄνθρωποι Plb. 13.6.8.
unexpected, ἐλπίς Id. 2.57.6. Adv. -τως Id. 1.84.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., unsuspecting, τοῦ μέλλοντος Id. 4.10.7, cf. Phld. Mort. 13, cf. 39. Adv. -τως unsuspiciously, Plb. 5.39.2.
with nothing spread below it, IG 7.3073.164 (Lebad.).
without suspicion, i.e.,
Pass., unsuspected, Th. 3.43 ( Comp.), X. Cyr. 5.3.11; λεηλασίαι unexpected, Arr. Tact. 17.
Adv. -τως unsuspectedly, Aen.Tact. 10.20, al., Men. 666.
free from risk, κίνησις Sor. 1.55; θάνατος Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.4.
Act., unsuspecting, πράξεως Plb. 8.27.2, Plu. Brut. 8. Adv. -τως Th. 1.146; ἀ. ἔχειν Arist. Top. 156b18; unhesitatingly, Plu. QConv. 2.614b.
not coming under the cognizance of, τῇ αἰσθήσει S.E. M. 7.345, etc.
Herill.Stoic. 1.191.
Ammon. in Cat. 2.8.
Hsch.
unsubstantiality, Sch. E. Hec. 702 (leg. -στασίαν).

not to be withstood, irresistible, δύναμις Pl. Lg. 686b; ἀνάγκη X. Lac. 10.7; φρόνημα, πόλις, Id. Cyr. 5.2.33, Mem. 4.4.15; τολμήματα D. 54.38; ἀ. τισὶν ἀνταγωνισταί D.Chr. 8.17. Adv. -τως Aristobul. ap. Eus. PE 8.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: without sure foundation, ἡ τῆς ὑποθέσεως ἀρχὴ ἀ. Plb. 1.5.3, cf. 12.25f. 4; ἀ. εἶναι τὰς τῶν ὅλων ἀρχάς D.L. 9.99, cf. Ath. 3.98c.

data.quote: ἀ. εἶναι τὰς τῶν ὅλων ἀρχάς

children.definition: without sediment, οὖρα Aret. SD 1.13, cf. CD 1.13, Hp. Epid. 2.2.23.

unsubstantial, Stoic. 2.117, Syrian. in Metaph. 25.3; of accidental or secondary qualities, Syn.Alch. p.62B.; nonexistent, Ps.- Archyt. ap. Simp. in Ph. 785.17; μαντικαί D.L. 7.149; τὸ ἀ. . . τῆς μαντικῆς Diogenian.Epicur. 4.79; κειμήλιον Secund. Sent. 11.
without significance, φωνή Them. in Ph. 124.27.
using no concealment, frank, fearless, ῥήτωρ Poll. 4.21; τὸ ἀ. τῆς ὀργῆς J. AJ 16.3.1. Adv. -λως D.Chr. 13.16, Phld. Rh. 1.109S., Alciphr. 3.39, etc.
unreturning, Suid. s.v. ἄνοστος. Adv. -τί without turning back, Pythag. ap. Phlp. in de An. 116.32.
from which none return, Orph. H. 56; ὁδός Lyd. Mag. 3.14.
without relapse, Hp. Epid. 6.3.4.
to be unruly, insubordinate, Sch. Od. 19.179.

definition: ἀνυπότακτος, ον, of persons or things,

children.definition: not made subject, τινί Ep.Hebr. 2.8, cf. J. AJ 11.6.6, Arr. Epict. 4.1.161; ἀ. ὁ βασιλεύς Artem. 2.30; unrestrained, free, Ph. 1.473, cf. Arr. Epict. 2.10.1.
not to be classified under heads, confused, Plb. 3.36.4; irregular, ποιήματα, of dithyrambs, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1014.12, Zen. 2.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: independent, Ptol. Tetr. 61; in bad sense, unruly, 1 Ep.Ti. 1.9, Ep.Tit. 1.6 and 10, PMag.Par. 1.1367. Adv. -τως impatiently, Hsch. s.v. ἀστέκτως.

children.label: III
children.definition: having no first aorist, AB 1087.
indiscipline, Phld. Lib. p.630.
that cannot be adequately punished, ἀσέβεια J. AJ 16.11.8, cf. 15.7.10. Adv. -τως without fear of punishment, 16.9.1.
not to be borne, Sch. E. Ph. 93.
without disguise, Ph. 2.435; γνώμη without arrière-pensée, Chor. Milt. 50.

definition: ἀνύπους, ὁ, ἡ, only in Hsch. ἀνύποδας· ταχύποδας, ἀπὸ τοῦ τοῖς ποσὶν ἀνύειν, prob. due to a misreading of S. Aj. 837 Ἐρινῦς τανύποδας.

children.definition: insufferable, EM 115.18.
Hsch.
not passive, of reciprocal Verbs, D.L. 7.64.

definition: ἄνυρις ἄδικος, ἀσεβής, and ἄνυρος· ἄδικος, Hsch.

children.definition: finishing work, industrious, Theoc. 28.14 [ ᾱ metri gr.], cf. Phld. Hom. p.30O.

efficacious, effectual, πρός τι Pl. Lg. 716d: Comp., εἴς τι οὐδὲν -ώτερον X. Cyr. 1.6.22, cf. Aret. CA 1.10, Jul. Or. 5.178a: Sup. ἀνῠσιμ-ώτατος Pl. l.c., Luc. Cal. 16; λόγος D.Chr. 39.8. Adv. -μως Pl. Tht. 144b, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 164.33: Sup. -ώτατα Pl. R. 518d.
Pass., capable of accomplishment, J. BJ 5.5.1, cf. Porph. VP 27, Serapion in Cat.Cod.Astr. 1.100.

accomplishment, ἄ. δʼ οὐκ ἔσσεται αὐτῶν Il. 2.347; οὐκ ἄνυσίν τινα δήομεν we find no end, accomplish nothing, Od. 4.544; χρήμασιν ὧν ἄ. γίνεται οὐδεμία Thgn. 462; οὐδʼ ἄνυσις there is no respite, Theoc. 25.93.—Poet. and late Prose, as Plu. Profect. 2.77b.
accomplishment, end, Sch. Od. 5.299.
one must accomplish, Suid.
effective, practical, Arist. Phgn. 813a4; τὸ ἀ. D.H. Vett.Cens. 5.2: Comp. -ώτερος Plb. 8.5.3, cf. Archig. ap. Gal. 8.154: Sup., [ Longin.] Rh. p.182H.

to be accomplished, practicable, οὔκ ἐστʼ ἀνυστὸν τόνδε σοι κατακτανεῖν E. Heracl. 961, cf. D.Chr. 12.34; τί γὰρ μερόπεσσιν ἀ.; Opp. H. 2.4: neut., ὡς ἀνυστόν [ἐστι], like ὡς δυνατόν, ὡς ἀ. κάλλιστα Diog.Apoll. 3; ὡς ἀ. ἀνθρωπίνῃ γνώμῃ Hp. Nat.Puer. 29; σιγῇ ὡς ἀ. as silently as possible, X. An. 1.8.11; ᾗ ἀ. μετριωτάτῳ Id. Lac. 1.3; τὰ ἀνθρώπῳ ἀ. Arist. Fr. 44.

data.quote: οὔκ ἐστʼ ἀνυστὸν τόνδε σοι κατακτανεῖν

children.definition: able, ready, πρὸς λόγους Hp. Decent. 3.
= Lat. exactor, Just. Nov. 163(2) (pl.).
effective, X. Eq.Mag. 2.6 ( Comp.), Oec. 20.22 ( Sup.), Plb. 8.3.3 ( Comp.); λόγοι S.E. M. 9.182 ( Sup.); of persons, J. BJ 5.9.1 ( Comp.), 1.17.8 ( Sup.).
rapid, ἀνυτικωτέραν ποιεῖν τὴν κίνησιν Arist. PA 682b1. Adv. -κῶς [ Longin.] Rh. p.190H.

definition: ἀνύτω or ἁνύτω, Att. form of ἀνύω.

children.definition: weave anew, ἀ. τὸ ἀνατριβόμενον renew that which wears out, Pl. Phd. 87d, cf. Olymp. Vit.Pl. p.3W., in Alc. p.198C.
one who weaves anew, Suid.:—fem. ἀνῠφ-άντρια, Eust. 1764.60.

definition: ἀνυφαίρετος, ον, f.l. for ἀναφαίρετος, D.H. Dem. 34.

children.definition: not woven, Ael.Dion. Fr. 80.
raise up, exalt, LXX Ps. 112(113).7, al., PGen. 51.27 (iii A. D.):— Med., AP 7.748 ( Antip. Sid.):— Pass., ὁ λόγος -οῦται πρὸς θεῖον δικαστήν Lyd. Mag. 2.16.

definition: ἀνύω ( ᾰνῠ), Il. 4.56, Ar. Ra. 606, Att. ἀνύτω or ἁνύτω Th. 2.75, Pl. R. 486c, al.: impf. ἤνυον Hdt. 9.66, E. Hec. 1167: fut. ἀνύσω [ῠ], S. Aj. 607, Ar. Ra. 649, Ep. ἐξ-ανύω Il. 11.365: aor. ἤνῠσα Od. 24.71, A. Pers. 726, etc.; poet. ἥνυσσα ( Dor. ᾱν-) Pi. P. 12.11, A.R. 4.413, Ep. ἄνυσσα [ᾰ] Hes. Th. 954, Maiist. 57 ( ὑπ-): pf. ἤνῠκα Pl. Plt. 264b:— Pass., pf. ἤνυσμαι Plb. 8.29.1, etc., δι-ήνυσμαι X. Cyr. 1.4.28: aor. ἠνύσθην Plb. 32.3.17, D.Chr. 3.127: fut. ἀνυσθήσομαι J. AJ 1.19.1, Ael. VH 1.21:— Med., ἀνύομαι Pi. P. 2.49, Bion Fr. 4.6: impf. ἠνυτόμην A. Ag. 1159: fut. ἀνύσομαι (v. infr.): aor. ἠνυσάμην A. Pr. 700, S. Tr. 995 (lyr.), inf. ἀνύσασθαι X. An. 7.7.24 (Valck.)—Non-thematic forms are found in poets: impf. Act. ἄνῠμες, Dor. for ἤνυμεν, Theoc. 7.10: pres. Pass. ἄνυται Opp. H. 3.427, Nic. Al. 599: impf. Pass. ἤνῠτο Od. 5.243 (nisi leg. ἤνετο); Dor. ἄνῠτο Theoc. 2.92. [ ῠ in all parts: hence ἀνῦσαι in Tryph. 126, ἀνῡσάμενοι in AP 10.12 should be written with σσ: ἀνύ̄ων is corrupt in Nonn. D. 21.16]:—

children.definition: effect, accomplish, ἤνυτο δʼ ἔργον Od. 5.243 (v. supr.), cf. A. Pers. 726, etc.; πρὸς θανάτῳ θάνατον ἀνύσασα S. Tr. 886; ἀρωγάν Id. Ph. 1145 (lyr.); τοὔπος ὡς ἄρʼ ὀρθὸν ἤνυσας Id. Ant. 1178, cf. OC 454: abs., οὐδὲν ἤνυε he did no good, Hdt. 9.66; εἴ τι ἔμελλεν ἀνύτειν whatever was likely to forward the work, Th. 2.75; σμικρὸν ἀνύτειν Pl. Sph. 230a, al.; ἧσσον ἁνύτειν Th. 2.76; οὐδὲν ἤνυε τούτοις D. 21.104; ἀ. εἴς τι to conduce towards . ., Pl. Ax. 369d: c. acc. et inf., Ἀπόλλων . . ἐκεῖνον ἤνυσε φονέα γενέσθαι brought it to pass that . ., S. OT 720:— Med., accomplish for oneʼs own advantage, ἀνύσσεσθαι τάδε ἔργα (if not in pass. sense, will be accomplished) Od. 16.373, cf. Hp. Ep. 27; θεός . . τέκμαρ ἀνύεται Pi. P. 2.49, cf. Ar. Pl. 196, dub. in Pl. Phd. 69d.
make an end of, destroy, φλόξ σε ἤνυσεν Od. 24.71; kill, Pi. P. 12.11.
make, cause to be, ἠνύσατʼ ἐκτοπίαν φλόγα S. OT 166 (lyr.), Nic. Al. 400.
make, εἰκόνα AP 12.56 ( Mel.).

finish a journey, ὅσσον τε πανημερίη γλαφυρὴ νηῦς ἤνυσεν (sc. ὁδοῦ) as much as a ship gets over in a day, Od. 4.357; so πολλὴν κέλευθον ἤνυδεν A. Pers. 748; πορείαν Onos. 6.1: c. acc. loci, ὄφρα τάχιστα νηῦς ἀνύσειε θαλάσσης . . ὕδωρ Od. 15.294, cf. Thgn. 511, S. Ant. 231.

data.quote: ὄφρα τάχιστα νηῦς ἀνύσειε θαλάσσης . . ὕδωρ

children.definition: ὁδόν or κέλευθον), make oneʼs way, win, πρὸς πόλιν Id. Tr. 657 (lyr.); ἐπὶ ἀκτάν E. Hipp. 743; also θάλαμον ἀνύτειν (i.e. εἰς θάλαμον) reach the bridal chamber, S. Ant. 805 (lyr.); ἀ. Ἅιδαν Id. Aj. 607 (lyr.), E. Supp. 1142 (lyr.): metaph., ζυγὰ ἤνυσε δούλια Τροία (s.v.l.) Id. Tr. 599 ( Τροίᾳ Sch.): rarely with inf. instead of acc., στρατὸς ἤνυσε περᾶν succeeded in crossing, A. Pers. 721: with Adj., come to be, εὐδαίμων ἀνύσει καὶ μέγας S. Ph. 720 (lyr.).
Pass. of Time, come to an end, χρόνος ἄνυτο Theoc. 2.92, cf. Eus.Mynd. 63.
Pass. of persons, grow up, ἠνυτόμαν τροφαῖς (lyr.) A. Ag. 1159.

get, obtain, γαστρὶ φορβάν S. Ph. 711 (lyr.), cf. Theoc. 5.144; τίνος χρείας ἀνύσαι; i.e. τίνος χρείας προσπίτνετε, ὥστε ἀνύσαι αὐτήν; S. OC 1755:— Med., χρείαν ἠνύσασθε ye obtained it, A. Pr. 700, cf. Ch. 858, S. Tr. 995 (lyr.); τοῦτο ἐκ Μοιρέων ἠνύσατο AP 7.506 ( Leon.).

data.quote: τίνος χρείας προσπίτνετε, ὥστε ἀνύσαι αὐτήν;

children.label: II
children.definition: part., οὐκ ἀνύω φθονέουσα I gain nothing by grudging, Il. 4.56.

do quickly, make haste, οὐ μέλλειν . ., ἀλλʼ ἀνύειν Ar. Pl. 607, cf. Ra. 606; οὐκ ἀνύσεις τι; make haste! ib. 649; ἀλλʼ ἄνυσον, οὐ μέλλειν ἐχρῆν Fr. 102: c. part., ἄνυε πράττων make haste about it, Pl. 413; ἄνυσον ὑποδησάμενος make haste and get your shoes on, V. 1168, cf. Av. 241; ἄνυσόν ποτʼ ἐξελθών Pherecr. 40: more freq. in part. ἀνύσας, or ἀνύσας τι with a Verb, ἄνοιγʼ, ἄνοιγʼ ἀνύσας make haste and open the door, Ar. Nu. 181; ἀνάβαινʼ ἀνύσας V. 398; σὺ δʼ ἔγχεον πιεῖν ἀνύσας τι Eq. 119, cf. V. 202, 847, 1158, Pl. 648, 974; βοηθησάτω τις ἀνύσας Ach. 571; νῦν οὖν ἀνύσαντε φροντίσωμεν Eq. 71; ἀκολουθήσεις ἐμοὶ ἀνύσας τι Nu. 506, cf. 1253; ἀπόδωμεν ἀνύσαντε Pax 872. (The distinction of meaning ἀνύτω accomplish, make way, ἀνύω hasten, is doubtful, cf. AB 411.— Att. ἁνύω acc. to Hdn.Gr. 1.541, Phryn. PS p.23B., cf. καθανύσαι X. HG 7.1.15 ( Hsch.); but κατανύειν (q.v.) occurs in Trag., cf. ταῦτʼ ἀνύσηται Ar. Pl. 196.) (I.-E. sen-, pres. stem sṇneu-, cf. Skt. sanoti ‘wins’.)

data.quote: σὺ δʼ ἔγχεον πιεῖν ἀνύσας τι

definition: ἄνω (A), imper. ἀνέτω S. Ichn. 70, inf. ἄνειν Pl. Cra. 415a, part. ἄνων, impf. ἦνον, etc. (v. infr.): aor. ἤνεσα IG 7.3226 (Orchom. Boeot.), Hymn.Is. 35, prob. in AP 7.701.1 ( Diod.) ( ἤνεσʼ codd.):—

children.definition: accomplish, finish, ἦνον ὁδόν Od. 3.496; οὔτʼ ἄν τι θύων οὔτʼ ἐπισπένδων ἄνοις A. Fr. 161 (Dobree, cf. AB 406); ἀλλʼ οὐδὲν ἦνεν E. Andr. 1132; ἦ τὸ δέον . . ἤνομεν; S. Ichn. 98; ταῦτα πρὸς ἀνδρός ἐστʼ ἄνοντος εἰς σωτηρίαν (cf. ἀνύω 1.6) Ar. V. 369; ἀρυσσάμενοι ποτὸν ἤνομεν AP 11.64 ( Agath.).

data.quote: οὔτʼ ἄν τι θύων οὔτʼ ἐπισπένδων ἄνοις

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., come to an end, be finished, mostly of a period of time, μάλα γὰρ νὺξ ἄνεται night is quickly drawing to a close, Il. 10.251; ἔτος ἀνόμενον the waning year, Hdt. 7.20; ἦμαρ ἀνόμενον A.R. 2.494; ἀνομένου τοῦ μηνός SIG 577.30 ( Milet., iii/ii B.C.); also ὅππως . . ἔργον ἄνοιτο Il. 18.473; ἤνετο τὸ ἔργον Hdt. 1.189, 8.71; ἀνομένων βημάτων A. Ch. 799; ὁπόταν θήρης . . ἔργον ἄνηται Opp. H. 5.442: impers., λιταῖς ἄνεται, = λιταὶ ἀνύονται, Pi. O. 8.8. [ ᾱ Hom., exc. Il. 18.473: afterwds. common, cf. A. l.c., Opp. H. l.c. Orig. ἄνϝω, cf. ἀνύω.]

children.label: I
children.definition: upwards, ἄ. ὤθεσκε ποτὶ λόφον Od. 11.596; ἄ. ἀπὸ θαλάσσης ἀναπλεῖν up stream, Hdt. 2.155; ἄ. ποταμῶν χωροῦσι παγαί E. Med. 410 (lyr.), hence " ἄ. ποταμῶν", proverbial, D. 19.287, etc.; κόνις δʼ ἄ. φορεῖτο S. El. 714; κονιορτὸς ἄ. ἐχώρει Th. 4.34; ἡ ἄ. ὁδός the upward road, Pl. R. 621c; ἄ. ἰόντι going up the country ( i.e. inland, v. infr. II.1f), Hdt. 2.8; ἄ. κάτω, v. infr. II.2; πέμπειν ἄ., i.e. from the nether world, A. Pers. 645 (lyr.), cf. Ch. 147; σύριγγες ἄ. φυσῶσιμέλαν μένος S. Aj. 1412 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: aloft, on high, ib. 240, etc.; τὸ ἄ. Pl. Phdr. 248a, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: on earth, opp. the world below, νέρθε κἀπὶ γῆς ἄ. S. OT 416; ἡνίκʼ ἦσθʼ ἄ. Id. El. 1167; ἄ. βλέπειν Id. Ph. 1348; ἄ. ἐπὶ [τῆς] γῆς Pl. Phd. 109c; οἱ ἄ. the living, opp. οἱ κάτω the dead, S. Ant. 1068, cf. Ph. 1348, etc.; τὰ ἄ. πράγματα the world above, Luc. Cont. 1.

children.label: c
children.definition: in heaven, opp. earth, οἱ ἄ. θεοί the gods above, S. Ant. 1072; κῆρυξ τῶν ἄ. τε καὶ κάτω A. Ch. 124: esp. in NT, ἐκ τῶν ἄ. εἰμί Ev.Jo. 8.23; ἡ ἄ. Ἱερουσαλήμ Ep.Gal. 4.26; ἡ ἄ. κλῆσις Ep.Phil. 3.14.

data.quote: κῆρυξ τῶν ἄ. τε καὶ κάτω

children.label: d
children.definition: ὁ δῆμος ἄ. καθῆτο in the upper quarter of the city, i.e. the Pnyx, D. 18.169; ἡ ἄ. βουλή, i.e. the Areopagus, Plu. Sol. 19; βαλλόμενοι ὑπὸ τῶν ἄ. by those above on the roofs, Th. 4.48; τὰ ἄ. X. An. 4.3.25; τὰ ἄ. τῆς οἰκίας, opp. θεμέλια, Id. Eq. 1.2; οἱ ἄ. τόποι OGI 111.17.

children.label: e
children.definition: on the upper side, i.e. on the north, ἄ. πρὸς βορέην Hdt. 1.72; οὔτε τὰ ἄ. χωρία οὔτε τὰ κάτω [οὔτε τὰ πρὸς τὴν ἠῶ οὔτε τὰ πρὸς τὴν ἑσπέρην] Id. 1.142; ὁ ἄ. τόπος Pl. R. 435e.

children.label: f
children.definition: inward from the coast, ἡ ἄ. Ἀσίη Hdt. 1.95; τὰ ἄ. τῆς Ἀσίης ib. 177; ἡ ἄ. ὁδός the upper or inland road, Id. 7.128, X. An. 3.1.8; ἡ ἄ. πόλις, opp. the Piraeus, Th. 2.48; in full, οἱ ἀπὸ θαλάσσης ἄ. ib. 83; ἡ ἄ. Μακεδονία Plu. Pyrrh. 11; ὁ ἄ. βασιλεύς the king of the upper country, i.e. of Persia, X. An. 7.1.28.

children.label: g
children.definition: τὰ ἄ. turning-post, Pl. R. 613b; cf. κάτω.

children.label: h
children.definition: τὰ ἄ. the upper parts, opp. τὸ κάτω, Arist. GA 741b28, al.; ἡ ἄ. κοιλία Id. Mete. 360b23.

children.label: i
children.definition: formerly, of old, εἰς τὸ ἄ. reckoning upwards or backwards, of generations, Pl. Tht. 175b; οἱ ἄ. men of olden time, Id. Criti. 110b; οἱ ἄ. τοῦ γένους Id. Lg. 878a; αἱ ἄ. μητρός the motherʼs lineal ancestors, Id. R. 461c, cf. infr. C; ἐν τοῖς ἄ. χρόνοις D. 18.310.

children.label: k
children.definition: above, in referring to a passage, Pl. Grg. 508e; ἐν τοῖς ἄ. λόγοις R. 603d, cf. Arist. Rh. 1412b33, etc.

children.label: l
children.definition: οἱ ἄ. τόνοι Plu. Cic. 3.

children.label: m
children.definition: ἄ. βαίνειν walk proudly, Philostr. VA 1.13; ἄ. φρονεῖν Hld. 7.23.

children.label: n
children.definition: higher, more general, of κατηγορίαι, Arist. APo. 82a23.
ἄ. καὶ κάτω up and down, to and fro, εἷρπʼ ἄ. τε καὶ κάτω E. HF 953; ἄ. καὶ κ. φεύγειν Ar. Ach. 21; ἄ. τε καὶ κ. κυκᾶν Id. Eq. 866; περιπατεῖν ἄ. κ. Id. Lys. 709.

children.label: b
children.definition: upside-down, topsy-turvy, τὰ μὲν ἄ. κ. θήσω, τὰ δὲ κ. ἄ. Hdt. 3.3; πάντʼ ἄ. τε καὶ κ. στρέφων τίθησιν A. Eu. 650; τρέπουσα τύρβʼ ἄ. κ. Id. Fr. 311, cf. Ar. Av. 3; ἄ. κ. συγχεῖν E. Ba. 349; ἄ. καὶ κ. ποιεῖν τὰ πράγματα D. 9.36; τοὺς νόμους στρέφειν 21.19; πόλλʼ ἄ., τὰ δʼ αὖ κ. κυλίνδοντʼ ἐλπίδες Pi. O. 12.6; πολλάκις ἐμαυτὸν ἄ. κ. μετέβαλλον backwards and forwards, Pl. Phd. 96a, cf. Prt. 356d.

data.quote: τὰ μὲν ἄ. κ. θήσω, τὰ δὲ κ. ἄ.
πάντʼ ἄ. τε καὶ κ. στρέφων τίθησιν
ἄ. καὶ κ. ποιεῖν τὰ πράγματα
πόλλʼ ἄ., τὰ δʼ αὖ κ. κυλίνδοντʼ ἐλπίδες

children.definition: ἄ. ἔχειν τὸ πνεῦμα pant or gasp, Men. 23, cf. Sosicr. 1.

children.label: B
children.definition: above, ἡ ἄ. Ἅλυος Ἀσίη Hdt. 1.130, cf. 103, Call. Jov. 24; αἱ ἄ. μητρός (v. supr. II.1 i); ἄ. τοῦ γόνατος above the knee, Thphr. Char. 4.4; ἀπὸ ἄ. τῆς χθονὸς ταύτης LXX 3 Ki. 14.15.
αἰθέρος ἄ. ἑλεῖν dub. in S. Ph. 1092, cf. E. Or. 1542; γῆς ἥκοντʼ ἄ. Id. HF 616; μικρὸν προαγαγὼν ἄ. τῶν πραγμάτων Aeschin. 2.34.

children.label: C
children.definition: Comp. ἀνωτέρω, abs., higher, ἀ. θακῶν . . Ζεύς A. Pr. 314; ἀ. οὐδὲν τῶν πρηγμάτων προκοπτομένων not getting on any farther, Hdt. 1.190; ἀδελφῷ ἢ πατρὶ ἢ ἔτι ἀ. Pl. Lg. 880b; οὐ προήϊσαν ἀ. τὸ πρὸς ἑσπέρης Hdt. 8.130.

data.quote: ἀδελφῷ ἢ πατρὶ ἢ ἔτι ἀ.
οὐ προήϊσαν ἀ. τὸ πρὸς ἑσπέρης

children.definition: ἀ. Σάμου ib. 132; ἀ. γίγνεσθαί τινων X. An. 4.2.25; ἀ. τῶν μαστῶν above them, ib. 1.4.17; later ἀνώτερον Plb. 1.7.2, etc.; cf. ἀνώτερος.

children.label: II
children.definition: Sup. ἀνωτάτω, ἐς τοὺς ἀ. (sc. στάντας) Hdt. 7.23; ἡ ἀ. κώμη X. An. 7.4.11; ἀνῳκίσανθʼ ὅπως ἀ. Ar. Pax 207; ἡ ἀ. ἄσκησις the highest, Arr. Epict. 3.24.84, cf. Ph. 1.33, al.; τὰ ἀ. τῶν γενῶν Arist. Metaph. 998b18, cf. Zeno Stoic. 1.51, S.E. P. 1.138; τὰ ἀ. τρία Ph. 1.321; ἡ ἀ. διαίρεσις Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 20.27.

definition: ἄνωγα, old Ep. pf. with pres. sense: ἄνωγα, -ας, -ε, without augm., Il. and Trag., Hdt. 3.81; 1 pl. ἄνωγμεν h.Ap. 528: imper. ἄνώγε E. Or. 119, more freq. ἄνωχθι Il. 23.158, A. Ch. 772, E. Alc. 1044; 3 sg. ἀνωγέτω Od. 2.195, ἀνώχθω Il. 11.189; 2 pl. ἀνώγετε Od. 23.132, ἄνωχθε 22.437, E. Rh. 987; subj. ἀνώγῃ Il. 7.74, Hdt. 7.104, ἀνώγωμεν Herod. 3.31; inf. ἀνωγέμεν Il. 13.56; part. ἀνώγουσα Herod. 7.101: plpf. with impf. sense, 3 sg. ἠνώγει Il. 6.170, S. OC 1598; without augm. ἀνώγει Od. 2.385; Ion. ἠνώγεα ib. 9.44, 17.55:—but ἀνώγει in Il. 6.439, 19.102, Od. 5.139, 357, Hes. Th. 549, Hdt. 7.104 is pres, in sense, and must be referred to pres. ἀνώγω (unless corrected to ἄνωγεν); also 2 dual ἀνώγετον Il. 4.287, and (later) 2 sg. ἀνώγεις Q.S. 13.238:— from this pres. are formed impf. ἤνωγον Il. 9.578, Od. 14.237, or ἄνωγον Il. 5.805, Od. 3.35, etc.; ἤνωγες Maiist. 17; ἤνωγε h.Cer. 297, Hes. Op. 68; 3 pl. ἄνωγον Inscr.Cypr. 135 H.: fut. ἀνώξω Od. 16.404: aor. ἤνωξα Hes. Sc. 479; subj. ἀνώξομεν, Ep. for -ωμεν, Il. 15.295; inf. ἀνῶξαι Od. 10.531. Il. 7.394, the impf. ἠνώγεον implies pres. ἀνωγέω:— Pass., ἄνωκται· κελεύεται, Hsch.:—

children.definition: Ion. Verb, also in Cypr., Inscr.Cypr. l.c., command, order, esp. of kings and masters, Il. 5.899, etc.; also of equals and inferiors, advise, urge, 16.8, Od. 2.195, etc.: constr. c. acc. pers. et inf., σιωπᾶν λαὸν ἀνώγει bade the people keep silence, Il. 2.280, cf. 4.287, etc.; πατὴρ ἄνωγέ σʼ . . αὐδᾶν A. Pr. 947, cf. 1037, etc.; πράσσειν ἄνωγας οὖν με . . τάδε; S. Tr. 1247; σιγᾶν ἄνωγα (sc. σε) Id. El. 1458: in Hom. also c. dat. pers., Od. 10.531, 20.139 sq., cf. A.R. 1.693: c. acc. pers. only, θυμὸς ἄνωγέ με my spirit bids, prompts me, freq. in Hom.: abs., ἐποτρύνει καὶ ἀνώγει Il. 15.43; κέλομαι καὶ ἄνωγα Od. 3.317.

definition: ἀνώγαιον or ἀνώγεον, τό, ( ἄνω, γαῖα)

children.definition: anything raised from the ground: the upper floor of a house, used as a granary, X. An. 5.4.29 (s.v.l.), Antiph. 312; as a dining-room, Ev.Marc. 14.15, Ev.Luc. 22.12.
prison, Suid. ( ἀνώγεον in GDI 1581 ( Dodona); ἀνάγαιον and ἀνόκαιον are also found in codd., cf. AB 405, Suid.)
command, exhortation, A.R. 1.1134; θείαν διʼ ἀνωγάν Philol. 71.6 ( Argos).
IG 5(2).262.17 ( Mantinea, v B. C.).
to be in labour, bring forth, Nonn. D. 41.167.
songless, Arist. HA 488a34.
freedom from pain, Protag. 9, Plot. 1.4.6: in pl., pain-free periods, Philagr. ap. Aët. 12.20.

free from pain, οἰδήματα Hp. Prog. 7, cf. D.Chr. 32.57; τὸ ἓν ἀ. καὶ ἀνάλγητον Arist. Xen. 974a19; of persons, S. Ph. 883; -ώτερος γίγνεσθαι suffer less pain, Hp. Prorrh. 2.7; τὸ ἀνώδυνον, = ἀνωδυνία, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.102d. Adv. ἀνωδύνως, τίκτεσθαι Hp. Coac. 527, cf. Plu. Cic. 2; ἰᾶσθαι D.Chr. 41.9: Sup. -ώτατα Hp. Acut. 4.
causing no pain, harmless, τὸ μὴ φρονεῖν γὰρ κάρτʼ ἀ. κακόν S. Aj. 554b; ἁμάρτημα ἢ αἶσχος ἀ., definition of τὸ γελοῖον, Arist. Po. 1449a35. Adv. -ως, ἰάσασθαι τὴν πατρίδα Plu. Cleom. 10.

data.quote: τὸ μὴ φρονεῖν γὰρ κάρτʼ ἀ. κακόν

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., allaying pain, Hp. Aph. 5.22, Dsc. 4.68 ( Comp. and Sup.); φάρμακον ἀ. anodyne, Plu. QConv. 2.614c:—the epitaph of a physician in IG 14.1879 combines both signfs., πολλούς τε σώσας φαρμάκοις ἀνωδύνοις, ἀνώδυνον τὸ σῶμα νῦν ἔχει θανών.

definition: ἄνωθεν and ἄνωθε ( Ar. Ec. 698), Dor. ἄνωθα Tab.Heracl. 1.17: ( ἄνω):— Adv. of Place,

children.definition: from above, from on high, θεοὺς ἄ. γῆς ἐποπτεύειν ἄχη A. Ag. 1579; ὕδατος ἄ. γενομένου Th. 4.75; βάλλειν ἄ. Id. 7.84; from the interior of a country, Id. 1.59, X. An. 7.7.2; esp. from inner Asia, Plu. Dem. 14; from the north, Hdt. 4.105.

above, on high, opp. κάτωθεν or κάτω, A. Ag. 871 (dub.): of the gods, Id. Supp. 597 (lyr.), Pl. Lg. 717b; of men on earth, οἱ ἄ. the living, A. Ch. 834 (lyr.), E. Hel. 1014; those on deck (in a ship), Th. 7.63; of birds of the air, S. El. 1058 (lyr.); ἡ ἄ. Φρυγία upper Phrygia, D. 23.155.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἄ. τοῦ στρατοπέδου Hdt. 1.75; τοῦ καρποῦ Hp. Art. 80; τῆς νεώς Plu. Them. 12.

children.label: II
children.definition: from the beginning, from farther back, ἄ. ἄρχεσθαι, ἐπιχειρεῖν, Pl. Phlb. 44d, Lg. 781d; ἄ. ἐξετάζειν τὸ γένος D. 44.69, cf. Men. Epit. 23; in quotations, above, earlier, Sch. E. Ph. 249, etc.: οἱ ἔμπροσθεν καὶ ἄ. γονεῖς ancestors, Pl. Ti. 18d; Κορίνθιαι εἰμὲς ἄ. by descent, Theoc. 15.91, cf. 22.164, Call. Aet. 3.1.32 [Fr. 75.32 Pf.]; πονηρὸς ἄ. a born rogue, D. 45.80; ἐκ προγόνων ἄ. τετιμημένος IG 2(2).1072; ἄ. ἀναμάρτητον from early life, Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.17.16; ἐν τοῖς ἄ. χρόνοις D. 9.41.
τὰ ἄ. higher, more universal principles, Pl. Phd. 101d, cf. Arist. APo. 97a33.
over again, anew, afresh, φιλίαν ἄ. ποιεῖται J. AJ 1.18.3, Artem. 1.14, cf. Ev.Jo. 3.3; πάλιν ἄ. Ep.Gal. 4.9, cf. Harp. s.v. ἀνάδικοι κρίσεις; κτίστης ἄνωθε γενόμενος IG 7.2712.58.
push up or forth, ἀνώσαντες πλέον (sc. ναῦν) they pushed off from shore and sailed, Od. 15.553; ἀ. τὴν πόλιν εἰς τοὺς πολεμίους Th. 8.93:— Pass., to be thrust upwards, Arist. Pr. 931b35.

data.quote: ἀ. τὴν πόλιν εἰς τοὺς πολεμίους

children.definition: push back, Hp. Art. 80; ὅστις σῖτον . . ἐσαχθέντα ἀνωθεοίη SIG 37 A 10 ( Teos): — Med., repel, repulse, οὗτοι ἦσαν οἱ βασιλέα . . ἀνωσάμενοι Hdt. 7.139, cf. 8.109.
support, of buoyant water, Olymp. in Mete. 81.23, al.
hand over, τὰ πράγματα πρὸς τὸν δῆμον D.C. 52.17; refer, τὰς ἐλαττώσεις εἰς τοὺς στρατηγήσαντας Id. Fr. 43.18.
push oneʼs way up, εἰς τὸ πρόσαντες J. BJ 3.7.5.
unlooked for, Od. 4.92.
unlooked for, unexpected, ἀ. κακόν Il. 21.39; ἀνωΐστων πολέων περ Hom. Epigr. 5; βέλεα Mosch. 2.75; κλάδοι Epic.Anon. Oxy. 214.1. Adv. -τως A.R. 1.680.

definition: ἀνώϊστος (B), ον, prob. f.l. for ἀνοιστός, referred, ἀνωΐστου γενομένου ἐς τὴν Πυθίην the matter having been referred to . ., Hdt. 6.66.

children.definition: lifted up, raised, Aret. SA 2.11.
indestructible, Parm. 8.3; ἀθάνατος καὶ ἀ. Anaximand. 15, Pl. Phd. 88b, 95b, Arist. Mu. 396a31, Ocell. 1.2; of roots, Thphr. HP 3.12.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not deadly, harmless, ὄφεις Paus. 10.17.12; of symptoms, not fatal, Aret. SD 1.5.
unbewailed, Hsch.
suffer ups and downs of fortune, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 279.28, cf. 65.6, Heph.Astr. 2.28.
Epicur. Ep. 2p.53U., Arist. Pr. 918a11; ἡ φωνὴ μεταβάλλει ἐπὶ τὸ . . ἀνωμαλέστερον Id. HA 581a18. Adv. -λῶς Id. Ph. 265b12.

data.quote: ἡ φωνὴ μεταβάλλει ἐπὶ τὸ . . ἀνωμαλέστερον

children.definition: unevenness, irregularity, Pl. R. 547a, Arist. HA 495b2; of shape, Str. 16.1.21; ἀ. τῶν στοιχείων, as cause of disease, Diocl. Fr. 30: pl., Epicur. Ep. 2p.53U.
irregular motion, anomaly, ἀ. τῆς κινήσεως Gem. 1.20, cf. Ptol. Alm. 3.3, etc.; ἀ. ἐκλειπτικαί, of the moonʼs orbit, Plu. Aem. 17.

children.label: II
children.definition: irregularity, ἀ. καὶ ταραχή Isoc. 2.6; ἀ. τῆς κτήσεως Arist. Pol. 1270a15; τύχης D.S. 20.30, cf. 18.59: pl., Vett.Val. 38.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: inconsistency, Aeschin. 2.7 and 54, Plb. 6.44.2, Plu. Alc. 16; of style, unevenness, Id. Aud. 2.45b.

children.label: IV
children.definition: deviation from rule, irregularity, title of work by Chrysipp., Stoic. 2.6, cf. Gell. 2.25, etc.; variety, diversity, Arist. GA 788a24, A.D. Adv. 205.18.

children.label: V
children.definition: indisposition, ‘malaise’, Hld. 7.19, Gal. 7.435.
to be subject to vicissitude, Vett.Val. 57.4, 85.28.
unevenly mixed, Hsch.

uneven, irregular, χώρα Pl. Lg. 625d; φύσις Id. Ti. 58a; τὸ ἀ. τῆς ναυμαχίας Th. 7.71 (cj.), cf. Arist. Pr. 885a15: and in Sup., Hp. Aër. 13; of movements, Arist. Ph. 228b16, al.; of periods of time, Id. GA 772b7; of the voice, ib. 788a1. Adv. -λως, κινεῖσθαι Id. Ph. 238a22, cf. Pl. Ti. 52e.

children.label: II
children.definition: φεῦ τῶν βροτείων ὡς ἀ. τύχαι E. Fr. 684; πόλις, πολιτεία, Pl. Lg. 773b, Mx. 238e; θέα Plot. 6.7.34. Adv. -λως Hp. Prog. 3, Isoc. 7.29; ἀ. διατεθῆναι τὸ σῶμα fall into precarious health, Prisc.p.333 D.

data.quote: φεῦ τῶν βροτείων ὡς ἀ. τύχαι

children.label: III
children.definition: inconsistent, capricious, ὁμαλῶς ἀ. Arist. Po. 1454a26; ὄχλος, δαιμόνιον, App. BC 3.42, Pun. 59; πίθηκος Phryn. Com.20; τύχη AP 10.96. Adv. -λως Isoc. 9.44.

children.label: IV
children.definition: which deviate from a general rule, anomalous, Diom. 1.327 K.; but τὸ ἀ. τῆς συντάξεως diversity of construction, A.D. Synt. 291.17. Adv. -λως Sch. Th. Oxy. 853v18.
Pl. Ti. 57e, 58c, Placit. 2.30.2.
admittedly, Lib. Decl. 50.39 (s.v.l.).
inconsistent, Ptol. Tetr. 47.
without shoulder, Πελοπίδαι Suid.
without oath, καὶ ὀμνύντας καὶ ἀ. Hdt. 2.118.
unsworn, not bound by oath, ἡ γλῶσσʼ ὀμώμοχʼ, ἡ δὲ φρὴν ἀ. E. Hipp. 612; ἀ. μάρτυρες Antipho 5.12, cf. D. 21.86; θεῶν ἀνώμοτος E. Med. 737. Adv. -τως Aristid. Or. 28(49).94.

data.quote: ἡ γλῶσσʼ ὀμώμοχʼ, ἡ δὲ φρὴν ἀ.

children.label: II
children.definition: not sworn to, εἰρήνη D. 19.204.
Dsc. 3.18, v.l. in Poet. ap. Plu. Aud. 2.44e, cf. Frat. 485a.
nameless, ineffable, E. Hec. 714 (lyr.); ἀ. ὀσμή Ar. Av. 1715.
without name, v.l. in Sch.D.T. p.18 H., EM 764.22.
namelessness, Arat. 146.

definition: ἀνώνυμος, ον, (from ὄνυμα, Aeol. for ὄνομα)

children.definition: without name, οὐ μὲν γάρ τις πάμπαν ἀ. ἐστʼ ἀνθρώπων Od. 8.552; ἡ Εὐρώπη . . ἦν ἀ. Hdt. 4.45; θεαί i.e. the Furies, E. IT 944; Ὅρκου πάϊς ἐστὶν ἀ. Orac. ap. Hdt. 6.86, cf. Pl. Ti. 60a, Arist. EN 1107b2, prob. in Po. 1447b9, cf. Tz. Diff. Poet. 11.

data.quote: οὐ μὲν γάρ τις πάμπαν ἀ. ἐστʼ ἀνθρώπων

children.definition: anonymous, μήνυσις Lys. 13.22, cf. D.C. 66.11.
not to be named, unspeakable, Aristid. Or. 50(26).8.
difficult to name, in Comp., Arist. EE 1221a40, Alex.Aphr. in Mete. 197.23.
Adv. -μως without mentioning a name, Men.Rh. p.391 S.

children.label: II
children.definition: nameless, inglorious, γῆρας Pi. O. 1.82; γῆ πατρὶς οὐκ ἀ. E. Hel. 16, cf. Hipp. 1; ὄνομα ἀ. Ar. Lys. 854; of persons, S. Tr. 377, Pl. Lg. 721c; ἀ. καὶ ἄδοξοι D. 8.66, cf. Herod. 6.14. Adv. -μως Poll. 5.160.
Hsch.
the part above the door, Poll. 2.53 (pl.).
unseen, unnoticed, Hsch.
untimeliness, ἀ. τοῦ ἔτεος πολεμέειν the bad season of the year for war, opp. ὥρα ἔτους, Hdt. 8.113.
Hdt. 2.79, cf. Leg.Gort. 7.29.
unroofed, uncovered, Lyc. 350, D.C. 37.17.
howl aloud, utter with a howl, πένθος AP 7.468 ( Mel.), Hld. 10.16.
by pushing upwards, S.E. P. 3.69.

definition: ἀνώτατος, η, ον, Sup. Adj. formed from ἄνω (B),

children.definition: topmost, τὰ ἀνώτατα Hdt. 2.125; θεῶν τῶν ἀνωτάτων νοητικός Euryph. ap. Stob. 4.39.27 ( ἀνωτάτω Mein.); ἡ ἀ. χάρις D.Chr. 31.32. Adv. ἀνωτάτω, v. ἄνω (B).
upper in point of place, inland (v. ἄνω (B) A. II.1f), Act.Ap. 19.1.
given by the mouth, τροχίσκος Archig. ap. Aët. 9.42, cf. Cass.Fel. 48.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ -κόν medicine which takes effect upwards, emetic, Hp. Superf. 29, Gal. 10.969.

definition: ἀνώτερος, α, ον, Comp. Adj. from ἄνω (B),

children.definition: upper, higher, Arist. HA 496b35, D.H. Rh. 1.1, Luc. Asin. 9; ἐπιβουλῆς ἀ. γέγονεν got the better of, Nic.Dem. p.25 D.; neut. as Adv., Arist. HA 503b18; above, LXX Le. 11.21; earlier in a book, Ep.Hebr. 10.8, cf. Plb. 3.1.1; to a higher place, Ev.Luc. 14.10. Adv. ἀνωτέρω, v. ἄνω.
from above, from a higher place, Hp. Oss. 5.
CIG 6849 ( Ilium), cf. Eranos 13.89.
bald on top, Ptol. Tetr. 143.
uselessness, D.L. 9.78, Aq. Je. 4.14; inconvenience, PHaw. 56.20 (i A. D.).
unprofitable, useless, ἁβροσύναι Xenoph. 3.1; γόοι A. Pr. 33; σκιά S. El. 1159; πάντα ἀ. ἦν Th. 2.47; ἀ. αὑτῷ τε καὶ τοῖς ἄλλοις Pl. R. 496d, al.

data.quote: ἀ. αὑτῷ τε καὶ τοῖς ἄλλοις

children.definition: hurtful, prejudicial, Th. 6.33; τινί Pl. Prt. 334a, X. HG 1.7.27: Comp. -έστερος E. Fr. 48, X. Cyn. 13.11, Pl. Hp.Ma. 284e. Adv. -λῶς Arist. EN 1095a5, PLond. 3.908.28 (ii A. D.).
unprofitable, useless, τινί to one, A. Ch. 752: abs., S. Ant. 645, El. 1144; γῆ X. Cyr. 1.6.11.

children.label: II
children.definition: helpless, ἄνθρωπος Eup. 377; ἀ. καὶ θεοῖς ἐχθρός Stratt. 9 D.

definition: ἀνωφέλιμος, ον, = foreg., Phld. Rh. 2.69 S.

children.definition: motion upwards, opp. κατωφ., Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.92.
borne upwards, ascending, opp. κατωφερής, of air and fire, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.143, cf. 290, Aristid. Quint. 3.19; ὀσμαί Arist. Pr. 908a25, cf. Herm. in Phdr. p.178A.; τὸ ἀ. Plu. QConv. 2.649c.
heady, intoxicating, Ath. 1.32c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., bearing upwards, Arist. Ph. 217a3.
lintel of a door, Suid.
mounting upwards, of air and fire, Zeno Stoic. 1.27, cf. Ph. 2.513, etc.
bear up, raise, freq. in Eust., esp. in Pass. as 40.36, al.:— Act., 695.54.
S.E. M. 10.9, Alex.Aphr. Pr. 1.96, Herm. in Phdr. p.132 A.
not fortified, X. Ages. 6.6, SIG 569.7 ( Halasarna, iii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: open, clear, χώρα, f.l.for ἄνυδρος, Hp. Aër. 24.

definition: ἄξαλλα, ἡ, a herb found on the Euphrates and used as a remedy for fever, Chryserm. ap. Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 20.3 (translated by θερμόν).
ἄξεινος, ον, Ion. for ἄξενος, q.v.

children.definition: without a guide, ψυχή Diog. Ep. 39.2.
not received or guided as a guest, Eust. Prooem. 1.10.
inhospitality, Eratosth. ap. Str. 17.1.19, D.S. 1.67.

definition: ἄξενος, Ion. and poet. ἄξεινος, ον,

children.definition: inhospitable, of persons, opp. πολύξεινος, Hes. Op. 715; ἀνὴρ ξένοισιν ἄ. E. Fr. 736; ἄ. καὶ ἄγριον Pl. Sph. 217e; of places, ὅρμος S. Ph. 217 (lyr.); γῆ, στέγη, E. IT 94, Cyc. 91: Comp. and Sup. -ώτερος, -ώτατος, Id. Alc. 556, Med. 1264.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἄξεινος (sc. πόντος) the Axine, afterwds. called the Euxine, Pi. P. 4.203, E. Andr. 793 (lyr.); in full, πόρος, πόντος Ἄ., Id. IT 253, 341.
unwrought, πέτρος S. OC 19, cf. Fr. 322, AP 7.657 ( Leon.): metaph. of a poet, rough, uncouth, Sch. Ar. Ra. 86.

worth, value, τῶν φορτίων Hdt. 4.196; τοῦ τιμήματος τῆς ἀξίας E. Hipp. 623; ἡ ἀ. τοῦ δούλου Pl. Lg. 936d; then, simply, money-value, price, amount, κατʼ ἀξίην ἑκάστου ἀδικήματος ἐδικαίευ Hdt. 1.100; ὑποτελέειν ἀξίην βασιλέϊ Id. 4.201; τῆς ἀ. τιμᾶσθαι estimate the penalty at the real amount, Pl. Ap. 36b, cf. e; τὴν ἀξίαν τῆς βλάβης ἀπογράφεσθαι Id. Lg. 845e; προσάπτειν ἑκάστῳ τῶν ἁμαρτημάτων τὴν ἀ. τοῦ πάθους ib. 876d; μὴ κατʼ ἀξίαν τῆς οὐσίας X. Cyr. 8.4.32; σκοποῦμαι . . εἰ ἄρα ὥσπερ τῶν οἰκετῶν, οὕτω καὶ τῶν φίλων εἰσὶν ἀξίαι Id. Mem. 2.5.2; κατὰ τὴν τῆς ὀλιγωρίας ἀ. according to the amount of his neglect, Decr. ap. D. 18.74; ἡ κατʼ ἀ. ἰσότης proportionate equality, Arist. Pol. 1302a8; τὸ κατʼ ἀ. ἴσον ib. 1301b30; παρὰ τὴν ἀ. Id. EN 1122b29, al.

data.quote: σκοποῦμαι . . εἰ ἄρα ὥσπερ τῶν οἰκετῶν, οὕτω καὶ τῶν φίλων εἰσὶν ἀξίαι

children.definition: reputation, dignity, Th. 6.68, D. 13.18, cf. 18.63; ἡ τῆς ἀρχῆς ἀ. Pl. Lg. 945b; ἡ τῆς ἀ. τιμή ib. 744b; οἱ ἐπʼ ἀξίας persons of dignity, official personages, Luc. Nigr. 24; ἐξεπορεύετο μετὰ μεγάλης ἀ. with great dignity, pomp, Plb. 38.8.6; κατὰ δουλικὴν ἀξίαν κοσμεῖσθαι D.S. 5.40.

due, merit, deserts, τὴν μὲν ἀ. οὐ λάμψεαι, ἐλάσσω δὲ τῆς ἀξίης Hdt. 7.39; εἰ τῆς ἀ. ἐτύγχανες Ar. Av. 1223; κατʼ ἀξίαν according to desert or merit, duly, E. Hec. 374, Pl. R. 496a, cf. Phd. 113e, al.; ὑπὲρ τὴν ἀ. beyond desert, undeservedly, E. HF 146, D. 2.3; παρὰ τὴν ἀ., οὐ κατʼ ἀ., Th. 7.77, cf. D. 1.23.

data.quote: τὴν μὲν ἀ. οὐ λάμψεαι, ἐλάσσω δὲ τῆς ἀξίης

children.label: b
children.definition: penalty, τὴν ἀ. ἀποτίνειν, ὑπέχειν, Luc. DMort. 24[30].1, Pisc. 8.
moral value, Stoic. 3.30: pl., Cleanth. ib. 1.129.

children.label: II
children.definition: estimate of a thingʼs worth, opinion, κατὰ τὴν ἰδίαν ἀ. D.S. 14.10, cf. 107; esp. estimate of the moral value of actions, αἱ τῶν ἐκτὸς ἀξίαι Arr. Epict. 1.2.7, cf. 1.25.17.
worth admiring, admirable, X. Lac. 10.2, Ael. Fr. 116, Jul. Or. 6.190d.
worth hearing, X. Smp. 4.44.
worth listening to, X. Lac. 4.2 (in Sup. -ότατος).
delectable, Stoic. 3.180.
worth telling, Hdt. 1.16, 177 ( Sup.), J. AJ 15.11.5 ( Sup.), Arr. An. 1 Praef. 1 ( Comp.).
Inscr.2 No. 160.33 ( Lampsacus), No. 130.5 ( Tenedos).
pitiable, Diog. Ep. 27.

definition: ἀξιεπαίνετος, ον, = v.l. for sq., in X. HG 4.4.6.

children.definition: praiseworthy, X. Cyr. 3.3.6, D. 61.15; χρῆμα, of a dead ox, Ael. NA 2.57, etc.: Sup. -ότατος X. HG 4.4.6. Adv. -νως Apollon. Vit.Aeschin. 11.
worthy of desire, Hsch. s.v. ἀξιέραστον.
worthy of love, X. Cyr. 5.2.9, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.181, Plu. Comp.Thes.Rom. 1, Luc. DMar. 1.2, Aristaenet. 1.27; οἰκονομία PMag.Par. 1.2010: Comp., X. Smp. 8.14.
Diog. Ep. 35 and 36.

definition: ἀξινάριον, τό, Dim. of sq., J. BJ 2.8.7.

children.definition: axe-head, ἀξίνην ἐΰχαλκον ἐλαΐνῳ ἀμφὶ πελέκκῳ Il. 13.612.
battle-axe (expl. as δίστομος πέλεκυς by Hsch.), ib. 15.711, cf. Hdt. 7.64.
axe for hewing wood, X. An. 1.5.12, Ev.Matt. 3.10, Ev.Luc. 3.9. (Cf. Goth. aqizi, OE. æx, Lat. ascia (fr. *acsia).)

definition: ἀξινίδιον, τό, Dim. of foreg., J. BJ 2.8.9.

children.definition: helve of an axe, Zonar. s.v. στελεός.
struck by an axe, An.Par. 3.114, Sch. Il. 1.1.
acisculus, ligo, Gloss.
worth living for, οὐκ ἀξιοβίωτόν ἐστιν X. HG 4.4.6.
worthy of tears, Sch. E. Med. 1221.
deserving, honourable, IGRom. 4.1398 ( Smyrna).
fit for, capable of work, X. Oec. 7.34.
enviable, Ael. VH 12.64, Them. Or. 13.175b ( Sup.). Adv. -λως Suid.
= foreg., Phld. Piet. 66 ( Sup.); νίκη Plu. Flam. 20.
worthy of emulation, Dsc. Praef. 4.
worth inquiry, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 6.7.
worthy of death, Sch. A. Th. 582.
wonder-worthy, X. Mem. 1.4.4 ( Comp.), Callix. 1, Aristeas 282.
well worth seeing, Hdt. 1.14, 184, al., X. Smp. 1.10, Corn. ND 17: Comp. -ότερος Plu. Demetr. 43: Sup. -ότατος Hdt. 2.176, X. Lac. 4.2.
worthy of God, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 5.34.
worth seeing, Alciphr. 3.55:—in poet. forms ἀξίθεος Epigr.Gr. 981; ἀξιθέωρος, ον, ibid. ( Philae).
worthy of lamentation, E. Alc. 904 (lyr.).
worth being led in triumph, Suet. Cal. 47.
deserving contempt, Iamb. VP 31.206.
worthy of our society, Pl. R. 371e; worthy to share in, τοῦ συλλόγου Lg. 961a.
worth getting, X. Cyr. 5.2.10, Paus. 1.9.5, Philostr. Ep. 9; ἐς φιλίαν Aristid.Quint. 3.18.
worth acceptance, precious, Hsch.

worthy of mention, remarkable, ὁ ἐν Ἐφέσῳ νηός Hdt. 2.148, etc.; πόλεμος -ώτατος Th. 1.1; τοῦτο -ώτερον X. Cyr. 8.2.13; ἀλίθοι Suid. Adv. -γως X. Mem. 1.5.5, Aristeas 72, Phld. Rh. 1.2 S., al., Plu. Sanit. 2.128e.
of note, important, τοὺς μάλιστα ἐν τέλει καὶ ἀξιολογωτάτους Th. 2.10, etc.

data.quote: τοὺς μάλιστα ἐν τέλει καὶ ἀξιολογωτάτους

children.definition: ἀ. μιμήματα imitations of worthy objects, Pl. Lg. 669e.

definition: ἀξιομαθής, ές, = sq., X. Ep. 7 ( Comp.).

children.definition: worth being learnt, Iamb. VP 3.14.
worthy to be deemed happy, X. Ap. 34 ( Sup.).
a match for another in battle or war, τινί Hdt. 7.157, Th. 8.38; πρός τινα Plu. Cat.Ma. 12, etc.: abs., Hdt. 3.19, 8.63, Th. 8.80, Aen.Tact. 2.5.

inf., sufficient in strength or number, νέες ἀξιόμαχοι τῆσι Αἰγινητέων συμβαλεῖν Hdt. 6.89; νεῶν . . ἀξιομάχων δέκεσθαι τὸν ἐπιόντα Id. 7.138, cf. 101; ἀξιόμαχόν τι δρᾶν D.C. 43.4. Adv. -χως, τινὶ συνεστάναι Plu. Sull. 19.
worthy of imitation, Ecphant. ap. Stob. 4.7.65.
worthy of hate, hateful, D.C. 78.21.

definition: ἀξιομίσητος [ῑ], ον, = foreg., Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10a, Inv. 537d, D.C. 38.44:—also ἀξιόμῑσος, ον, A. Eu. 366 (lyr.).

children.definition: worthy of mention, Pl. Prt. 343a, Smp. 178a, X. HG 4.8.1, etc.
shapely, beautiful, Man. 4.513.
worthy of victory, worthy of being preferred, X. Cyr. 1.5.10: c. inf., -ότερος ἔχειν τοῦτο τὸ κράτος more worthy to hold this supremacy, Hdt. 7.187, cf. 9.26: Sup., Luc. Anach. 36.
lamentable, E. Hipp. 1465.
to be worthy of belief, Phld. Po. 1676.11.
trustworthiness, Hipparch. 1.1.7, Phld. Rh. 1.45S., D.S. 1.23, Longin. 16.2, etc.
plausibility, J. BJ 1.32.2; credibility, Alex. Fig. 1.17.

trustworthy, Pl. Alc. 1.123b; ἀ. ἄν εἰκότως φαίνοιτο D. 1.3; κτησίας οὐκ ὢν ἀ. Arist. HA 606a8, al.; ἀ. εἴς τι X. Mem. 1.5.2; ναύλοχα ἀ. πρὸς τοσαύτην ναυτιλίαν sufficient for . ., Plu. Caes. 58: Comp., Phld. Mus. p.77 K.
trustworthy, Arist. GA 741a37. Adv. -τως, ἀ. συνῶπται 741a34.
plausible, in Adv. -τως Timae. 70, Gal. 17(2).139.
exacting due punishment, of Athena at Sparta, Paus. 3.15.6.
proper, becoming, σῶμα X. Smp. 8.40 ( Sup.), cf. Phld. Rh. 2.30S.
worthy of command, Poll. 1.178.
worth seeing, Luc. Hist.Conscr. 32, Ph. 1.441.

definition: ἄξιος, ία, ιον ( ος, ον Nonn. D. 8.314), for *ἄγ-τιος,

children.definition: counterbalancing, cf. ἄγω VI: hence prop. weighing as much, of like value, worth as much as, c. gen., βοὸς ἄ. Il. 23.885; νῦν δʼ οὐδʼ ἑνὸς ἄξιοί εἰμεν Ἕκτορος we are not—all together— worth one Hector, 8.234, cf. Hdt. 1.32, 7.21; πάντων Ζεὺς ἄξιον ἦμαρ ἔδωκεν Il. 15.719; so πολλοῦ ἄ. worth much, X. An. 4.1.28, Pl. Smp. 185b, etc.; πλείονος ἄ. Id. Phdr. 235b, etc.; πλείστου ἄ. Th. 2.65, Pl. Grg. 464d, etc.; παντός, τοῦ παντὸς ἄ., E. Fr. 275, Pl. Sph. 216c; παντὸς ἄ., c. inf., Ar. Av. 797; λόγου ἄ., = ἀξιόλογος, Hdt. 1.133, Th. 1.73, etc.; σπουδῆς, μνήμης ἄ., Plu. Aud.poet. 2.35a, Apophth.reg. 172e:—opp. to these are οὐδενὸς ἄ. Thgn. 456; ἢ παντὸς ἢ τὸ παράπαν οὐδενός Pl. Phlb. 64d; ὀλίγου Id. Grg. 497b, etc.; σμικροῦ Id. R. 504d, etc.; βραχέος Id. Lg. 692c; μείονος, ἐλάττονος ἄ., X. Vect. 4.50, Cyr. 2.2.14; πολλαπλασίου τιμήματος ἄ. κτήσεις Arist. Pol. 1306b12; also εἰς ὀγδοήκοντα μνᾶς ἄ. worth up to a sum of . ., D. 27.10.

data.quote: ἢ παντὸς ἢ τὸ παράπαν οὐδενός

children.definition: σοὶ δʼ ἄξιόν ἐστιν ἀμοιβῆς ʼtis worth a return to thee, i.e. will bring thee a return, Od. 1.318; πολέος δέ οἱ ἄξιος ἔσται Il. 23.562; βασιλεῖ ἂν πολλοῦ ἄξιοι γένοιντο X. An. 2.1.14.
worthy, goodly, ἄξια δῶρα Il. 9.261; ἄ. ὦνος a goodly price, Od. 15.429; ὅθεν κέ τοι ἄξιον ἄλφοι it would bring thee a good price, 20.383; φέροντες ὅ τι ἕκαστος ἄξιον εἶχε X. Cyr. 3.3.2.
