children.definition: lighten, lessen, βάρος ψυχῆς E. Alc. 354; τῶν ἐγκαλουμένων ἀπηντληκώς τι having shed some of his faults, Phld. Lib. p.35 O.:—in Pass., Ph. 1.266, Plu. Alex. 57.
drawing off, of moisture, Arist. Pr. 869b38; of blood, with menses, Sor. 1.29.
one must draw off, as water, Gp. 6.18.
entreat one not to do a thing, E. Rh. 901 (lyr., tm.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Phryn. 254.
always, A.D. Synt. 263.2, al.
finish entirely, νῆες ἀπήνυσαν οἴκαδε (sc. ὁδόν) the ships performed the voyage home, Od. 7.326:— Pass., Q.S. 5.1.
from above, from the top, τοῦ τείχους LXX 2 Ki. 11.20, al.

once, once only, once for all, first in Od., ὅτε τʼ ἄλλοι ἅ. θνῄσκουσʼ ἄνθρωποι 12.22; ἅ. . . ἀπὸ θυμὸν ὀλέσσαι ib. 350; ἀπαλλάχθηθʼ ἅ. E. Cyc. 600; οὐχ ἅ. μόνον more than once, A. Pr. 211; ἅ. . . κοὐχὶ δίς S. OC 1208; πολλάκις καὶ οὐχὶ ἅ. Hdt. 7.46; πολλάκις τε κοὐχ ἅ. S. OT 1275; μὴ ἅ. ἀλλὰ πολλάκις Antipho 1.3, cf. Pl. Lg. 711a; μὴ δίς, ἀλλʼ ἅ. μόνον Arist. Pol. 1299a10; of the self-creation of Νοῦς, τὴν ποίησιν αὑτοῦ . . ἅ. εἶναι Plot. 6.8.21; ἅ. ἔτι yet this once, A. Ag. 1322; τὸ ἅ. τοῦτο at this moment, LXX 2 Ki. 17.7; ἅ. δυοῖν ποδοῖν, i.e. two square feet ( 1 x 2), opp. δυοῖν δίς ( 2 x 2), four, Pl. Men. 82c.

data.quote: ὅτε τʼ ἄλλοι ἅ. θνῄσκουσʼ ἄνθρωποι
Νοῦς, τὴν ποίησιν αὑτοῦ . . ἅ. εἶναι

children.definition: ἅ. τοῦ ἐνιαυτοῦ, ἔτεος ἑκάστου ἅ., Hdt. 2.59, 4.105; also ἐν τῷ ἐνιαυτῷ ἅ. Id. 2.132.
once on a time, formerly, ἅ. καὶ ἅ. LXX Jd. 20.30.

children.label: II
children.definition: once, when once, εἴπερ ἐσπείσω γʼ ἅ. if once you have made a treaty, Ar. Ach. 307. cf. 923; ἢν ἅ. ἁλῷ Id. V. 898, cf. Av. 342; ἂν ἅ. τις ἀποθάνῃ Amphis 8; ἐπειδήπερ γʼ ἅ. ἐμοὶ σεαυτὸν παραδέδωκας Ar. V. 1129; ἐπεὶ ἅ. ἐταράχθησαν Th. 7.44; ὡς ἅ. ἤρξατο X. HG 5.4.58; ἐπεὶ ἅ. αὐτοῖς φίλος ἐγένετο Id. An. 1.9.10, cf. 3.2.25, Isoc. 12.242; ὡς ἅ. ἐγκλήματα ἐταράχθη D. 18.151: so with part., ἐπὶ γᾶν ἅ. πεσὸν . . . αἷμα A. Ag. 1019 (lyr.); ἅ. θανόντος οὔτις ἔστʼ ἀνάστασις Id. Eu. 648; ἅ. ἐλθόντες Pl. Prm. 165e, cf. Ep.Hebr. 6.4, etc. ( ἁ- = sṃ (cf. εἷς) ; -παξ akin to πήγνυμι.)

data.quote: ἐπειδήπερ γʼ ἅ. ἐμοὶ σεαυτὸν παραδέδωκας

children.definition: all together, the whole, περιτρέχων τὴν γῆν ἁπαξάπασαν Hermipp. 4.3; ἡμέρα ἁ. Stratt. 36.2; ἁπαξάπαν Xenarch. 7.16: ἁπαξαπάσης τιμῆς Phld. Mort. 23: mostly in pl., all at once, all together, Ar. Pl. 111, 206, etc.
in general, Hierocl. p.51A., PLips. 27.29 (ii A.D.), S.E. M. 7.428, Luc. Peregr. 3, etc.
disvalue, Zeno Stoic. 1.48, cf. Antip. ib. 3.251, Arr. Epict. 1.2.10, S.E. M. 11.62.
unworthy of, τινός Pl. Lg. 645c.

children.label: II
children.definition: οὐκ ἀ. [ἐστι], c. inf., Id. Ep. 324b. Adv. -ίως Iamb. Myst. 5.6.
disclaim as unworthy, disown, τι or τινά, Th. 1.5, Plb. 1.67.13, Plot. 5.8.3; ἀ. τινὸς μή, c. inf., Paus. 10.14.6.
ἀ. ἑαυτὸν τῶν καλλίστων Arist. Mu. 391a6; but τί τινος deem a thing unworthy of one, Luc. Dom. 2:— Med., λέσχας ἇς ἀπηξιώσατο deemed them unworthy of . ., banished them from . ., A. Eu. 367.
arrest, POxy. 33 iii 15 (ii A.D.).
rejection, contempt, Plb. Fr. 10, D.H. 1.9; τῆς ἀρχῆς 5.71.

definition: ἁπαξοί. μοναχοί, Hsch.; perh. to be read in Hdt. 2.79, 7.96.
ἀπάορος, ον, Dor. for ἀπήορος, q.v.

children.definition: dandelion, Taraxacum officinale, Thphr. HP 7.7.1, 7.8.3 and 11.3 (ex cod. Urb. pro vulg. ἀπάτη vel ἀφάκη), cf. Plin. HN 21.99.
with no grandfather: metaph., φάος οὐκ ἄπαππον Ἰδαίου πυρός light not unfathered by the Idaean flame, A. Ag. 311.

unalterable, εἱρμὸς αἰτιῶν Stoic. 2.266; ἐπιπλοκή, of causation, Chrysipp. ib. 293; τάξις Plu. Def.orac. 2.410f; ἡ τῆς κινήσεως ἰδέα Ocell. 1.15; infallible, προρρήσεις Iamb. VP 28.135, cf. Philum. Ven. 4.14; also of persons, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).215. Adv. -τως Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.279.
inviolable, κύρια καὶ ἀ. PRyl. 65.18 (i B.C.), cf. PGrenf. 1.60.7 (vi A.D.).
permanent, perpetual, ἱερωσύνη Ep.Hebr. 7.24.
Act., not transgressing, J. AJ 18.8.2; ἀ. τῶν καθηκόντων Hierocl. in CA 10p.435M. Adv. -τως Arr. Epict. 2.15.1.
not branching laterally, Thphr. HP 1.2.5, CP 1.1.3; not budding laterally, Id. HP 3.17.2.
incomparable, PLond. 2.232.5 (iv A.D.), f.l. for -βατος in Ph. 2.509.
without deposit made, κρίσιν ἀπάρβολον IG 9(1).694.115; δίκα GDI 5017 (Gortyn, prob.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -λως without danger, Sch. Il. 13.141.
without formal declaration, πόλεμος Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1920.84 ( Itanos, ii B.C.). Adv. -τως without signal of battle, Plb. 16.3.1, Fr. 11.
without reading, Suid. s.v. Πουλχερία.
incapable of definition, ποσότης Plb. 16.12.10.
not to be turned aside, Hierocl. in CA 13p.450M. Adv. -γως ib. 8p.431M.
not liable to censure, Ptol. Tetr. 170.
not returned, unregistered, ἐδάφη BGU 915.6 (ii A. D.).
inadmissible, Phld. Sign. 17 ( -δεικτον Pap.), A.D. Synt. 59.18, al.; unacceptable, Olymp.Hist. p.465 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not receiving or admitting, c. gen., μαθημάτων Memn. 2.2; [ τῶν ἀγαθῶν] Phld. D. 3 Fr. 42 (dub. rest.); τέχνης Ph. 1.311; διαβολῆς Stoic. 3.153; esp. in Gramm., τῶν ἄρθρων A.D. Synt. 16.18, al.
not defeated in discus-throwing, Ephes. 2 No.72 (iii A. D.).
not padded out with quotations, D.L. 7.181: hence in Gramm., ἀπαράθετα words or phrases without quoted authority, prob. for ἀπαρένθ-, Et.Gud. s.v. ἀεί.
unshaken, not to be shaken, Olymp. in Phlb. p.274S., Eustr. in EN 297.26.

definition: ἀπαραιρημένος, Ion. pf. part. Pass. of ἀφαιρέω.

children.label: I
children.definition: not to be moved by prayer, inexorable, δαίμων Lys. 2.78; θεοί, θεαί, Pl. Lg. 907b, IG 12(2).484 (Lesb.); Δίκη D. 25.11; ἀνάγκη Epicur. Ep. 3p.65U.; δικασταί Lycurg. 2; ἀ. εἶναι περί τι Plu. Pyrrh. 16:— τὸ ἀ. τινος πρὸς τοὺς πονηρούς Id. Publ. 3. Adv. -τως implacably, inexorably, Th. 3.84; ἀ. ἔχειν πρός τινα Plb. 21.31.15.

data.quote: τὸ ἀ. τινος πρὸς τοὺς πονηρούς

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be averted by prayers, inevitable, unmerciful, τιμωρίαι Din. 1.23; κολάσιες Ti. Locr. 104d; νόμος J. Ap. 2.30; ὀργή, κατηγορία, Plb. 1.82.9, 12.12.6; = ἀνήκεστος, βουλεύεσθαί τι ἀ. Id. 4.24.6; ἁμαρτία unpardonable, Id. 33.10.5. Adv. -τως obstinately, Sor. 1.107.

not to be evaded, ἱκέτευμα Plu. Frig. 2.950f; χρεία POxy. 900.12 (iv A. D.), cf. PFlor. 6.11 (iii A. D.); indispensable, ἀριθμός Philostr. VA 3.30; irresistible, προθυμία Orib. Fr. 57. Adv. -τήτως without evasion, PMag.Leid.W. 17.2.
undisguised, γυμνὴ καὶ ἀ. κατηγορία Hld. 10.29. Adv. -τως Pl. R. 538c, Euthd. 294d: Comp. -ότερον D.C. 67.3.
open-hearted, ἀ. τὰς ψυχάς Ptol. Tetr. 155.
unsummoned, volunteering, Th. 2.98; εὔνοια Inscr.Prien. 108.43 (ii B. C.); καὶ παρακαλούμενος καὶ ἀ. Plu. Pyth. 2.403b, cf. CIG 2271.27 ( Delos).

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be consoled, Sch. A. Pr. 185.
not to be reached or attained, Tz. ad Lyc. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. -τως inconsequently, M.Ant. 2.16, Plot. 4.3.28.
not defeated in javelin-throwing, Ephes. 2. No. 72 (iii A. D.).
Hsch.
unintermittent, Simp. in Ph. 213.34. Adv. -τως Syrian. in Metaph. 132.23, Procl. in Prm. p.833 S.
complete, Alex.Trall. 5.1.
with disordered hair, Pherecr. 195.
unceasingly, CIG 2271.7 ( Delos).

precisely similar, indistinguishable, Stoic. 2.26, al., cf. Phld. Sign. 15, al., D.H. 2.71, D.S. 1.91, Plu. Alex. 57, Plot. 5.7.3; ἀ. ἁρμονία πρὸς τὸ ἀρχέτυπον Jul. Or. 2.93a: c. gen., indistinguishable from, Phld. Po. 994.26: c.dat., exactly like, D.S. 2.50. Adv. -τως unchangeably, LXX Es. 3.13, BMus.Inscr. 481*.402 ( Ephesus), Theo Sm. p.172 H.; in precisely similar terms, Ath. 1.26a, etc.; indistinguishably, Stoic. 2.190, al., Plot. 2.1.2.
indistinguishability, Stoic. 2.34 (pl.), cf. Phld. Sign. 6, 37; ὁμοιότης κατʼ -ίαν S.E. M. 7.108.

children.label: II
children.definition: unshakable determination, Stoic. 3.73.
not to be deceived, τῶν καθηκόντων τήρησις Hierocl. in CA 10p.437M.; not liable to error, Nicom. Harm. 6. Adv. -τως undoubtedly, Ruf. ap. Orib. 45.30.55.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not deceiving, Hsch. s.v. ἀπαράσημον.
not without reason or method, Iamb. VP 30.182.
irrevocable, λόγος PGrenf. 1.60.31 (vi A. D.).
unmixed, Sch. Od. 2.341.
unrivalled, J. AJ 8.7.3.
not abiding, transient, Secund. Sent. 14, Vett.Val. 39.30, al.
not to be persuaded or entreated, inexorable, Pl. Epin. 980d, Plu. QConv. 2.629a.
incorrigible, in Adv. -τως Pl. Lg. 731d.

children.label: II
children.definition: comfortless, Plu. Alex. fort. 2.332d; not admitting consolation, πάθος Jul. Or. 8.245c; κακόν Hld. 1.14.
inconsolable, Id. 2.33. Adv. -τως Jul. Or. 8.252a.
inexorable, κέαρ A. Pr. 185 (lyr.); restive, ὄμμα πωλικόν E. IA 620. [In A. ᾱπ- metri gr.]
propitiate, τοῖς θεοῖς Mim. in POxy. 413vii 133.
not to be seduced, D.H. 8.61.

free from embarrassment or interference, Arr. Epict. 1.1.10, al., BGU 1124.44 (i B. C.); ὁρμή Hld. 3.13; clear, διάνοια Hices. ap. Ath. 15.689c. Adv. -τως Arr. Epict. 2.13.21, S.E. M. 1.178, PLond. 3.1168.12 (i A. D.), Gal. 4.725.
unnoticed, ἀ. τι ἀφιέναι, ἐᾶσαι, LXX 2 Ma. 15.36, Mon.Ant. 23.61 ( Seleucia), cf. Michel 546.21 ( Anisa, i B. C.).
not counterfeit, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: κατηγορία φόνου ἀ. with no defendant named, Antipho 2.1 tit.
want of preparation, Hp. Acut. 65.
= sq., X. An. 1.5.9 ( Comp.), 2 Ep.Cor. 9.4, J. AJ 4.8.41. Adv. -τως Arist. Rh.Al. 1430a3.

without preparation, unprepared, Antipho 5.18 ( Sup.), Th. 2.87; ἀπαράσκευόν τινα λαβεῖν X. Cyr. 7.5.25; ἀ. ληφθῆναι D. 40.30; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ μέλλον Plb. 1.49.4: c. gen., unprovided with, τῶν ἐπιτηδείων J. BJ 3.7.32; also of things, ἀπόστασις Th. 3.13: Sup., X. an. 1.1.6. Adv. ἀπαρασκεύως, ἔχειν, διακεῖσθαι, Plb. 1.45.7, 14.10.7.
not having appeared in person, PLond. 2.260.128 (i A. D.).
strike off, ἀντικρὺ δʼ ἀπάραξε [τὴν αἰχμήν] Il. 16.116; ἀπήραξεν δὲ χαμᾶζε . . κάρη 14.497; ἀ. τοῦ ἵππου τοὺς πόδας Hdt. 5.112; κρᾶτα S. Tr. 1015 (lyr.).
knock or sweep off, τοὺς ἐπιβάτας ἀπὸ τῆς νεός Hdt. 8.90; τοὺς ἀπὸ τοῦ πολεμίου καταστρώματος ὁπλίτας ἀ. Th. 7.63:— Pass., aor. part. ἀπαραχθείς D.H. 8.85.

data.quote: τοὺς ἀπὸ τοῦ πολεμίου καταστρώματος ὁπλίτας ἀ.

children.definition: crush, ἀπὸ δʼ ὀστέον ἄχρις ἄραξε Il. 16.324:— Pass., -άσσεται τὴν κεφαλήν J. BJ 3.7.23.
not parallel in formation, EM 13.33: c. dat., ἀ. οὐδετέρῳ having no corresponding neuter, Eust. 94.30.
unextended, Simp. in Ph. 640.21. Adv. -τως without extension: of Time, in a moment, τὴν ἁφὴν ἀθρόως καὶ ἀ. γίνεσθαι Id. in Cael. 313.22.

data.quote: τὴν ἁφὴν ἀθρόως καὶ ἀ. γίνεσθαι

children.definition: not observed, IG 2(2).1035.11 (i B.C.). Adv. -τως without precautions, Plb. 3.52.7, 14.1.12, J. BJ 4.3.3, Ph. Fr. 105H.
with hairs not pulled out, Ar. Lys. 279, Luc. Salt. 5.
not turned, of clothes, Phryn. PS p.52 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be perverted, Plu. QConv. 2.745d; of persons, Poll. 8.10. Adv. -τως M.Ant. 1.16.1.
not subject to increase, dub. in Gal. 8.913.
free from damage, ἔργον IG 12(3).326 ( Thera).
not to be guarded against, Sch. Il. 11.297.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med.) careless, heedless, Sch. E. Hipp. 657.
not counterfeit, Damocr. ap. Gal. 14.135, Hsch. s.v. ἀπαράσημον.
without anything poured in, unmixed, οἶνος Gal. 13.721, cf. 10.832; ὕδωρ Hld. 5.16: generally, pure, Plu. Sollert. 2.968c.
not giving ground, staunch, Plb. 1.61.3. Adv. -τως, διακεῖσθαι περί τινος Id. 5.106.5.
refusing to retire, unyielding, τὸ ἀ. τῆς ἐξουσίας D.H. 10.19; φιλαρχία ἀ. 10.54, cf. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.10a.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., not permitted, Sch. Opp. H. 5.416.
hawkʼs-beard, Crepis Columnae, Thphr. HP 7.8.3.
Ar. Pax 1056, Lyc. 106.
appraise at cash value, ὄψα Them. Or. 23.292d:— Med., buy off, πολέμους Lyd. Mag. 3.45.
selling for ready money, Gloss.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. adaeratio, PFlor. 377.4 (vi A. D.), Just. Nov. 43.1 Intr., 130.4.
Artem. 1.50.
direct, Gal. UP 15.8; inflexible, νόμοι φυσικοὶ ἀ. Nicom. Ar. 1.23; πρόνοια Hero *Deff. 136.57.
straight, εὐθεῖα (sc. γραμμή) Phlp. in Mete. 21.10, cf. Ammon. in Porph. 9.1. Adv. -τως Gal. 18(2).726; not diverging from the perpendicular, Eustr. in EN 74.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: unimpaired, ὑγίεια Iamb. VP 3.13.
not to be tampered with, inviolable, Ti.Locr. 95a, Arr. Epict. 4.1.161, J. AJ 15.8.1. Adv. -τως inimitably, perfectly, D.S. 4.78.
Ath. 1.27a.
Sor. 1.3; ἡ τοῦ κόσμου διοίκησις Chrysipp.Stoic. 297, cf. S.E. M. 1.147. Adv. -τως Aët. 16.61, Hdn. Fig. p.96S., Alex.Aphr. in Top. 46.3.
not determinative or indicative, c. gen., A.D. Synt. 239.8, cf. Herm. in Phdr. p.124A., Ps.-Alex.Aphr. in SE 36.17. Adv. -τως Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἡ ἀπαρέμφατος (sc. ἔγκλισις) the infinitive mood (cf. παρεμφατικός), D.H. Comp. 5, A.D. Synt. 226.20, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 34.28; τὸ ἀ. S.E. P. 1.204. Adv. -τως in the infinitive mood, ἀναγνῶναι take as an infinitive, A.D. Synt. 76.16.
not considering, carelessly, M.Ant. 10.8. Adv. -τως Id. 6.53.
undisturbed, συμβίωσις Phld. Ir. p.78 W.; ὑπό τινων BGU 1140.24 (i B. C.), cf. IGRom. 4.2927 (Pergam.), PTeb. 41.24, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.118b.
to be disagreeable to, τινί Th. 1.38, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.6b.
displease, Pl. Tht. 202d, Jul. Mis. 365d.
τὰ ἀπαρέσαντα J. AJ 8.14.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., οὐ . . γάρ τι νεμεσσητὸν βασιλῆα ἄνδρʼ ἀπαρέσσασθαι it is no disgrace for a king to approve a man (or, to appease a man of royal birth), Il. 19.183, cf. Sch. and Eust. ad loc.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀπαρέσκεσθαί τινι to be displeased with, Hdn. 5.2.5, cf. 5.6.1, 6.1.10, Lyd. Mag. 2.7.
unpleasing, Stob. 2.7.11k.
unconsoled, Plu. Dem. 22; admitting of no consolation, συμφορά J. AJ 7.6.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be controlled, Men. 798, Plu. Mar. 2, Ant. 6; inexorable, Hp. Decent. 4. Adv. -τως inflexibly, Ph. 2.196.
unconsoling, θρῆνος Epigr.Gr. 344.2 ( Mysia).
unmaidenly, unfitting a maiden, E. Ph. 1739 (lyr.), neut. pl. as Adv., cf. Id. IA 993.

children.label: II
children.definition: deflowered, Sch. Theoc. 2.41.

children.label: III
children.definition: virginal (as if from παρθενεύω, = κορεύω), S. Fr. 304, Carm.Pop. 8.
no more a maid, Theoc. 2.41; νύμφην ἄνυμφον παρθένον τʼ ἀπάρθενον ‘virgin wife and widowed maid’, E. Hec. 612.
to be jointed, ἀπό τινος Hp. Art. 30.
articulation, Gal. 18(1).433.
count over, take an inventory of, X. Oec. 9.10; reckon up, Id. Cyr. 5.2.35; μύθους ἀ. recount, Arist. Po. 1453a18:— Pass., Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 64.11, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: reckon or pay back, repay, X. Cyr. 3.1.42, D.H. 4.10 (4.62.3?), etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: Med., secure payment of a sum owing, IG 1.32, cf. ib. 2(2).1122; but,
= Act. in Men. Epit. 164, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 422.3; ἀ. προγόνους δυνάστας Jul. Or. 2.83b; enumerate, σοφῶν ὀνόματα Id. Gal. 176b.
counting over, ὀνομάτων Th. 5.20, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 425.8, Procl. in Prm. p.908 S., in Ti. 1.15 D., al.:— Adj. ἀπᾰριθμ-ητικός, ή, όν, Sch. Hermog. Id. in Rh. 7.1027 W.
cleavers, Galium Aparine, Thphr. HP 7.14.2, Plu. QConv. 2.709e, Dsc. 3.90, Gal. 11.834.
of the ἀπαρίνη, χυλός Nic. Th. 953.
after luncheon, Tab.Defix.Aud. 187.63.
finish luncheon, Gloss.
suffice, be sufficient, Sol. 5 (ap. Arist. Ath. 12.1), A. Pers. 474, S. OC 1769 (lyr.), E. Fr. 892; πρός τι S.E. P. 1.185: abs., οὐκ ἀπήρκει it was not enough, Ar. Fr. 457, cf. D.H. 11.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be contented, acquiesce, ὥστʼ ἀπαρκεῖν A. Ag. 379 (lyr.):— Pass., Cerc. 18 ii 13, Lyc. 1302.
sufficient, Hsch.
sufficiently, Poll. 9.154 (perh. f.l. for ἐπαρκούντως).
one must offer as first-fruits, sacrifice, Ph. 1.533, Them. Or. 11.142a, Porph. Abst. 2.61.
north wind, Arist. Mete. 363b14, al., Thphr. Sign. 2.35. The form ἀπαρκίας, mentioned by Eust. 1156.17, 1535.16, but censured by Phryn. PS p.31 B., occurs( = Septentrio) in IG 14.1308, Gloss.
northerly, πνοαί Lyc. 27.

definition: ἀπαρνέομαι, fut. -ήσομαι Pl. Grg. 461c: aor. ἀπηρνησάμην Call. Cer. 75, 107, A.R. 3.1133 (v.l.), Ev.Matt. 16.24, al., but in Trag. and Att., -ηρνήθην S. Tr. 480, E. Hipp. 1266, Th. 6.56, etc.:—

children.definition: deny utterly, Hdt. 6.69; κλέψαντες ἀπαρνεῖσθαι Antipho 2.3.4; μή . . ἀπαρνηθεὶς γένῃ Pl. Sph. 217c; ἀπαρνηθῆναί τι to refuse, reject it, Th. l.c., etc.; ἀ. μή c. inf., τὸν . . ἀπαρνηθέντα μὴ χρᾶναι E. l.c.; οὐκ ἀπαρνοῦμαι τὸ μή (sc. δρᾶσαι) S. Ant. 443, Aj. 96; τίνα οἴει ἀπαρνήσεσθαι μὴ οὐ . .; Pl. Grg. 461c; οἷός ἐστι μὴ ἂν ἀ. χαρίσασθαι Id. Phdr. 256a.

data.quote: οἷός ἐστι μὴ ἂν ἀ. χαρίσασθαι

children.definition: κατηγορεῖν, deny, Arist. APr. 41a9:— Pass., ib. 63b37.
ἀ. ἑαυτόν deny oneself, Ev.Matt. 16.24, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., fut. ἀπαρνηθήσεται it shall be denied or refused, S. Ph. 527, cf. Ev.Luc. 12.9, dub. in LXX Is. 31.7: aor. ὥνθρωπος ἓν μὲν οἶδεν, ἓν δʼ ἀπηρνήθη was refused, Herod. 4.74.

data.quote: ὥνθρωπος ἓν μὲν οἶδεν, ἓν δʼ ἀπηρνήθη

children.definition: denial, renunciation, Ph. 2.438.
one who denies, Gloss.
denying, Eust. 29.44.
denying utterly, ἄ. ἐστι μὴ νοσέειν Hdt. 3.99, cf. Antipho 1.9 and 10: c. gen., ἄ. οὐδενὸς καθίστατο she denied nothing, S. Ant. 435.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., denied, ᾇ . . οὐδὲν ἄπαρνον τελέθει to whom nothing is denied, A. Supp. 1039 (lyr.).
inaccessible, κρημνοί D.S. 17.67.
without paroxysms, Alex.Trall. 8.2.
not excitable, Theag. ap. Stob. 3.1.116.
without bodily presence, Olymp. in Alc. p.13C.
niggardly, Vett.Val. 85.24; impraestans, Gloss.
plough up, Suid. (expl. by ἀπηροτρίασα).
produce male plants, opp. ἀποθηλύνομαι, Thphr. HP 7.4.3 ( Pass.).
deprived of freedom of speech, Thphr. Fr. 103; πολιτεία Plb. 22.12.2; having no right of speech, Cic. Att. 9.2.2; not frank, Phld. Herc. 1457.12, Id. Rh. 2.158S.

children.label: II
children.definition: not speaking freely, J. BJ 4.5.4, Plu. Adul. 2.51c, al., Luc. Cal. 9. Adv. -τως, εὐλαβεῖσθαι Ph. 1.477.

children.label: b
children.definition: not acting freely, of reptiles, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.69.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., not freely spoken of, Ph. 2.428.
setting out, departure, D.H. 3.58, LXX Nu. 33.2, J. AJ 17.9.3.

hang up: ἀ. δέρην strangle, E. Andr. 412; swing freely, of a stone in a sling, Arist. Mech. 852b1:— Pass., hang loose, X. Eq. 10.9, Arist. Aud. 802a38; ἀπό τινος πρός τι Id. GA 740a29; ἔκ τινος Luc. Pisc. 48; τινός Babr. 17.2.
make dependent upon, ἀ. ἐλπίδας ἐξ ἑαυτοῦ Luc. Tim. 36:— Med., make dependent on oneself, νόμοις τὸ πλῆθος Plu. CG 8.

children.label: II
children.definition: detach, separate, τὸν λόγον τῆς γραφῆς D. 18.59, cf. Arist. Rh. 1407a24:— Pass., ὥστε τὴν χώραν πολὺ τῆς πόλεως ἀπηρτῆσθαι Id. Pol. 1319a34; ὁ πλεύμων . . πολὺ ἀπηρτημένος τῆς καρδίας Id. HA 508a33; οἱ πόροι . . ἀπήρτηνται ἀλλήλων, opp. συμπίπτουσι, ib. 495a18:—but that from which one is separated is often omitted, and the Pass. used absolutely, ἀπηρτημένοι καὶ ταῖς παρασκευαῖς καὶ ταῖς γνώμαις detached, D. 4.12; συνεχεῖς καὶ οὐκ ἀπηρτημένοι not detached, Arist. HA 509b13, cf. 506b19, al.; of Time, τοῖς καιροῖς οὐ μακρὰν ἀπηρτῆσθαι Plb. 12.17.1, cf. Plu. TG 3; λόγος ἀπηρτημένος discrepant, Str. 7.3.2; λίαν ἀπηρτ. far different, Ph. 1.300, cf. Phld. Rh. 1.288 S.

data.quote: ὥστε τὴν χώραν πολὺ τῆς πόλεως ἀπηρτῆσθαι
ὁ πλεύμων . . πολὺ ἀπηρτημένος τῆς καρδίας
ἀπηρτημένοι καὶ ταῖς παρασκευαῖς καὶ ταῖς γνώμαις

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., remove oneself, go away, ἐς ἀλλοτρίαν ἀπαρτᾶν Th. 6.21, cf. D.C. 40.15; to be away, distant, ἀπό τινος Id. 51.4; πρὶν ἀπαρτηθῆναι 44.38 is perh. f.l. for ἀπαντηθῆναι.
raised up, ῥίς Hp. Art. 38 (v.l. ἀπαρτητήν).
hanging from, appendage, τῶν πτερυγίων Arist. GA 720b12.
attachment, Hp. Art. 8 (with v.l. ἀπάρτισις): metaph., dependence, Plot. 5.1.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: detachment, separation, Ph. 1.209.

completely, and, of numbers, exactly, just, ἡμέραι ἀ. ἐνενήκοντα Hdt. 5.53, cf. 2.158; φρόνιμος ὢν ἀ. ταύτης τῆς τέχνης Telecl. 37; ἀ. ἐναρμόζειν πρός τι Hp. Art. 73: of Time, ἀ. ἐν καιροῖσι . . Id. Acut. 41.

data.quote: φρόνιμος ὢν ἀ. ταύτης τῆς τέχνης

children.label: II
children.definition: just the contrary, τί . . ἀποτίνειν τῷδʼ ἀξιοῖς;—ἀ. δή που προσλαβεῖν παρὰ τοῦδʼ ἐγὼ μᾶλλον on the contrary, I expect to receive . ., Pherecr. 93, cf. 71, Ar. Pl. 388.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀπάρτι, properly ἀπʼ ἄρτι, of Time, from now, henceforth, Ev.Matt. 23.39, etc.
just now, even now, Ev.Jo. 13.19, etc. (This is not an Att. use, hence Pl.Com. 143 must be incorrectly interpr. by AB 79.)
household utensils, movables, chattels, Hippon. 26, Thphr. ap. Poll. 10.19, LXX Ex. 40.36.
spoil, including captives, ib. Nu. 31.17, 18.

children.label: II
children.definition: public auction, PStrassb. 59.3 (i B. C.), PGnom. 241 ( -εία, ii A. D.), Poll. l.c.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀπαρτίαν· μετάβασιν, ἀποσκευήν, τέλος, ἀπαρτισμόν, Hsch.
adequately, precisely, λόγος κατʼ ἀνάλυσιν ἀ. ἐκφερόμενος Antip.Stoic. 3.247, cf. Apollod.ib. 3.260; Alex.Aphr. in Top. 42.27; of division, without remainder, Theo Sm. p.76 H.

definition: ἀπαρτίζω, fut. ἀπαρτιῶ Mitteis Chr. 88 iii 13 (ii A. D.):—

children.definition: make even, σπουδὴ . . οὐκ ἀπαρτίζει πόδα does not allow his feet to move evenly, regularly, A. Th. 374 ( Herm. οὐ καταργίζει); produce an even result, Arist. GA 780b10; ἀ. ὥστε σφαιροειδῆ εἶναι make it perfectly spherical, Id. Mete. 340b35; fasten off the ends of a phylactery, PMag.Par. 1.2703.

children.label: II
children.definition: get ready, complete, Plb. 31.12.10; finish, λόγον Iamb. in Nic. p.35 P.; dispose of, δίκας Mitteis Chr. l.c., cf. Charito 6.1; educate an apprentice thoroughly, POxy. 724.11 (ii A. D.):— Pass., to be brought to perfection, Arist. Fr. 282; to be completed, be exactly made up, ἀπηρτισμένης <τῆς> πρώτης περιόδου Hp. Morb. 4.48; ἀπαρτίζεται εἰς ἑπτὰ κεφαλάς, of the golden candlestick, J. AJ 3.6.7: metaph., end, result in, εἴς τι ib. 16.8.2; of multiplication, make, Paul.Al. E. 1; ἀπηρτισμένος complete, perfect, D.H. Dem. 50; στίχος verse coinciding with a sentence, Hdn. Vers. 86; πρὸς τὸ τέλος Phld. Mus. p.31 K., cf. Piet. 66.

to be complete, τῆς ὀκταμήνου ἀπαρτιζούσης Hp. Epid. 2.3.17; ἀ. ὁ τόπος καὶ τὸ σῶμα fit exactly, Arist. Ph. 205a32; ἀ. πρός τι square with, suit exactly, Id. Pol. 1313a7; ἡ ἀπαρτίζουσα ὥρα the fitting season, Id. HA 542a31; τῶν ὀργάνων οὐθὲν ἀπαρτιζόντων Epicur. Nat. 11.6; οἱ -οντες corresponding precisely to definition, Stoic. 2.128. Adv. ἀπαρτισμένως (sic) Simp. in Ph. 949.17; cf. ἀπηρτισμένως.

data.quote: ἀ. ὁ τόπος καὶ τὸ σῶμα

definition: ἀπαρτικός πρὸς ἄπαρσιν καὶ ἀποδημίαν ἕτοιμος, Hsch.

children.definition: an even number or sum, Hdt. 7.29, Lys. Fr. 28 S., Antipho Soph. 99.
goods to public sale, Plu. Cic. 27, Apophth.reg. 2.205c.
arrangement, νεύρων Hp. Art. 8 (with v.l. ἀπάρτησις, q.v.).

definition: ἀπάρτισμα, ατος, τό, = sq., Sm. 3 Ki. 7.9(46).

children.definition: completion, Ev.Luc. 14.28; ἔργων PGiss. 67.9 (ii A. D.); λογοθεσίας Mitteis Chr. 88iv 25 (ii A. D.); κατʼ ἀπαρτισμόν precisely, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.164; οὐ κατʼ ἀπαρτισμὸν ἀλλʼ ἐν πλάτει not narrowly but broadly, D.H. Comp. 24.

data.quote: οὐ κατʼ ἀπαρτισμὸν ἀλλʼ ἐν πλάτει

children.definition: rounding off, βαλάνου Antyll. ap. Orib. 50.3.1.
Gal. 17(2).437; f.l. in Hp. Hum. 6 (to which Gal. refers).

definition: ἀπαρτύειν ἀποκηρύσσειν ( Tarent.), Hsch.; ἀπαρτῦναι· τάξαι, Id.

children.definition: one must draw off: metaph., ἀ. τῶν ἀπειλῶν Ar. Eq. 921.
IG ΙΙ(2).110.27 ( Delos, iii B. C.).
draw off, τὸ ἐπιστάμενον ἀπαρύσαντες having skimmed off the cream, Hdt. 4.2, cf. D.S. 5.37.

draw off, take off the force of a thing, χαλκῷ ἀπὸ ψυχὴν ἀρύσας Epic. ap. Arist. Po. 1457b14; exhaust, come to the end of, Plu. Cohib. 2.463c, etc.:— Med., c. gen., ὁ τῆς μνήμης τῶν ἀγαθῶν ἀπαρυτόμενος skimming the cream of memory, ib. Cons.ux. 610e:— Pass., aor. part., ἀπαρυθεὶς τὴν ἄνω . . ἄνοιαν ἐπιπολάζουσαν having it skimmed off the surface, Alex. 45.
compare to something ancient, τινί τι Ath. 1.20c.

children.label: II
children.definition: assign antiquity to, αἵρεσιν Gal. 14.683; τὸ παγκράτιον Sch. Pi. N. 3.27.
to be or become ancient, ἀπηρχαιωμένα old-fashioned songs, Antiph. 85; ἀ. λέξις, φράσις, D.H. Th. 24, Aristid. Rh. 2p.508J.

definition: ἀπαρχή, ἡ, mostly in pl. ἀπαρχαί (cf. ἄπαργμα):

children.definition: beginning of a sacrifice, primal offering (of hairs cut from the forehead), ἀπαρχαὶ κόμης E. Or. 96, cf. Ph. 1525 (lyr.); later, a banquet held on this occasion, Plu. Aud. 2.40b.

firstlings for sacrifice or offering, first-fruits, ἁπάντων ἀπαρχαί Hdt. 4.71; ἀπαρχὰς ἄγειν θεοῖσι S. Tr. 183; ἀπαρχὰς θύειν E. Fr. 516; ἀ. σκυλευμάτων Ph. 857; ἐπιφέρειν ἀ. τῶν ὡραίων Th. 3.58; τῶν ὄντων Is. 5.42, cf. Epicur. Fr. 130, etc.:—so also in sg., λείας ἀ. S. Tr. 761; ἀ. τῶν πατρων χρημάτων Hdt. 1.92, etc.; ἀνθρώπων ἀ. εἰς Δελφοὺς ἀποστέλλειν Arist. Fr. 485; ἀ. ἀπό τινος ἀνατιθέναι Hdt. 4.88; inscribed on votive offerings, [ ἀνέθηκεν] . . τόδʼ α. IG 1.382, etc.; freq. in LXX, as Ex. 25.2, al., cf. Ep.Rom. 11.16, and metaph., ἀ. τῶν κεκοιμημένων 1 Ep.Cor. 15.20; τῶν κτισμάτων Ep.Jac. 1.18.
ἀπαρχαὶ τῶν ἐμῶν προσφθεγμάτων E. Ion 402; ἀπαρχὴν τῆς σοφίας ἀνέθεσαν Pl. Prt. 343b, etc.; ἀ. ἀπὸ φιλοσοφίας Plu. Apophth.reg. 2.172c.
tax on inheritances, PTaur. 1.7.10; tax paid by Jews, Stud.Pal. 4.72 (i A. D.).
entrance fee, PTeb. 316.10 (i A.D.), al.
board of officials (cf. sq. [ἀπάρχης]), IG 12(8).273 ( Thasos).
birth-certificate of a free person, PTeb. 316.10 (i A. D.), PGnom. 131 (ii A. D.): perh. metaph. in Ep.Rom. 8.23.
official (or perh. ex-magistrate) in Lesbos, IG 12(2).68.5, 69b6 (Mytil.).

make a beginning, esp. in sacrifice; τρίχας ἀπάρχεσθαι begin the sacrifice with the hair, i.e. by cutting off the hair from the forehead and throwing it into the fire, κάπρου ἀπὸ τρίχας ἀρξάμενος Il. 19.254; ἀλλʼ ὅ γʼ ἀπαρχόμενος τρίχας ἐν πυρὶ βάλλεν Od. 14.422: abs., 3.446.

data.quote: ἀλλʼ ὅ γʼ ἀπαρχόμενος τρίχας ἐν πυρὶ βάλλεν

children.label: II
children.definition: cut off part of a thing, offer it, τοῦ ὠτὸς τοῦ κτήνεος Hdt. 4.188; ἀ. κόμης E. El. 91; τῶν κρεῶν καὶ σπλάγχνων offer part of them, Hdt. 4.61: hence,

offer the first-lings or first-fruits, πάντων of all sacrifices, Id. 3.24: abs., begin a sacrifice, Ar. Ach. 244, Pax 1056, etc.; ἀ. τοῖς θεοῖς X. Hier. 4.2; ἀπηργμένοι, of eunuchs, having had their first-fruits offered, Anaxandr. 39.11.
take as the first-fruits, take as the choice or best, δικαστήν Pl. Lg. 767c: abs., offer first-fruits, Theoc. 17.109.

children.label: III
children.definition: offer, dedicate, χρυσᾶς (sc. δραχμάς) IG 2.652 B19, cf. Plu. Sull. 27, AP 7.406 ( Theodorid.).

children.label: IV
children.definition: begin, c. gen., πημάτων Lyc. 1409: c. inf., v.l. in Luc. Nigr. 3; practise, prelude on, ὀργάνων Him. Or. 17.2.
commander, A. Pers. 327 (v.l. ἔπ-), Ag. 1227 [edited from Supp.].
lead the way, εἰς νᾶσον B. 11.6 (s. v.l.); esp. in dancing, ὁ ἀπάρχων τῶν ὀρχηστῶν dub. l. in D.H. 7.73; ὔμμι δʼ ἀπάρξει shall lead you in the dance, AP 9.189.

children.label: II
children.definition: reign far away from home, of Teucer, Pi. N. 4.46.
without alteration, Eust. 1090.12.

definition: ἅπας, ἅπᾱσα (also ἅπανσα SIG 56.25 ( Argos, v B.C.)), ἅπαν ( ἅ- = sṃ-, cf. εἷς), strengthd. for πᾶς,

children.definition: quite all, the whole, and in pl. all together, freq. from Hom. downwds.; ἅπασι in all things, Hdt. 1.1; τοῖσι ἅπασι 91; ἐν ἅπασι Hp. Coac. 156; ἐφʼ ἅπασι Ph. 2.365.

Adj., ἀργύρεος δὲ ἔστιν ἅ. all silver, i.e. of massive silver, Od. 4.616, 15.116; ἅ. δὲ τραχὺς ὅστις ἂν νέον κρατῇ A. Pr. 35; μικκός γα μᾶκος . . ἀλλʼ ἅπαν κακόν Ar. Ach. 909, cf. Theoc. 15.19, 148; ἡ ἐναντία ἅπασα ὁδός the exactly contrary way, Pl. Prt. 317b.

data.quote: ἅ. δὲ τραχὺς ὅστις ἂν νέον κρατῇ
μικκός γα μᾶκος . . ἀλλʼ ἅπαν κακόν

children.definition: Subst., all possible, absolute, ἅπασʼ ἀνάγκη Ar. Th. 171; σπουδή D.H. 6.23; ἀτοπία Plb. 39.1.7; εἰς ἅπαν ἀφικέσθαι ἀνοίας Paus. 7.15.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. in sg., every one, neut. everything, Pl. Phd. 108b; οὐ πρὸς [τοῦ] ἅπαντος ἀνδρός not in the power of every man, Hdt. 7.153; οὐκ ἐξ ἅπαντος δεῖ τὸ κερδαίνειν φιλεῖν S. Ant. 312; ἐξἅπαντος εὖ λέγει in any cause whatever, Id. OC 807; σῖγα νῦν ἅπας ἔχε σίγαν Cratin. 144; ἅπαν γένοιτʼ ἂν ἤδη nihil non . ., Ar. Th. 528: with Subst., ἅπαντι λόγῳ in every matter, Cratin. 231; τὸ ἅπαν, as Adv., altogether, Pl. Phdr. 241b; καθʼ ἅπαν as a whole, Ti.Locr. 96d; ἐς ἅπαν Th. 5.103; εἰς ἅπαν at all, Lib. Or. 18.266; πρὸς ἅπαν Ph. 2.493; ἐξ ἅπαντος Luc. Merc.Cond. 41. [ ᾰπᾰν Od. 24.185, etc., Pi. P. 2.49; but ᾰπᾱν Men. 129, Metrod. 57, Theoc. 2.56, and Att. acc. to Hdn.Gr. 2.12; ᾰπᾰν in anap., Ar. Pl. 493: the use of ἅπας for πᾶς is chiefly for the sake of euphony after consonants.]

data.quote: οὐκ ἐξ ἅπαντος δεῖ τὸ κερδαίνειν φιλεῖν

children.definition: turn to soot, become sooty, Dsc. 5.76.
struggle, be convulsed, like a dying fish, ἀ. ὡσπερεὶ πέρκην χαμαί Ar. Fr. 495; ἀπασκαριῶ γέλωτι Men. l.c.; ἀπησκάρισεν gave up the ghost, prob. for ἀπεσκ-, AP 11.114 ( Nicarch.).
take leave of, ἀλλήλους Act.Ap. 21.6, v.l. in LXX To. 10.13; ᾠδῇ καὶ μέλει χορόν Him. Ecl. 11.1.
gasp away, θνῄσκει δʼ ἀπασπαίρουσα E. Ion 1207.

definition: ἀπασσεϊον (sic): παμποίκιλον, οἱ δὲ λινοῦν χιτῶνα, οἱ δὲ μαλλωτόν, Hsch.

children.definition: fasting, Hsch.
abstaining from food, fast, ἀ. ἄγειν Ar. Nu. 621.
not having eaten, abstaining from food, fasting, Il. 19.346, Arist. HA 563a23, Call. Cer. 6, Euph. 57, v.l. in h.Merc. 168.
ἄπαστος ἐδητύος ἠδὲ ποτῆτος without having tasted meat or drink, Od. 4.788, cf. 6.250, h.Cer. 200: ἐδητύος ἔργον ἄπαστον a meal which feeds not, Opp. H. 2.250.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., not eaten, Ael. NA 11.16.
flash forth, Arat. 430, Opp. C. 1.220; αὐγὴ ἀ. λίθων J. AJ 3.8.9: c. acc. cogn., φέγγος Ph. 1.150, al.; αἴγλην Opp. C. 3.479; φάος Procl. H. 7.31, cf. Luc. Gall. 7, Iamb. Myst. 2.3.
lightning, Tz. H. 9.106.
make secure, fasten or shut up, Ps.- Porph. in Bentley Epistola ad Millium p.303 (where ἀποσφαλίσει for ἀπασφαλίσῃ), Sch. E. Or. 1108.

leave one no leisure, keep him employed, Luc. Philops. 14, Hld. 2.21:— Pass., to be wholly occupied or engrossed, so as to attend to nothing else, περί τινα Luc. Charid. 19, cf. Olymp. in Mete. 108.22; τινί ib. 107.13; ἀ. ἐπὶ τῆς ἀλλοδαπῆς to be absent on foreign service, POxy. 71 ii 8 (iv A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: τῆς συνεχείας τῶν φυτῶν ἀπασχολούσης ἐς ἑαυτὴν τὰ βέλη rendering them of none effect, Hdn. 7.2.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀ. τινὰ τῶν ἡδίστων detain him from . ., Hld. 10.23.
one must be engrossed, βιωτικαῖς πράξεσι Aët. 9.23.
detention by business, Str. 6.4.2 (pl.).
noiselessly, Suid.

definition: ἀπατάω [ᾰπ], late Ion. ἀπατ-έω Luc. Syr.D. 27 ( Pass.): impf. ἠπάτων E. El. 938, Ion. ἐξ-απάτασκον Orac. in Ar. Pax 1070: fut. -ήσω: aor. ἠπάτησα, Ion. ἀπ- Il. 9.344, S. Tr. 500 (lyr.): pf. ἠπάτηκα Id. Ph. 929:— Pass., fut. ἀπατηθήσομαι Arist. APr. 67a38, cf. ( ἐξ-) Pl. Cra. 436b, Aeschin. 2.123; also in Med. form ἀπατήσομαι Pl. Phdr. 262a, ( ἐξ-) X. An. 7.3.3: aor. ἠπατήθην Pl. Cri. 52e: pf. ἠπάτημαι Th. 5.46, etc.: ( ἀπάτη):—

children.definition: cheat, deceive, Il. 19.97, Od. 17.139, etc.; cheat oneʼs hopes, Hes. Op. 462; οἷʼ ἠπάτηκας S. Ph. 929; κλέμματα . . ἃ τὸν πολέμιον ἀπατήσας Th. 5.9: abs., to be deceptive or fallacious, Arist. Rh. 1376b28:— Pass., to be self-deceived, mistaken, Pi. Fr. 182, S. OT 594, Pl. Phdr. 262a, etc.; ἔγνωκα . . φωτὸς ἠπατημένη S. Aj. 807; τί γὰρ οὐκ . . ἔρχεται ἀγγελίας ἀπατώμενον; comes not belied by the result? Id. El. 170; ἀ. περί τι Arist. Rh. 1368b22; περί τινος Id. Sens. 442b8; ἀ. ταύτην τὴν ἀπάτην Id. APo. 74a6; also ἀπατᾶσθαι ὡς . . to be deceived into thinking that . ., Pl. Prt. 323a.—The compd. ἐξαπατάω is more common, esp. in Hdt. and Att. Prose; the simple Verb is used in LXX Ge. 3.13, al., but not by Plb., and is rare in later Greek, Plu. Aud.poet. 2.15d.

definition: ἀπάτειρα [πᾰ], fem. of ἀπάτωρ, epith. of Isis, POxy. 1380.19.

children.definition: apart, aloof, ἀ. δὲ θωρήσσοντο Il. 2.587, cf. Thgn. 1059, Pi. O. 7.74.

children.label: II
children.definition: far away from, ἀπάτερθεν ὁμίλου Il. 5.445, cf. Thgn. 1153; γόων ἀ. IG 14.2123.
Xenoph. 11.
cheat, rogue, Hp. Art. 42, Democr. 63, Pl. R. 451a, X. Cyr. 1.6.27, Epicur. Fr. 236, etc.:—as Adj., ἀ. λόγος Max.Tyr. 2.1 [31.1.a].

trick, fraud, deceit, νῦν δὲ κακὴν ἀπάτην βουλεύσατο Il. 2.114, cf. 4.168: in pl., wiles, οὐκ ἄρʼ ἔμελλες . . λήξειν ἀπατάων, says Athena to Ulysses, Od. 13.294, cf. Il. 15.31; σκολιαὶ ἀπάται Pi. Fr. 213.

guile, treachery, ἄταν ἀπάτᾳ μεταγνούς A. Supp. 111, cf. S. OC 230; ἀπάτης δικαίας οὐκ ἀποστατεῖ θεός A. Fr. 301, cf. Pers. 93; ἀ. ἐρώτων S. Ant. 617; διαβολὴ καὶ ἀ. Antipho 6.7, etc.; ἀ. εὐπρεπής, opp. βία ἐμφανής, Th. 4.86; ἢ βίᾳ ἢ ἀπάτῃ 2.39; ἀ. λεχέων a being cheated out of the marriage, S. Ant. 630; ἄνευ δόλου καὶ ἀπάτης ‘without fraud or covin’, Hdt. 1.69; μετὰ σκότους καὶ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 864c.
Ἀπάτη, personified, Hes. Th. 224, Luc. Merc.Cond. 42.

children.label: II
children.definition: beguiling of time, pastime (not Att., Moer. 65), Plb. 4.20.5; ψυχῆς Dicaearch. 1.1; ψυχαγωγίαι καὶ ἀπάται τῆς πόλεως D.Chr. 32.5.
guileful, wily, ἀπατήλια εἰδώς skilled in wiles, Od. 14.288; ἀ. βάζειν ib. 127; of a person, Nonn. D. 46.10, al.
Hsch.

definition: ἀπατηλός, ή, όν ( ος, ον Pl. Criti. 107d),

children.definition: Il. 1.526; κόσμος Parm. 8.52; λόγου στόλος Emp. 17.26; δέσποινα X. Oec. 1.20; κακοῦργος καὶ ἀπατηλή Pl. Grg. 465b; ἀ. λόγος Id. Lg. 892d; τὸ ἀ. ἐν λόγοις Id. Cra. 407e; σκιαγραφία ἀ. producing illusion, Id. Criti. 107d; στρατηγός App. BC 1.112 ( Sup.); also, deceptive, opp. γνήσιος, Eus. Mynd.63. Adv. -λῶς Iamb. Myst. 3.26, Poll. 9.135.
deceit, stratagem, Aen.Tact. 23.6; beguilement, δόξης Gorg. Hel. 10 (pl.); πόθων AP 7.195 ( Mel.).
beguiling men, τέχνη Tryph. 137.

children.label: II
children.definition: Call. Fr. 36P.
beguiling, LXX Ju. 10.4, Phld. Ir. p.9 W. (pl.), Id. D. 1.16.
deceiver, Gloss.
fallacious, of sophistry, Pl. Sph. 240d, 264d, Arist. APo. 80b15, al.: Comp. -κώτερος more effective in deceiving, X. Eq.Mag. 5.5. Adv. -κῶς Poll. 4.24.
untrodden, AP 6.51.

children.label: II
children.definition: not trodden down: hence metaph., unusual, Democr. 131.
= sq., ἀπητιμασμένη A. Eu. 95.
dishonour greatly, ἀπητίμησε Il. 13.113.
evaporate, ἀπατμίζει τὸ ὑγρόν Arist. Mete. 359a31, cf. Somn.Vig. 457b31, PA 653a36.
evaporation, Mich. in EN 55.6.
immune from punishment, Leg.Gort. 2.1, al.

definition: Ἀπατουρεών, ῶνος, ὁ, name of a

children.definition: month, answering to Att. Pyanepsion, CIG 3661 ( Cyzicus), IPE 12.47 ( Olbia):—written -ιών IG 11.203 A32,53 ( Delos, iii B.C.), ib. 12(5).824.33 ( Tenos), SIG 169.1 ( Iasus): Ἀπατοριών IG 12(7).412 ( Amorgos, iii B. C.).
the Apaturia, a festival celebrated by the members of φρατρίαι at Athens and most Ionic cities, Hdt. 1.147, And. 1.126, X. HG 1.7.8, D. 39.4, Thphr. Char. 35, etc.

definition: Ἀπατουρία, ἡ, title of Aphrodite at Troezen, Paus. 2.33.1:—also Ἀπατούρη IPE 2.28 ( Panticapaeum); Ἀπατουριάς ib. 352 ( Phanagoria):—also Ἀπάτουρον (leg. -ούριον) τὸ τῆς Ἀφροδίτης ἱερόν, at Phanagoria, Str. 11.2.10. ( ἀ- copul., πατήρ, cf. ὁμοπάτορες.)

children.definition: exile, CIG 3632 ( Ilium).
without country, Tz. H. 7.436.

definition: ἀπάτυλλα [πᾰ], ἡ, Dim. of ἀπάτη, dub. in Cerc. Oxy. 1082 Fr. 39.

children.definition: without father, of deities, αὐτοπάτωρ, ἀ. Orph. H. 10.10; ἀ. . . ἀμήτωρ Nonn. D. 41.53, cf. Ep.Hebr. 7.3; fatherless, orphan, ἀοίκους ἀπάτοράς τε S. Tr. 300; ἀμήτωρ ἀ. τε E. Ion 109 (lyr.); ἀ. πότμος Id. IT 864 (lyr.), cf. Vett.Val. 103.35: neut. pl., ἀπάτορα τέκεα E. HF 114 (lyr.); disowned by the father, Pl. Lg. 929a: also c. gen., ἀ. ἐμοῦ not having me for a father, S. OC 1383.
of unknown father, like σκότιος, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.288e, PGrenf. 2.56.3 (ii A. D.).

definition: ἀπάτωρος, ον, = foreg., [ Hes.] ap.Sch. Il. Oxy. 1087.50.
ἀπαυαίνω, aor. part. ἀπαυάνας Orph. Fr. 31.20:—

children.definition: make to wither away, Thphr. CP 3.10.7; parch with thirst, Orph. l.c.:— Pass., to be withered, Q.S. 1.66, al.; cf. ἀφ-.
flash forth, ἀπὸ τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν σέλας Hld. 3.4; χροιάν, χρῶμα, Id. 4.8, Philostr. VA 3.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., see from far, Call. Del. 125, 181.
radiance, effulgence, of light beaming from a luminous body, φωτὸς ἀϊδίου LXX Wi. 7.26; δόξης Ep.Hebr. 1.3, cf. Ph. 1.337, al., Hld. 5.27, Dam. ap. Simp. in Ph. 775.15.
efflux of light, radiance, effulgence, Plu. Profect. 2.83d, Fac.lun. 934d.
bright, Hsch.

forbid, abs., ἐγὼ δʼ ἀπαυδῶ γʼ S. Ph. 1293; freq. folld. by μή c. inf., τὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀπηύδα . . στέγης μὴ ἔξω παρήκειν Id. Aj. 741; τὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀπαυδῶ τῆσδε γῆς . . μὴ εἰσδέχεσθαί τινα Id. OT 236, cf. E. Rh. 934, Supp. 468, Ar. Eq. 1072: with implied neg., ἀ. ἐξίστασθαι μύσταισι χοροῖς Id. Ra. 369.

data.quote: τὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀπηύδα . . στέγης μὴ ἔξω παρήκειν
τὸν ἄνδρʼ ἀπαυδῶ τῆσδε γῆς . . μὴ εἰσδέχεσθαί τινα

children.label: II
children.definition: decline, refuse, οὔκουν ἀπαυδᾶν δυνατόν ἐστί μοι πόνους E. Supp. 342; renounce, νεῖκος ἀ. Theoc. 22.129; say no, APl. 16.299.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be wanting towards, fail, φίλοισι E. Andr. 87: hence abs., fail, of wood, Thphr. HP 5.6.1; ἀ. πρὸς τὸ περίπατον Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.21.11; become speechless, of hysterical patients, Hp. Mul. 1.74, cf. Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 18; ἀ. τὰ μαντεῖα the oracles are dumb, Plu. Def.orac. 2.431b; faint, fail, Thphr. Char. 8.14; ἀ. ὑπὸ λιμοῦ Luc. Luct. 24; κόπῳ Babr. 7.8; πόνοις AP 5.167; die (of patients), Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.80.
exhaustion, Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.10.

definition: ἀπαυθαδιάζοντες μεγαλοφρονοῦντες, AB 419, Hsch., Suid.:— Med., -ιάζομαι,

children.definition: = ἀπαυθαδίζομαι, Phlp. in Mete. 7.35; reject boldly, Hld. 7.19.
speak or act boldly, Pl. Ap. 37a; freq. in late Prose, in bad sense, Ph. 2.441; μέχρι παντός J. BJ 3.7.11, cf. Plu. Amat. 2.766c, Them. Or. 10.131d,135a, 23.290c.
do on the same day; esp. go or return the same day, εἰς τὸ στρατόπεδον X. An. 5.2.1; ἐκ Πίσης εἰς Αἴγιναν Ael. VH 9.2.

definition: ἀπαυλεῖσθαι τὸ μὴ προαυλεῖν κατὰ τρόπον, Hsch.

children.definition: sleeping alone, esp. the night before the wedding, when the bridegroom slept alone in the father-in-lawʼs house, Poll. 3.39; cf. ἐπαύλια:— EM 119.14 is confused.
sleep or live away from, τῆς πόλεως D.H. 8.87; ἀπὸ τῆς νύμφης Poll. 3.39.
a moon-stroke or fit caused by sleeping in the moonlight, Poet. de herb. 173.
belonging to the ἀπαύλια, ἀ. χλανίς a garment presented on this day, Poll. 3.40.
lying alone, Hsch.
away from the αὐλή, AP 6.221 ( Leon.).
in ‘irrational’ proportion to the χρόνοι πρῶτοι, Gal. 8.913.
decrease: hence, disesteem, πίπτειν εἰς ἀ. Longin. 7.3.
derive nourishment, ἀπὸ τῆς ἰκμάδος Hp. Nat.Puer. 26.
unceasing, incessant, D.C. 37.46.
unceasing, never-ending, Parm. 8.27; αἰών A. Supp. 574 (lyr.); βίος Pl. Ti. 36e; ἄτα S. Aj. 1187 (lyr.); ἄ. καὶ ἀθάνατος φορά Pl. Cra. 417c, etc. Adv. -τως Arist. Mu. 391b18, Corn. ND 34.
not to be stopped or assuaged, insatiable, δίψα Th. 2.49; γνάθοι Antiph. 237.4; ἐπιθυμίη χρημάτων Eus.Mynd. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: never ceasing from, γόων E. Supp. 82 (lyr.).—Cf. ἄπαυτος.
on the spot, dub. l. in D.C. 40.15
do a thing of oneself, Plu. QConv. 2.717b; produce spontaneously, Ph. 1.36:— Pass., Id. 2.182:— Act., intr., occur spontaneously, Id. 1.571; -ίζουσα φορά ib. 387; of the menses, Orib. 7.20.1.
go of oneʼs own accord, desert, Th. 7.75; πρός τινα D.H. Orat.Vett. 2; τινός D.C. 36.17.
unceasing, Thphr. Metaph. 5; cf. ἄπαυστος.
cut off by the neck, D.S. 34.2.22.

children.label: II
children.definition: ταῦρον ἀ. tame a bull by forcing back his neck, Philostr. Her. 12b, cf. Philostr.Jun. Im. 2.

children.label: III
children.definition: shake off the yoke from the neck, get free by struggling, Phld. Lib. p.34 O., Ph. 1.305.
stone kneading-trough ( Lacon.), Hsch.

cheat, beguile, mostly in compos. with παρά and ἐξ:— of the simple word Hom. has only ἀπαφίσκει Od. 11.217: aor. opt. ἀπάφοιτο in act. sense, 23.216:—later, ἀπάφῃ APl. 16.108 ( Jul.); ἀπαφών Opp. H. 3.444; ἤπαφες, ἤπαφε, Q.S. 3.49, Nonn. D. 5.512: aor. 1 ἀπάφησε ib. 8.129, Q.S. 13.280, 2 sg. ἀπάφησας 3.502.
skim, esp. of honey, Gp. 8.29 and 32, Orib. 5.33.4:— Pass., Gal. 6.283, Gp. 8.27.2, Philagr. ap. Orib. 5.21.1.
thinness, Eust. 641.33.
without thickness or solidity, Eust. 641.35.
have blurred vision, Aret. SD 2.3.
free from darkness, Q.S. 1.79.

definition: ἄπαχος, ον, paraphrase of νεαρός, f.l. in Procl. Par.Ptol. 43.

children.definition: winnow, Sch. Nic. Th. 114.
give up, deliver again, Hsch.

definition: ἀπεγνωσμένως, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of ἀπογιγνώσκω,

children.definition: desperately, Plu. Nic. 21.
Hsch. s.h.v.
level, ἠπέδιζον τὴν ἀκρόπολιν Clid. 22.
unshod, A. Pr. 135, Nonn. D. 5.407, al.:—also ἀπεδίλωτος, ον, Call. Cer. 124.
level, flat, χώρη Hdt. 1.110, cf. 9.25, 102, Th. 7.78, X. Cyn. 6.9:— Subst. ἄπεδον, τό, flat surface, Hdt. 4.62.
footless, Lyc. 629.

disaccustom, τιμωρίαις ἀ. τινά Aeschin. 1.58: c. inf., ἀ. μὴ ποιεῖν accustom or teach not to do something, ib. 152; τινός τινα Philostr. VS 1.25; τινὸς τὸ σῶμα Epicur. Fr. 458, cf. Gal. 16.141: pf. part. ἀπειθικώς Plu. Alex. 40:— Pass., ἀτειθισμένος J. BJ 5.13.4.
one must disuse, unteach, Gp. 14.7.5.

definition: ἀπεῖδον, inf. ἀπῐδεῖν, aor. 2 with no pres. in use, ἀφοράω being used instead:—

children.definition: look away from other things at, and so simply, look at, πρός or ἔς τι Th. 7.71, Luc. DMar. 9.2, al.; πόρρωθεν ἀπιδεῖν Timocl. 21.

children.label: II
children.definition: look away from, and so, despise, Plu. Comm.not. 2.1070f (dub.l.). (In later Greek ἀφ-, ἀφίδω Ep.Phil. 2.23.)
construct according to a pattern, Inscr.Milet. (Haussoullier p.163), in form ἀπειδοποιήθη; but more prob. from ἀπεδοποιέω, make flat, smooth, κατεξέσθη τὸ ὑπέρθυρον καὶ ἀ.
disobedience to command, Antipho Soph. 72, D.C. Fr. 57.17.
disobedience, X. Mem. 3.5.5, D.H. 9.41, Arr. Epict. 3.24.24; υἱοὶ τῆς ἀπειθείας Ep.Eph. 5.7; later ἀπειθία, ἡ, BGU 747ii14 (ii A.D.), etc., Gloss.

definition: ἀπειθέω, Att. form of ἀπῐθέω (though even Trag. preferred ἀπιστέω, q.v. II),

children.definition: to be disobedient, refuse compliance, A. Ag. 1049; opp. πείθομαι, Pl. Phdr. 271b: freq. c. dat., disobey, οὐκ ἀπειθήσας θεῷ E. Or. 31; ἀ. ἅμα νόμῳ καὶ τῷ θεῷ Pl. Lg. 741d, etc.; τὰ μεγάλα ἀ. τινί in great matters, Id. R. 538b; ἀ. ταῖς ἐνεχυρασίαις not to abide by them, Id. Lg. 949d: later c. gen., ψαφίσματος GDI 3705.111 ( Cos); ἐντολῶν LXX Jo. 5.6.

data.quote: ἀ. ἅμα νόμῳ καὶ τῷ θεῷ

children.definition: X. Cyr. 7.5.62; of ships, τοῖς οἴαξιν ἀ. D.S. 13.46.
refuse compliance, Aristaenet. 2.20.

definition: ἀπείθη, ἀπείθησαν, Ion. aor. 1 Pass. of ἀφίημι.

children.definition: disobedient, BGU 747i6 (ii A.D.).

disobedient, S. Fr. 45; ἀ. τοῖς νόμοις Pl. Lg. 936b; of ships, τοῖς κυβερνήταις ἀπειθεστέρας τὰς ναῦς παρεῖχον less obedient to them, Th. 2.84, cf. D.C. 50.29 ( Comp.), Orph. A. 247; στράτευμα X. Eq. 3.6; of horses, Id. Eq.Mag. 1.3; ἀπειθέα τεύχειν work disobedience, Call. Dian. 66. Adv. ἀπειθῶς, ἔχειν πρός τινα Pl. R. 391b.

children.label: b
children.definition: unbelieving, Nonn. D. 8.306.

inflexible, rigid, κέντρον Ael. NA 1.55; σιδήρου καὶ ἀδάμαντος ἀπειθέστεροι Ph. 2.87; ὀδόντες ἀ. unyielding, Opp. C. 2.511; χῶρος ἀ. impracticable, of Hades, Hermesian. 7.3; δίκη ἀ. Νεμέσεως IG 4.444.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not persuasive, incredible, μῦθος Thgn. 1235; uninviting, πρὸς τὴν γεῦσιν Hices. ap. Ath. 3.87b, c; τὴν γεῦσιν Id. 323a; of places, difficult of access, Ael. Fr. 120.

definition: ἀπεικάζω, fut. -άσομαι X. Mem. 3.11.1, -άσω Plu. Mus. 2.1135a:— Pass., aor. ἀπεικάσθην E. El. 979, Pl. Cra. 419d: fut. -ασθήσομαι Them. Or. 2.33a: pf. ἀπείκασμαι Pl. Cra. 420d (on the augment v. εἰκάζω):—

children.definition: form from a model, represent, express, copy, of painters, ἀ. τὰ καλὰ τῶν ζῴων Isoc. 1.11; τὸ σὸν χρῶμα καὶ σχῆμα Pl. Cra. 432b, cf. Criti. 107d, 107e; διὰ χρωμάτων ἀ. X. Mem. 3.10.1; χρώμασι καὶ σχήμασιν Arist. Po. 1447a19: metaph., ἀ. ἑαυτόν τινι conform oneself to . ., Pl. R. 396d:— Pass., become like, resemble, τινί ib. 563a, Cra. 419c; ἀπεικασθεὶς θεῷ in a godʼs likeness, E. El. 979.

express by a comparison, ἔχοιμʼ ἂν αὐτὸ μὴ κακῶς ἀπεικάσαι S. Fr. 149.2, cf. Pl. Tht. 169b; οἷος γὰρ Ἀχιλλεὺς ἐγένετο ἀπεικάσειεν ἄν τις Βρασίδαν Id. Smp. 221c; τὸ θάλλειν τὴν αὔξην μοι δοκεῖ ἀπεικάζειν τὴν τῶν νέων the word θάλλειν seems to express the growth . ., Id. Cra. 414a; ἀ. διὰ τοῦ ῥῶ to express by the sound of ῥ, ib. 426e:— Pass., to be copied or expressed by likeness τοῖς ὑπὸ τῶν κάτω ἀπεικασθεῖσι Id. R. 511a; τὰ ἄλλα ἀπείργαστο εἰς ὁμοιότητα ᾧπερ (sc. τούτου ᾧ ἀπεικάζετο Id. Ti. 39e; ἀ. πρός τι to be copied in reference to . ., i. e. from . ., ib. 29c.

data.quote: ἔχοιμʼ ἂν αὐτὸ μὴ κακῶς ἀπεικάσαι
οἷος γὰρ Ἀχιλλεὺς ἐγένετο ἀπεικάσειεν ἄν τις Βρασίδαν

children.definition: liken, compare with, τινί τι E. Supp. 146, Pl. Phd. 76e, Grg. 493b, Smp. 221d, al.; οὐ τοιοῦτόν ἐστιν ᾧ σὺ ἀπεικάζεις not such [as that] to which you compare it, Id. Phd. 92b:— Pass., to be likened or compared, ἄρχουσιν Id. Lg. 905e, al.; [ τὸ ἀναγκαῖον] ἀπείκασται τῇ πορείᾳ Id. Cra. 420d; [ τὸ ψεῦδος] ἀπείκασται τοῖς καθεύδουσι ib. 421b.

children.label: II
children.definition: ὡς ἀπεικάσαι, = ὡς ἐπεικάσαι, as one may guess, to conjecture, S. OC 16, Tr. 141, E. Or. 1298.

children.label: III
children.definition: imagine, ἀ. χειρώσεσθαι ( -ασθαι codd.) τὴν Σπάρτην D.S. 15.65.
representation, μίμησις καὶ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 668b, Criti. 107b, Hierocl. in CA 27p.484M.
copy, representation, Pl. Cra. 402d, 420c.
representation, Porph. Abst. 4.7.
one must represent as like, τινά τινι Pl. Phdr. 270e; ἀπειλητικὰ τὰ ὄμματα ἀ. X. Mem. 3.10.8; one must compare, τί τινι Plot. 5.6.4, cf. Men. Rh. p.349 S.
represent in a statue, AP 12.56 ( Mel.); express, ψυχῇ κάλλος ib. 127 ( Mel.); generally, represent, Porph. Sent. 44:— Pass., to be modelled, Ph. 1.106, al.; to be described, 1.561.
Med., reflect, symbolize, τὴν [τῶν ἀπορρήτων] δύναμιν Procl. in Alc. p.25 C., cf. Inst. 209, Aristaenet. 2.5.
Socr. Ep. 20, Ph. 1.4, al., BMus.Inscr. 481*.24 ( Ephesus, ii A.D.), Phlp. in Ph. 316.24.

keep away, ἀπὸ τῶ βωμῶ GDI 1159, cf. 1150; ἀπὸ μαντείας 1154:— Pass., ἐς ἀπορίην ἀπειληθείς or ἀπειλημένος brought into great straits, Hdt. 1.24, 2.141; ἐς ἀναγκαίην ἀπειλημένος Id. 8.109; ἀπειληθέντες ἐς στεινόν forced into narrow compass, Id. 9.34.

children.label: II
children.definition: unroll, roll off, Hero Aut. 5.5.

definition: ἀπειλέω (B), 3 dual impf. Act. ἀπειλήτην, Ep. for ἠπειλείτην, Od. 11.313: later Ep. pres. ἀπειλείω Musae. 122, Nonn. D. 20.204:—

children.definition: hold out either in the way of promise or threat, and therefore:

children.label: I
children.definition: promise, οὐδʼ ἠπείλησεν ἄνακτι . . ῥέξειν κλειτὴν ἑκατόμβην Il. 23.863, cf. 872; also, boast or brag, ὥς ποτʼ ἀπειλήσει 8.150; ἦ μὲν ἀπείλησας βητάρμονας εἶναι ἀρίστους Od. 8.383, cf. Jul. Or. 2.57a.

data.quote: οὐδʼ ἠπείλησεν ἄνακτι . . ῥέξειν κλειτὴν ἑκατόμβην
ἦ μὲν ἀπείλησας βητάρμονας εἶναι ἀρίστους

children.label: II
children.definition: threaten, in Hom. either abs., as Il. 2.665, Od. 21.368: or (more freq.) c. dat. pers., ib. 20.272, etc.: c.acc. cogn., αἶψα δʼ ἀναστὰς ἠπείλησεν μῦθον spake a threatening speech, Il. 1.388; ἀπειλὰς ἀ., v. ἀπειλή; δείνʼ ἀπειλήσων ἔπη E. Supp. 542: freq. with neut. Pron. or Adj., ἀ. τόγε θυμῷ Il. 15.212; ταῦτα, πολλὰ ἀ., Hdt. 7.18, 1.111, Th. 8.33, etc.; πύργοις ἀ. δεινά A. Th. 426; τοῦτʼ ἀπειλήσας ἔχεις S. OC 817.
θάνατον ἀ. ὃς ἂν . . Hdt. 4.81; ξίφος Plu. Pomp. 47; ζημίας ἀ. κατά τινος Id. Cam. 39; ἠπείλησαν τοὺς ἄρχοντας threatened them with the prefects, Lib. Or. 47.7.

fut. inf., γέρας . . ἀφαιρήσεσθαι ἀπειλεῖς Il. 1.161, cf. 15.179, Od. 11.313; σφέας . . ἀπείλεε ἐκτρίψειν Hdt. 6.37; ἀ. δράσειν τι E. Med. 287; ἀ. ἀποκτενεῖν Lys. 3.28: rarely in pres. inf., ἠπ. . . ἑλκέμεν Il. 9.682: after Hom. in aor. inf., X. Mem. 3.5.4, HG 5.4.7, Theoc. 24.16.
ἀ. ὅτι . ., ὡς . ., Ar. Pl. 88, X. An. 5.5.22, etc.; ἀ. τινί, εἰ μή . . Id. Cyr. 4.5.12.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., ἀπειλοῦμαι, of persons, to be terrified by threats, Id. Smp. 4.31.
τὰ ἀπειληθέντα, = ἀπειλαί, Pl. Lg. 823c.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Med., with aor. 1 -ησάμην App. BC 3.29, Polyaen. 7.35.2: c. inf., forbid with threats, ἀπειλησώμεθα αὐτοῖς μηκέτι λαλεῖν Act.Ap. 4.17.
boastful promises, boasts, ποῦ τοι ἀπειλαὶ ἃς . . ὑπίσχεο οἰνοποτάζων; Il. 20.83; μέχρι τῶν ἀπειλῶν γενναῖος Lib. Or. 59.118, cf. Eust. 704.28.

data.quote: ποῦ τοι ἀπειλαὶ ἃς . . ὑπίσχεο οἰνοποτάζων;

children.label: II
children.definition: threats, ποῦ τοι ἀπειλαὶ οἴχονται τὰς Τρωσὶν ἀπείλεον υἷες Ἀχαιῶν; Il. 13.219; οὐδὲ . . λήθετʼ ἀπειλάων τὰς ἀντιθέῳ Ὀδυσῆι πρῶτον ἐπηπείλησεν Od. 13.126, cf. Il. 16.200, Hdt. 6.32; εὐθύνειν ἀπειλαῖς καὶ πληγαῖς Pl. Prt. 325d, cf. A. Pr. 175 (lyr.): in sg., S. Ant. 753, Th. 4.126; ἀπειλῆς ἕνεκα τοῖς ἐν τῷ Ταρτάρῳ Arist. APo. 94b33.

data.quote: ποῦ τοι ἀπειλαὶ οἴχονται τὰς Τρωσὶν ἀπείλεον υἷες Ἀχαιῶν;
οὐδὲ . . λήθετʼ ἀπειλάων τὰς ἀντιθέῳ Ὀδυσῆι πρῶτον ἐπηπείλησεν
ἀπειλῆς ἕνεκα τοῖς ἐν τῷ Ταρτάρῳ

children.definition: ἀ. πνιγμοῦ Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.60; τὰ ἐν ἀπειλῇ ἀποστήματα Heras ap. Gal. 13.815; of storms, J. BJ 1.21.5, Ael. NA 7.7.
threat, Phld. Herc. 1251.8.
threatener, boaster, Il. 7.96, Call. Del. 69, AP 6.95 ( Antiph.): as Adj., Nonn. D. 4.378, al.:—fem. ἀπειλ-ήτειρα, ib. 2.257.
of or for threatening, λόγοι Hdt. 8.112.
Pl. Phdr. 268c; νόμιμα Id. Lg. 823c; ὄμματα X. Mem. 3.10.8. Adv. -κῶς Phryn. PS p.61 B.

definition: ἄπειμι (A), ( εἰμί sum), impf. ἀπῆν (later ἀπήμην POxy. 1204.23 (iii A.D.)), 2 sg. ἀπῆσθα S. Ph. 379; Ep. ἀπέην Il. 20.7, 3 pl. ἄπεσαν ib. 10.357: fut. ἀπέσομαι Ar. Nu. 887; Ep. ἀπέσσομαι Od. 8.150, 3 sg. ἀπεσσεῖται ib. 19.302:—

children.definition: to be away or far from, c. gen., ὁππότε πάτρης ἧς ἀπέῃσιν ἀνήρ ib. 169, cf. 20.155, al.; ἐὰν δʼ ἀπῇ τούτων τὸ χαίρειν S. Ant. 1169; ἀ. ἀπὸ τῶν ἰδίων Th. 1.141: c. dat., φίλοισιν E. Med. 179 (lyr.), cf. Tr. 393, Hdt. 4.1, Th. 2.61, etc.: but mostly,

data.quote: ἐὰν δʼ ἀπῇ τούτων τὸ χαίρειν

children.definition: to be away or absent, and of things, to be wanting, οἵ τʼ ὄντες οἵ τʼ ἀπόντες, i.e. all that are, every one, S. Ant. 1109; τὰς οὔσας τέ μου καὶ τὰς ἀπούσας ἐλπίδας Id. El. 306; of the dead, v.l. in E. Hec. 312; τοῦ θεοῦ ἀπεόντος the god not being counted, Hdt. 6.53:—in 3 pl. impf., ἀπῆσαν and ἀπῇσαν are freq. confused in codd., as in Th. 4.42.

data.quote: τὰς οὔσας τέ μου καὶ τὰς ἀπούσας ἐλπίδας

definition: ἄπειμι (B), ( εἶμι ibo), serving as fut. of ἀπέρχομαι: inf. ἀπιέναι, in AP 11.404 ( Lucill.) ἀπίναι:—

children.definition: go away, depart, Od. 17.593, al.; οὐκ ἄπει; = ἄπιθι, begone, S. OT 431; ἀπιὼν οἴχεσθαι D. 18.65, Isoc. 17.43; οἱ πρέσβεις περὶ τῶν σπονδῶν ἀπῇσαν Th. 4.39; of soldiers, ἀπίασι οὐδενὶ κόσμῳ will retreat, Hdt. 8.60.γʹ; ἀ. πρὸς βασιλέα desert to him, X. An. 1.9.29; ἀ. πάλιν return, ib. 1.4.7, cf. 15; ἄπιτε ἐπὶ τὰ ὑμέτερα αὐτῶν return to your homes, Hdt. 6.97; ἄπιμεν οἴκαδε Ar. V. 255; ἀπῇσαν ἐπʼ οἴκου Th. 5.36; εἰς τὴν πατρίδα Arr. Epict. 2.23.36; of the Nile, recede. Hdt. 2.108; ἀ. ἐπί τι go in quest of . ., X. Cyr. 7.5.80; μηνὸς ἀπιόντος, for the common φθίνοντος, Decr. ap. D. 18.37, CIG 3658 ( Cyzicus); die, Luc. Tim. 15, Philostr. Im. 2.9.

data.quote: οἱ πρέσβεις περὶ τῶν σπονδῶν ἀπῇσαν

children.definition: πολλὴν καὶ τραχεῖαν ἀπιέναι (sc. ὁδόν) Pl. Phdr. 272c.
to be discharged, Hp. Mul. 8, al.

definition: ἀπεῖπον, inf. ἀπειπεῖν, Ep. ἀπŏειπεῖν, ἀπŏειπέμεν, and part. ἀπōειπών, i.e. ἀποϝειπών, Il. 19.35, etc.: less freq. aor. 1 ἀπεῖπα Hdt. 3.153, S. Ant. 405: fut. in use is ἀπερῶ, pf. ἀπείρηκα, mostly in signf. IV. 3:— Med., aor. 1 ἀπειπάμην Hdt. 1.59, 5.56, Arist. EN 1163b19, but never in correct Att.:— Pass., fut. ἀπορρηθήσομαι Lys. 22.14: aor. ἀπερρήθην Pl. Lg. 929a, D. 33.21:— pres. and impf. are supplied by ἀπαυδάω, ἀπόφημι, and in Att. Prose by ἀπαγορεύω:—

children.definition: speak out, tell out, declare, μῦθον Il. 9.309, cf. 431; ἀγγελίην 7.416; ἀληθείην 23.361; ἐφημοσύνην Od. 16.340; μνηστήρεσσιν ἀπειπέμεν (prob. μνηστῆρσʼ ἀποειπέμεν) to give them full notice, ib. 1.91; ἀπηλεγέως ἀποειπεῖν Il. 9.309, cf. Od. 1.373; ῥῆσιν ἀπερέοντα to deliver a verbal message, Hdt. 1.152: in aor. Med., ἀπείπασθαι θανάτῳ ζημιοῦν τοὺς πλευσομένους Arist. Mir. 837a2.

children.label: II
children.definition: deny, refuse, ὑπόσχεο καὶ κατάνευσον, ἢ ἀπόειπʼ Il. 1.515, cf. 9.510, 675; σύμφαθι ἢ ἄπειπε Pl. R. 523a: c. acc., βοήθειαν Plu. Tim. 2.

children.label: III
children.definition: forbid (cf. ἀπαγορεύω I), freq. in Prose, ἀ. τινι μὴ ποιεῖν forbid one to do, tell him not to do, Hdt. 1.155, S. OC 1760, Ar. Av. 556; also without μή, Plb. 2.52.8: with inf. omitted, ἀπειπὼν εἴργει μελάθρων A. Ag. 1333, cf. S. Ant. 405; ἀ. τινί τι forbid him the use of it, Arist. Pol. 1264a21:— Pass., ἀπειρῆσθαι γάρ οἱ . . μηδενὶ ἐπιδεικνύναι Hdt. 6.61; τὸ ἀπειρημένον a forbidden thing, Id. 3.52, Antipho 3.2.7; ἀπείρηται δὲ τοῦτο τῷ νόμῳ Xenarch. 7.7; ἀπειρημένον, abs., contrary to orders, Arist. Rh. 1373b10.

children.label: IV
children.definition: renounce, disown, give up, c. acc. rei, ἀ. μῆνιν Il. 19.35; and not seldom in Prose, as εἴτε . . ἀπερέουσι . . τὴν συμμαχίην Hdt. 7.205; ἀπειπεῖν . . κηρύκων ὕπο . . πατρῴαν ἑστίαν renounce it by public proclamation, E. Alc. 737; τὸν υἱὸν ὑπὸ κήρυκος ἀ. Pl. Lg. 928d; πόνους E. HF 1354; προξενίαν Th. 5.43, 6.89; ὁμιλίαν Lys. 8.6; ταῦτα μὲν οὖν ἀπείποι τις ἄν D. 21.113; ἀ. τὴν στρατηγίαν to resign it, X. An. 7.1.41; τὴν ἀρχήν Arist. Pol. 1272b5; ἐλπίδας Plb. 14.9.6; ἀ. γυναῖκα divorce her, Plu. Luc. 38:—in Pass., αἱ σπονδαὶ οὐκ ἀπείρηντο had not been renounced, remained in force, Th. 5.48; τὰς σπονδὰς μέλλειν ἀπορρηθήσεσθαι Lys. 22.14:—in Med., ἀπείπασθαι παῖδα Hdt. 1.59; συμμαχίην 4.120, 125; φιλίαν Plb. 33.10.5; ἀ. ὄψιν averruncare, Hdt. 5.56; ἀ. υἱόν, πατέρα, Arist. EN 1163b19; ἀποϝειπάθθω (Cret. for ἀπειπάσθω) let him renounce the inheritance, Leg.Gort. 11.11; ἀ. γνώμας withdraw, retract them, Plu. Caes. 8.

data.quote: ταῦτα μὲν οὖν ἀπείποι τις ἄν

children.definition: refuse, c. inf., Nonn. D. 4.30.

fail, tire, sink from exhaustion, ἐπεὶ δʼ ἀπεῖπε S. Tr. 789, cf. Ar. Pax 306, Pl. Phdr. 228b, etc.; ἀπειρηκὸς σῶμα Antipho 5.93; γῆ ἀπειρηκυῖα Thphr. CP 3.20.3; οὐ γάρ που ἀπεροῦμέν γέ πω shall not give in yet, Pl. Tht. 200d; ἕως ἂν ἀπείπωσιν D. 54.25, cf. 27; οἱ διὰ τὸν χρόνον ἀπειρηκότες Arist. Pol. 1329a33; οὐδʼ ἀπεῖπεν . . φάτις was not unfulfilled, A. Th. 840.

children.label: b
children.definition: fail or be wanting to one, οὐκ ἀ. φίλοις E. Med. 459.

children.label: c
children.definition: fail or fall short in a thing, ἀπειρηκότων δὲ χρήμασι now that they are bankrupt, D. 3.8; ἀ. σώμασι Isoc. 4.92, Lycurg. 40; but,

children.label: d
children.definition: ἀ. κακοῖς, ἄλγει, give way to, sink under them, E. Or. 91, Hec. 942; ἀ. ὑπὸ πλήθους κακῶν X. HG 6.3.15.

children.label: e
children.definition: ἀ. πρὸς τὸν φόνον to be tired of butchery, Plu. Cam. 18; ἀ. ἐν τοῖς δράμασι Antiph. 191, 14.

children.label: f
children.definition: pres. part., ἀ. ταλαιπωρούμεναι Ar. Lys. 778; φέροντες ἀπεροῦσιν they will be tired of paying, Th. 1.121; ἀ. λέγων give over speaking, Pl. Lg. 769e; ἀπειρήκη τὰ ὄντα σκοπῶν I had failed to . ., Id. Phd. 99d, etc.
act without right knowledge, Paul.Aeg. 6.50.
ignorance of goodness, folly, Hierocl. p.54 A.
unacquainted with goodness, foolish, LXX Es. 8.13. Adv. -θως D.S. 15.40.

Apeiraean, and Ἀπείρηθεν, Adv. from Apeire, both in Od. 7.8, 9 γρῆϋς Ἀπειραίη . ., τήν ποτʼ Ἀπείρηθεν νέες ἤγαγον. Apeire seems to be Limitless-land (from ἄπειρος B), an imaginary place; Hsch. expl. by ἠπειρωτική.

times without number, Arist. Ph. 193a28, Xen. 975a26, Plu. Def.orac. 2.426e; πολλάκις, μᾶλλον δʼ ἀ. Arist. Pol. 1329b27; οὐχ ἅπαξ οὐδὲ δὶς ἀλλʼ ἀ. Id. Cael. 270b19, cf. Phld. D. 3 Fr. 35; ἀπειράκις ἄπειρος Ph. 1.499, Dam. Pr. 21.

data.quote: οὐχ ἅπαξ οὐδὲ δὶς ἀλλʼ ἀ.

children.definition: that has not known man, Hsch. s.v. μνηστή.
incapable of being tempted, κακῶν Ep.Jac. 1.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: without experience, τῶν ἀβουλήτων Alciphr. 3.37.

children.label: III
children.definition: not experienced, Gal. 13.459; untried, τέχνη Phld. Rh. 1.45 S.

definition: ἀπείρατος, ον, Dor. and Att. for ἀπείρητος.

children.definition: impenetrable, Pi. O. 6.54.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄπειρος (B), v.l. in Hp. Flat. 3, dub. in Dam. Pr. 107.
in an infinite number of ways, Plu. QConv. 2.732f, Procl. in Prm. p.581 S.

definition: ἀπείργαθον, Ep. ἀποέργαθον (also ἀπεργ- Hsch.), poet. aor. 2 of ἀπείργω:—

children.definition: keep away, Πηλείωνα δόλῳ ἀποέργαθε λαοῦ Il. 21.599; ῥάκεα μεγάλης ἀποέργαθε οὐλῆς he pushed back the rags from the scar, Od, 21.221; ἢν μή μʼ ὁ κραίνων τῆσδε γῆς ἀπειργάθῃ S. OC 862.

data.quote: ἢν μή μʼ ὁ κραίνων τῆσδε γῆς ἀπειργάθῃ

definition: ἀπείργω, Ion. and Ep. ἀπέργω, in Hom. also ἀποέργω (i.e. ἀποϝέργω), also ἀπεέργει Hsch.: fut. ἀπείρξω: aor. ἀπείργαθον (q.v.); aor. also ἀπεῖρξα S. Aj. 1280, Th. 4.37, etc.:— Pass., pf. inf. ἀπεῖρχθαι Phld. Mus. p.19 K.:—

children.definition: keep away from, debar from, c. gen., ὁ δὲ Τρῶας . . αἰθούσης ἀπέεργεν Il. 24.238; σφέας θυσιέων ἀπέρξαι Hdt. 2.124; ἀ. πόλεως ζυγόν A. Th. 471; ἐγώ σφʼ ἀπείργω . . χαρᾶς S. Aj. 51 (dub. sens.); οὐκ ἔστιν ὅτε ἀπείργομέν τινα . . μαθήματος ἢ θεάματος Th. 2.39, cf. 3.45; νόμων ἡμᾶς ἀπείργεις; do you exclude us from their benefit? Ar. V. 467; δείπνου ἀ. τινά Cratin. 57; ἀ. τινὰ ἀπό τινος Hdt. 9.68:— Med. like Act., ἱκέτην ἀπείργεται A. Ch. 569; but also, keep oneʼs hands off, keep away from, ξένου Pl. Lg. 879d.

data.quote: οὐκ ἔστιν ὅτε ἀπείργομέν τινα . . μαθήματος ἢ θεάματος

children.definition: keep from doing, prevent ( ἀπείργω τὸν βουλόμενον ἐνεργεῖν τι, ἀνείργω τὸν ἀρξάμενον AB 1331), c. acc. et inf., αὐγὰς ἀπείρξω σὴν πρόσοψιν εἰσιδεῖν S. Aj. 70, cf. E. Rh. 432, Antiph. 126; μὴ ποιεῖν E. Hel. 1559; ἀ. τι μὴ γίγνεσθαι Pl. Lg. 837d:— Pass., to be debarred from doing, ἅπτεσθαί τινος Id. Prm. 148e.

data.quote: ἀπείργω τὸν βουλόμενον ἐνεργεῖν τι, ἀνείργω τὸν ἀρξάμενον

children.definition: keep back, keep off, ward off, μικρὸς δὲ λίθος μέγα κῦμʼ ἀποέργει Od. 3.296; ἀπὸ πάμπαν εἴργοντες (sc. τοὺς πολεμίους) Pi. O. 13.59; τίς ταῦτʼ ἀπεῖρξεν; S. Aj. 1280; νόσους ἀ. E. Ion 1013: abs., ἀλλʼ ἀπείργοι θεός God forfend! S. Aj. 949; ὅπου μή . . καῦμα ἀπείργει Pl. Ti. 22e, etc.

data.quote: μικρὸς δὲ λίθος μέγα κῦμʼ ἀποέργει

children.label: b
children.definition: νόμος οὐδεὶς ἀπεῖργε checked them, Th. 2.53, cf. Democr. 259; τὴν βίαιον τροφὴν ἀ. prohibit it, Arist. Pol. 1338b41:— Pass., φυγῇ ἀπειργόμενος X. HG 1.4.15.

children.label: c
children.definition: τὸ ἀπεργμένον the old bed of the Nile laid dry by barring or damming off the river, Hdt. 2.99; ὁ ἀγκὼν . . ὡς ἀπεργμένος ῥέῃ dammed off, ibid.

children.label: II
children.definition: part, divide, separate, ὅθι κληῒς ἀποέργει αὐχένα τε στῆθός τε Il. 8.325:—and so, bound, skirt, of seas and rivers, etc., ὁ Ἅλυς ἔνθεν μὲν Καππαδόκας ἀπέργει, ἐξ εὐωνύμου δὲ Παφλαγόνας Hdt. 1.72; πρὸς βορῆν ἄνεμον ὁ Κεραμεικὸς κόλπος ἀπέργει ib. 174, cf. 204, 2.99, 4.55.

data.quote: ὅθι κληῒς ἀποέργει αὐχένα τε στῆθός τε
ὁ Ἅλυς ἔνθεν μὲν Καππαδόκας ἀπέργει, ἐξ εὐωνύμου δὲ Παφλαγόνας

children.definition: ἐπορεύετο ἐν ἀριστερῇ μὲν ἀπέργων Ποίτειον πόλιν κτλ. keeping Rhoeteium on the left . ., Id. 7.43; ἐκ δεξιῆς χειρὸς τὸ Πάγγαιον ὄρος ἀ. ib. 112, cf. 109, 8.35.

children.label: III
children.definition: shut up, confine, αἱ ἐσχατιαὶ τὴν ἄλλην χώρην ἐντὸς ἀ. Id. 3.116; ἀπεργμένον ἐν τῇ ἀκροπόλει Id. 1.154, cf. 5.64; ἐν τῷ ἱρῷ Id. 6.79.

data.quote: αἱ ἐσχατιαὶ τὴν ἄλλην χώρην ἐντὸς ἀ.

children.definition: boundless, immense, γαῖα, ὀϊζύς, Il. 20.58, Od. 11.621; δῆρις Batr. 4; countless, ἄνθρωποι πολλοί, ἀπειρέσιοι Od. 19.174, cf. Hes. Fr. 134.4, Theoc. 25.100; ὄρνιθες Simon. 40; ἀ. εἶδος untold beauty, Hes. Fr. 33; once in Trag., ἀ. πόνοι S. Aj. 928 (lyr.): neut. as Adv., Q.S. 2.179, 3.386. (Like ἀπερείσιος, by metrical lengthening for *ἀπερέσιος; root per- in πεῖραρ, ἄπειρος B.)

definition: ἀπείρητος, Dor. and Att. ἀπείρᾱτος, ον, also η, ον h.Ven. 133;

children.definition: without trial, and so:

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., without making trial of, without making an attempt upon, c. gen., ἀπείρητος . . σταθμοῖο, of a lion, Il. 12.304: abs., making no attempt or venture, Pi. I. 4(3).30.

without trial or experience of, unknowing of, φιλότητος h.Ven. l.c., cf. J. BJ 3.4.1, Plu. QConv. 2.681c, etc.; στρατὸν μηδʼ ἀπείρατον καλῶν Pi. O. 11(10).18; ἀλλοδαπῶν οὐκ ἀ. δόμοι not unvisited by . ., Id. N. 1.23; ἀ. πολεμίας σάλπιγγος that never heard an enemyʼs bugle, Demad. 12: abs., inexperienced, opp. εὖ εἰδώς, Od. 2.170, cf. Pi. O. 8.61. Adv. ἀπειράτως, ἔχειν τινός Paus. 10.7.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., untried, unattempted, οὐ μὰν ἔτι δηρὸν ἀ. πόνος ἔσται . . ἤτʼ ἀλκῆς ἤτε φόβοιο Il. 17.41 (where however Nicanor took it in signf. I.2); ἔστω μηδὲν ἀ. Hdt. 7.9.γʹ; οὐδὲν ἦν ἀπείρατον τούτοις κατʼ ἐμοῦ D. 18.249, cf. J. BJ 7.8.1, Luc. Tox. 3.

data.quote: οὐ μὰν ἔτι δηρὸν ἀ. πόνος ἔσται . . ἤτʼ ἀλκῆς ἤτε φόβοιο
οὐδὲν ἦν ἀπείρατον τούτοις κατʼ ἐμοῦ

definition: ἀπειρία (A), ἡ, ( ἄπειρος A) opp. ἐμπειρία,

children.definition: want of skill, inexperience, ignorance, Hp. Lex 4, Th. 1.80; ἐμπειρία τε τῆς ἀπειρίας κρατεῖ E. Fr. 619; ἡ μὲν ἐμπειρία τέχνην ἐποίησεν ἡ δʼ ἀπειρία τύχην Polus ap. Arist. Metaph. 981a5; ὑπὸ ἀπειρίας Pl. Tht. 167b; διʼ ἀπειρίαν Id. Grg. 518d.

data.quote: ἡ μὲν ἐμπειρία τέχνην ἐποίησεν ἡ δʼ ἀπειρία τύχην

children.definition: τοῦ θανεῖν E. Fr. 816.10; ἀ. μέθης want of skill to carry it discreetly, Antipho 4.3.2; ἀ. ἔργου And. 3.2; μουσικῆς ἀπειρίᾳ Philetaer. 18; διʼ ἀπειρίαν τοῦ ἐρωτᾶν καὶ ἀποκρίνεσθαι Pl. R. 487b; ἀπειρείῃσι νόοιο (sic) Epigr.Gr. 1078.5 ( Adana).

data.quote: διʼ ἀπειρίαν τοῦ ἐρωτᾶν καὶ ἀποκρίνεσθαι

children.definition: infinity, infinitude, τὴν τῶν ὁμοιομερῶν ἀ. Anaxag. ap. Arist. Metaph. 988a28; opp. πέρας, Pl. Phlb. 16c; ἡ ἀ. καὶ ὁ αἰών Metrod. 37, cf. Phld. D. 3.11; ἀ. χρόνου Pl. Lg. 676a; ἀ. τῶν κόσμων Epicur. Ep. 1p.9U.; τῶν ἀτόμων Dam. Pr. 98; τῶν ἀριθμῶν Ph. 1.10.
eternity, Arist. Cael. 279a26.
Od. 10.195, Hes. Th. 109; boundless, immense, νῆσος D.P. 4; γαῖα Orph. Fr. 91, al.: neut. pl. as Adv., ἀπείριτα δηριόωντες Timo 12 [786].
keeping out, Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 23.18.
without experience of life, Hierocl. p.55 A.
unwedded, νύμφα Eub. 35; of Athene, Nonn. D. 47.416, Cat.Cod.Astr. 7.227.
infinitely generative, δύναμις Dam. Pr. 98, 99.
Dam. Pr.272.
with an infinite number of angles, Theol.Ar. 1.
ignorant of tears, A. Supp. 71.
director of the infinite, PMag.Par. 1.1354 (pl.).
unbedewed, parched, E. El. 735 (lyr.).

of infinite potentiality, ἡ τῆς ψυχῆς φύσις Porph. Sent. 37, cf. Procl. Inst. 84, Id. in Prm. p.642 S., Dam. Pr. 117, al., Simp. in Ph. 608.36:— Subst. ἀπειρο-δῠναμία, ἡ, infinite potentiality, Procl. in Prm. p.873 S., Simp. in Ph. 1329.10.
resembling the infinite, Procl. Inst. 159, Dam. Pr. 210, Simp. in Ph. 528.13.
unused to the sea, Philostr.Jun. Im. 12.
without experience of evil: τὸ ἀ. unsuspiciousness, Th. 5.105.

children.label: II
children.definition: unused to evil or misery, E. Alc. 927.
lack taste, Aeschin. Ep. 10.1.

ignorance of the beautiful, want of taste, ἀμουσία καὶ ἀ. Pl. R. 403c; ὑπʼ ἀπειροκαλίας ib. 405b; ἀ. περὶ χρήματα vulgar extravagance, Arist. EN 1107b19; of literary style, D.H. Dem. 23: in pl., vulgarities, X. Cyr. 1.2.3.

ignorant of the beautiful, tasteless, vulgar, ἀ. καὶ ἀπαίδευτος Pl. Lg. 775b, cf. D.H. Pomp. 2, etc.; περὶ λόγους ἀ. Plu. Aud. 2.44d; ἀ. ἡγοῦμαι πάντων μεμνῆσθαι Ael. Tact. 1.2; τὸ ἀ., = ἀπειροκαλία, X. Mem. 3.10.5. Adv. -λως Pl. Phdr. 244c, etc.; foolishly, rashly, Onos. 11.4.
Ar. Th. 119; Φοίβη Orac. ap. Eus. PE 4.23.
interminable argument, S.E. P. 2.151 (pl.), prob. l. in Phld. Rh. 1.7S.
unused to battle, untried in war, Pi. N. 4.30.
immensely large, S.E. P. 3.44; διαστήματα Ph. 1.605, cf. Cleom. 2.1: metaph., χωρίον ἐπιστήμης Ph. 1.627.
infinitely greater, v.l. for ἀπείρῳ μείζων, Cleom. 2.1.
unused to toil, Κυθερείη Nonn. D. 24.294.
infinitely more, many thousand-fold, Phlp. in Mete. 17.15, Eust. 89.8.
infinitely great or numerous, Eust. 562.37, Sch. Nic. Th. 310:— Subst. ἀπειρο-πλήθεια or ἀπειρο-πληθία, ἡ, Eust. 202.43.
ignorant of navigation, Luc. Dom. 12.
producing infinitude, δυνάμεις Procl. in Prm. p.567S., cf. p.602S., Dam. Pr. 91 bis.
inexperienced in war, App. Mith. 51; τὸ ἀ. D.H. 8.37. Adv. -μως App. BC 2.71.
unused to toil, Κυθερείη Nonn. D. 24.276.

without trial or experience of a thing, unused to, unacquainted with, ἄθλων Thgn. 1013; καλῶν Pi. I. 8(7).70; κακότητος Emp. 112.3; τυράννων Hdt. 5.92.αʹ; τῆς ναυτικῆς Id. 8.1; Περσέων Id. 9.58, cf. 46; πόνων, νόσων, A. Ch. 371, Fr. 350.2; γνώμης S. Ant. 1250; δικῶν Antipho 1.1; πολέμων Th. 1.141; τοῦ μεγέθους τῆς νήσου Id. 6.1; γραμμάτων Pl. Ap. 26d; ἀνδρῶν ἀγαθῶν Lys. 2.27; of a woman, ἄ. ἄλλων ἀνδρῶν not having known other men (beside her husband), Hdt. 2.111; ἄ. λέχους E. Med. 672: abs. in same sense, ib. 1091 (lyr.).

inexperienced, ignorant, Pi. I. 8(7).48, etc.; γλυκὺ δʼ ἀπείροισι πόλεμος Id. Fr. 110; δίδασκʼ ἄπειρον A. Ch. 118. Adv. ἀπείρως, ἔχειν τῶν νόμων Hdt. 2.45; πρός τι X. Mem. 2.6.29; περί τινος Isoc. 5.19: Comp. ἀπειρότερον, παρεσκευασμένοι Th. 1.49; -οτέρως Isoc. 12.37, Arist. Resp. 470b9.

boundless, infinite, σκότος Pi. Fr. 130.8; τὸν ὑψοῦ τόνδʼ ἄ. αἰθέρα E. Fr. 941; ἤπειρον εἰς ἄ. ib. 998; of number, countless, πλῆθος Hdt. 1.204; ἀριθμὸς ἄ. πλήθει Pl. Prm. 144a; ἄ. τὸ πλῆθος Id. R. 525a, al.; εἰς ἄ. τὴν ἀδικίαν αὐξάνειν Id. Lg. 910b; χρόνος ἄ. OGI 383.113 (i B.C.): Comp. -ότερος Dam. Pr. 50, Phlp. in Mete. 17.15; τὸ ἄ. the Infinite, as a first principle, Arist. Ph. 203a3, etc.; esp. in the system of Anaximander, D.L. 2.1, etc.; but τὰ ἄπειρα individuals, opp. τὰ εἴδη, Arist. Top. 109b14, cf. Metaph. 999a27, al.; ἄπειρος, opp. πεπερασμένος, Ph. 202b31; εἰς ἄ. ἰέναι, προϊέναι, ἥκειν, etc., APo. 81b33, Ph. 209a25, EN 1113a2, etc.; [ γῆ] ἐπʼ ἄπειρον ἐρριζωμένη Str. 1.1.20; also, indefinite, ὕλη Stoic. 2.86.
in which one is entangled past escape, i.e. without outlet, ἀμφίβληστρον A. Ag. 1382; χιτών S. Fr. 526; ὕφασμα E. Or. 25.
endless, i.e. circular, ἀ. δακτύλιος a simple hoop-ring, = ἄλιθος ( Poll. 7.179), Arist. Ph. 207a2; cf. ἀπείρων (B) 1.3. Adv. -ρως, θρυφθῆναι into an infinite number of fragments, Id. Pr. 899b16.
E. Hipp. 196, Med. 1094, Cleanth. 1.33.
limitless, of God, Corp.Herm. 18.12.
Eus. PE 4.23.
not having brought forth, παρθενίη AP 6.10 (Antip. Sid.).
of infinite duration, διαμονή Phld. D. 3 Fr. 24.
multiply to infinity, Dam. Pr. 25 bis ( Pass.).
knowing not the pains of child-birth, Nonn. D. 16.152.
without experience, ignorant, S. OT 1088 (lyr.), Fr. 266.

definition: ἀπείρων (B), ον, gen. ονος, ( πεῖραρ, πέρας) Ep. form of ἄπειρος (B),

children.definition: boundless, endless, ἐπʼ ἀπείρονα γαῖαν Od. 1.98, Hes. Th. 187; Ἑλλήσποντος ἀ. Il. 24.545; δῆμος ἀ. a countless people, ib. 776; ὕπνος ἀ. seeming endless, i.e. profound sleep, Od. 7.286; ἀπείρονα γῆς βάθη Emp. 39, cf. 28; τῶν ἀλιθίων ἀ. γενέθλα Simon. 5.6; δόξα Pi. P. 2.64; κύκλος a vast concourse, B. 8.30.
without end or escape, δεσμοὶ ἀπείρονες Od. 8.340.
Att., = ἄπειρος (B) 3, having no end, circular, δακτύλιος ἀ. Ar. Fr. 250, cf. IG 2.709.5, 11(2).161 B 81 ( Delos, iii B. C.); ἐν λόχῳ ἀπείρονι, of persons standing in a circle, A. Fr. 379.
not to be persuaded, πρὸς δωροδοκίαν Hyp. Dem. Fr. 4.
away out of, v.l. in h.Ap. 110.
turn out, come to be, ὥσπερ τι τέρας Eust. 1062.61.
turn out, Sch. A. Pr. 84.
cease living, Hsch.
expulsion, Sch. Dosiad. Ara
great-great-grandchild, Simon. 112.3.
expect anxiously, await eagerly, σωτῆρα Ep.Phil. 3.20; θάνατον Alciphr. 3.7; τὸ μέλλον Hld. 2.35, cf. S.E. M. 2.73.

children.label: II
children.definition: misunderstand, misinterpret, Hipparch. 1.6.11, al.

children.label: b
children.definition: understand a word from the context, A.D. Conj. 226.20.
relet (after cancelling a contract), CIG 2266 ( Delos); simply, contract for, στήλην Michel 468.72 ( Iasus); ὅπως στήλη κατασκευασθῇ ib. 481.31 ( Priene).
E. Hec. 749.
contract, -σιν ποιῆσαι Milet 6.36 ( -έγδ- lapis), cf. PPetr. 2p.34; performance of work contracted for, ἐν τῇ ἀ. τῶν ἔργων PSI 4.352.5 (iii B. C.).
strip off oneself: metaph., put off, τὸν παλαιὸν ἄνθρωπον Ep.Col. 3.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: strip off for oneself, despoil, τινά ib. 2.15.
putting off (like clothes), Ep.Col. 2.11.
thence, Olymp. in Mete. 119.28 (better divisim).
forget entirely, τινος, found only in aor. 2 imper., ἀπεκλελάθεσθε δὲ θάμβευς Od. 24.394.
pick out and reject, Dsc. 1.7, Antip.Stoic. 3.252, Arr. Epict. 4.7.40.
fit for rejection, ἀπαξία Stoic. 3.28, cf. Antip. ib. 251.
rejection, opp. ἐκλογή, Diog.Bab.Stoic. 3.219, cf. S.E. M. 11.133: pl., Ph. Fr. 8H.

definition: ἀπεκλούομαι, v.l. for ἐκλ. in Dsc. 1.99.

children.definition: relax, weaken, Alex.Aphr. Fr. 1.120 (dub.).
throw away, PMag.Par. 1.59.
spreading out, LXX Jb. 36.29, Gal. 19.447; f.l. for ἐπέκτασις in Ph. Bel. 72.28:—also ἀπέκ-τανσις, Anon. in Rh. 146.1.
draw off, τῆς θερμασίας ἐν τοῖς ἀγγείοις ἀπεκταθείσης Gal. 17(1).114.

data.quote: τῆς θερμασίας ἐν τοῖς ἀγγείοις ἀπεκταθείσης

children.definition: uncombed: hence, unshorn, of sheep less than a year old, μὴ σφάττειν πρόβατον ἄ. ἢ ἄτοκον Androt. 41, cf. Philoch. 64.

data.quote: μὴ σφάττειν πρόβατον ἄ. ἢ ἄτοκον

children.definition: Hsch.
driving away, POxy. 1252r6 (iii A. D.), PLond. 2.403.12 (iv A.D.).
retirement of cavalry, Arr. Tact. 16.10 (pl.).
unapproachable, dub. in Simon. 29.
to be driven away, Philostr. VA 6.16.
driver away, cattle-lifter, Ptol. Tetr. 180, Just. Nov. 22.15.1.

definition: ἀπελαύνω, also ἀπέλα as imper. from pres. ἀπελάω, X. Cyr. 8.3.32; Dor. impf. ἀπήλαον vulg. in Ar. Lys. 1001 (but prob. ἀπήλααν, = ἀπήλασαν, should be read): fut. -ελάσω LXX Ez. 34.12; Att. -ελῶ (also in Hdt. 8.102): pf. -ελήλακα X. Cyr. 4.2.10:— Pass., aor. -ηλάθην [ᾰ]: pf. part. ἀπεληλαμένος Artem. 4 Prooem.:— Med., aor. -ηλασάμην AP 7.303 (Antip. Sid.):—

children.definition: drive away, expel from a place, τινὰ δόμων, πόλεως, etc., E. Alc. 553, etc.; ἀπὸ τόπου X. Cyr. 3.2.16; ἀ. τινά drive away, banish him, S. OC 93, 1356, etc.; expel (from a society), X. An. 3.1.32; exclude, keep at a distance, Ar. Eq. 58; remove, φόβον τινί X. Cyr. 4.2.10; exclude from a thing, Id. HG 3.2.31:— Med., ἀ. τί τινος ward off, avert from him, AP l.c.

ἀ. στρατιήν lead away an army, Hdt. 4.92: freq. abs. like ἀπάγω, march, depart, ἐς τὰς Σάρδις Id. 1.77, cf. 5.25, etc.; πυρώσας τὰς Ἀθήνας ἀπελᾷς Id. 8.102; also (sc. ἵππον) ride away, X. Smp. 9.7, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be driven away, ἐνθεῦτεν Hdt. 5.94; ἐντεῦθεν εἰς ἄλλον τόπον X. Cyr. 1.2.3; γῆς ἐμῆς πρός τινος S. OC 599; to be excluded from a thing, ἁπάσης [τῆς στρατιῆς] from the command, Hdt. 7.161, cf. X. Cyr. 1.2.15; τῆς πολιτείας Lys. 18.5; τῶν ἀρχῶν Pl. R. 564d; ἀ. τῆς φροντίδος to be far from, Hdt. 7.205; ἐς πατέρʼ ἀπηλάθην τύχης was barred from [good] fortune on my fatherʼs side, E. HF 63; ἀ. φιλίας Them. Or. 7.90c.
one who refutes, Oenom. ap. Eus. PE 6.7.
refutation, exposure, Act. Ap. 19.27.

convict, expose, refute, Antipho 5.19; τινά τινος Ph. 1.205; εὐχέρειαν ἑαυτοῦ ib. 193; τὴν διάνοιαν, εἰ . . M.Ant. 8.36: abs., procure a conviction, CIG 4325k ( Olympus); vindicate, ἀ. τὸν τόκον γνήσιον Jul. Or. 2.81d:— Pass., to be convicted, πείσας of having persuaded, Antipho 5.21.
immeasurable, ἶνʼ ἀπέλεθρον ἔχοντας Il. 5.245, cf. Od. 9.538; ἀπέλεθρον ἀνέδραμε sprang back immeasurably, Il. 11.354; countless, Nonn. D. 19.330.
unhewn, unwrought, LXX 3 Ki. 6.1, al.: metaph., φωνή Crantor ap. D.L. 4.27.
enfranchisement of a slave, Aeschin. 3.41, Man. 4.600.

children.label: II
children.definition: status of a freedman, Poll. 3.83.
to be free, act freely, -άζουσα κίνησις Ph. 1.419, cf. 277; in bad sense, ὑπʼ αὐθαδείας Id. 2.31.
in the condition of a freedman, ἄνθρωπος Plu. Sull. 1, Cic. 7; γυνή PGnom. 83 (ii A.D.); γένος Str. 8.6.23.

children.label: II
children.definition: relating to freedmen, νόμοι D. ap. Poll. 3.83.
manumission, IG 9(1).109 ( Elatea).

definition: ἀπελευθερίωσις, εως, ἡ, = foreg. [ἀπελευθερισμός], IG 9(1).190 ( Phocis).

children.definition: freedman, Str. 5.3.7 (v.l. ἀπελευθέρων).

restored to freedom, S. Ichn. 193; emancipated slave, freedman, Pl. Lg. 930d; ἀ. τινος Lys. 7.10; opp. δοῦλος and μέτοικος, X. Ath. 1.10, Arist. Pol. 1278a2; ἀ. ἀφιέναι τινά Aeschin. 3.41: metaph., ἀ. κυρίου 1 Ep.Cor. 7.22:—fem. ἀπελευθέρα, Ion. ἀπελευθέρη, ἡ, Hp. Epid. 5.75, Is. 6.19, D. 59.18, Men. 436.
emancipate a slave, Pl. Lg. 915asq., POxy. 722.18 (i A.D.):— Pass., Pl. Lg. 915b; αἱρεῖται ἐπίτροπον ὁ ἀπελευθερούμενος Arist. Rh. 1408b25.
emancipation, δούλων D. 17.15, cf. Plu. Publ. 7, PGnom. 60 (ii A. D.) , BGU 96.10 (iii A.D.).
concerning manumission, νόμοι SIG 1210 ( Calymna); δίκαια SIG 2868.9 (ibid.).
dropping out, of a letter, Eust. 191.13.
unroll, unwind, ἀγαθίδα Aen.Tact. 18.15:— Pass. in Ion. form ἀπειλισσομένης Hero Aut. 2.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: roll up, aor. 1 ἀπείλιξαν D.C. 46.36.
Lacon. for ἐκκλησιάζω, Plu. Lyc. 6.— Hsch. writes ἀπελάζειν, but quotes ἀπέλλαι· σηκοί, ἐκκλησίαι; ἐν ταῖς μεγάλαις ἀπέλλαις IG 5(1).1144.21, 1146.41 ( Gythium, i B.C.).

data.quote: σηκοί, ἐκκλησίαι; ἐν ταῖς μεγάλαις ἀπέλλαις

children.definition: sacrifice at meeting of a φρατρία, Michel 995 A 4 (Delph.).

definition: Ἀπελλαῖος, ὁ, sc. μήν, name of a month in various Dorian states, as Delphi, GDI 1721, al.; Epidaurus, IG 4.925.1, etc.:—also Ἀπελλαιών, ῶνος, ὁ, at Tenos, ib. 12(5).872.15.
ἀπελλακάς ἱερῶν κοινωνούς, Hsch. ἀπέλλειν· ἀποκλείειν, Id.

children.definition: Dor. form of Ἀπόλλων, IG 5(1).145 ( Amyclae), GDI 5075 (Cret.), etc.; cf. Ἀπείλων Inscr.Cypr. 140H.
wound not skinned over, Call. Fr. 343.

despair of, τῆς πόλεως τὴν σωτηρίαν Hyp. Ath. 35; τὸ μέλλον Epicur. Ep. 3p.62U.; πράξεις Plb. 1.19.12, etc.:— Pass., to be given up in despair, τὰ πράγματα Id. 10.6.10; of persons, to be despaired of, οἱ ἀπηλπισμένοι LXX Is. 29.19, cf. Plb. 9.5.2; ὑπὸ τῶν ἰατρῶν D.S. 1.25, D.L. 8.69, cf. IG 14.966 ( ἀφηλπ-).
ἀ. τινός despair of, Plb. 1.55.2, al.; οὐκ ἀ. τινός to be confident of, Gal. 8.365; περὶ τῆς νίκης D.S. 2.25.
hope that a thing will not happen, D.L. 1.59.

children.label: II
children.definition: drive to despair, τινά AP 11.114 ( Nicarch.).

children.label: III
children.definition: hope to receive back, μηδὲν (v.l. μηδένα) ἀπελπίζοντες Ev.Luc. 6.35 (dub.).
hopelessness, despair, Plb. 30.32.11.
one must despair, Posidon. ap. Aët. 6.20, Ph. 2.422, Orib. 14.42.3.
despair, Tz. H. 11.18 (pl.).
desperatus, Gloss.
spit up, vomit forth, Il. 14.437, Hp. Aff. 15, Opp. H. 1.560, Arist. Pr. 871a21, Ael. NA 9.66, Luc. Cont. 7, Gal. 14.163:— Pass., ἀπεμούμενα Arist. Pr. 926b26.

sell, ἀπημπόλα με λάθρα E. Ion 1371; ἀ. τι ἀντί τινος to sell for a thing, Id. Cyc. 257; τί τινος X. Smp. 8.21, cf. Herod. 7.65; ἀ. τινὰ εἰς λατρείαν Luc. Merc.Cond. 23; sell, i.e. betray, ἡ μὲν Ἄργος βαρβάροις ἀπημπόλα E. Tr. 973; ἀ. ψυχάς barter your lives, Id. Ph. 1228; τίς ὢν σὺ τήνδʼ ἀπεμπολᾷς χθονός; dost thou smuggle her out of the country? Id. IT 1360; ἀ. νόμους τοῖς δεομένοις Procop. Pers. 1.24:— Pass., ἀπεμπολώμενοι ‘bought and sold’, Ar. Ach. 374.— An Ion. form ἀπεμπολέω is found in D.H. 7.63, (Max.Tyr. 33.8, Luc. Tox. 28.
sale, Hsch.; also, = sq., Id.
riddance, ἀκαθαρσίας Hp. Decent. 5.
seller, dealer, Lyc. 341.

to be incongruous, inconsistent, Plb. 6.47.10, A.D. Synt. 324.23; ἀπεμφαῖνον incongruous, Stoic. 2.51, Str. 8.3.17, Jul. Or. 7.217c, Dam. Pr. 229; to be absurd, A.D. Synt. 47.8, S.E. P. 3.112; -οντες θρῆνοι discordant, Marin. Procl. 33; of verses faulty in metre, Aristid.Quint. 1.28; τοῦ ἀπεμφαίνοντος ὀνόματος of a word similar in meaning but different in form (?), Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.74:— Pass., to be distinguished, A.D. Pron. 46.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: display, ἀλαζονείαν . . διὰ τῶν προσώπων Malch. p.397 D.
incongruity, absurdity, Str. 10.2.12; contradiction, εἰς -σιν περικλείεσθαι S.E. M. 11.162.
unlike, Thphr. HP 8.8.5.
opposite, c. gen., Plb. 1.86.3, LXX Ge. 21.16, PGrenf. 1.21.14 (ii B.C.), IG 2.489b17, Ev.Matt. 27.61; before, in the presence of, ἀ. ὑμῶν Act.Ap. 3.16; against, c. gen., LXX Si. 37.4, Act.Ap. 17.7.
εἰς τὸν ἀ. βουνόν Inscr.Prien. 37.168.
Hsch.

definition: ἀπεναντίον, Adv. = foreg., ἡ ἀ. (sc. χώρα) the

children.definition: opposite shore, ἐς τὴν ἀ. Hdt. 7.55, cf. Str. 7.6.2, D.S. 19.38: c. dat., Gal. UP 1.9: c. gen., from before, LXX Ca. 6.4: Geom., of angles, ἡ ἀ. γωνία the opposite angle, Euc. 1.16, al.; of sides of a figure, Archim. Aequil. 2.1, hence,

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj. ἀπεναντίος, ον, Procop. Aed. 1.11. Adv. -ίως v.l. in Luc. Nigr. 36.
strip of arms, c. dupl. acc., τοὺς ἐνάριζον ἀπʼ ἔντεα Il. 12.195, 15.343.

definition: ἀπενάσσατο, 3 sg. aor. 1 Med. of ἀποναίω.

children.definition: become mute, Thd. Da. 4.16.
free from grief, A. Pr. 956; νεβρός B. 12.87; θυμός Fr. 7.2, cf. Plu. Flam. 11, Tryph. 599.

definition: ἀπένθητος, ον, = foreg., A. Ag. 895, Eu. 912.

children.definition: Pass., unlamented, LXX 2 Ma. 5.10, Epigr.Gr. 436 ( Berytus).
banishment for a term of years, τριετεῖς ἀ. Pl. Lg. 868e (v.l. -ισις).
go into banishment for a term of years, X. Mem. 1.3.13, Nic.Dam. p.18 D., Philostr. VA 1.13; ἐνιαυτοὺς τρεῖς ἀ. Pl. Lg. 868d.

children.label: II
children.definition: outlive the year after a thing, D.C. 46.49.
AB 421, Hsch.

definition: ἀπεννέπω, Trag. word, also ἀπενέπω (only lyr. E. IA 552),

children.definition: forbid: abs., A. Th. 1058, E. Ph. 1657; ἀ. τι forbid it, S. OC 209; more freq. c. acc. et inf., ἀ. τινὰ ποιεῖν E. Med. 813, Heracl. 556; ἀ. τινὰ μὴ ποιεῖν Id. Ion 1282, HF 1295; ἀ. τινὰ θαλάμων order him from the chamber, Id. IA 552 (lyr.).
deprecate, ἀνδροκμῆτας δʼ . . ἀπεννέπω τύχας A. Eu. 957 (lyr.).
put back in its place, of the prolapsed uterus, Sor. 2.88.
at this point, Plb. 39.1.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: henceforth, POxy. 93.16 (iv A.D.), Eustr. in EN 339.16.
take out, remove, τί τινος E. IT 1278 (tm.).
hang out, τι ἐκ τόπου Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. κνυζόμενον.
narrate, cj. in X.Eph. 5.9.10.
purge, prob. in Timocl. 39; also aor. Med. ἀπεξινησάμην (from -αω) Hsch.
equalize, Steph. in Int. 16.33.
drive out, expel, AB 1454.

to be unlike, differ from, c. gen., Plu. Per. 8, Arr. Ind. 6.8, Lib. Or. 59.157:—in early writers found only in part. ἀπεοικώς, Att. ἀπεικώς, υῖα, ός, unreasonable, unnatural, οὐκ ἀπεικός (v.l. ἀπεοικός) Hp. VM 4, Antipho 2.2.5; οὐκ ἀπεικός not unlikely, Plb. 2.62.8, cf. Philostr. VA 3.34; ἀπεοικὼς πρὸς τὰ καλά unfitted, indisposed for noble deeds, Plb. 6.26.12: c. dat., unlike, Heph. 15.4. Adv. ἀπεοικότως unreasonably, Th. 6.55; but οὐκ ἀπεικότως Th. 1.73, 2.8, 8.68, cf. Porph. Abst. 1.46; D.Chr. has ἀπεοικότως 12.35, ἀπεικότως 31.116.
not ripened, unripe, Thphr. CP 2.8.4, AP 9.561 ( Phil.), Dsc. 5.34; cf. ἀπεπαν[ό] τος· ὁ μὴ παλαιούμενος, Hsch.
hasten away, ἄλλοσε Man. 5.239.
unripe, ὀπώρα AP 9.78 ( Leon.).
unrobed, i.e. in her tunic only, of a girl, ἄπεπλος ὀρούσαισʼ ἀπὸ στρωμνᾶς Pi. N. 1.50; λευκῶν φαρέων ἄπεπλος, i.e. clad in black, E. Ph. 324 (lyr.).
suffer from indigestion, Luc. Par. 57, Plu. Sanit. 2.136d, Arr. Epict. 1.26.16, Cass. Pr. 74.
Pass., of food, to remain undigested, Gal. 6.628, Mich. in EN 56.21.

uncooked: undigested, of food, Hp. Epid. 1.4.2 [1.26.βʹ], Arist. de An. 416b5, al.; of humours, crude, unconcocted, Hp. VM 19; οὖρον Id. Acut. 42; φύματα Id. Art. 41, cf. Arist. Mete. 384a33: Comp., Id. GA 750b25: Sup., ib. 745b20. Adv. -τως Hp. Epid. 1.5.
Arist. Mete. 371a3, Plu. Am. prol. 2.495b.

children.label: II
